resources.string: What?! How dare you! Get out of my tavern this instant! Get out!!
A reward? I'll need every coin I have just to repair the damage these creatures have done! Will you help us or not?
Oh, I've noticed, all right. The thought that you're the kind of student that mage is taking in makes me ill. Have you no sense of decency?
Yes, but it isn't helping. They want us to let them leave, but they want to take Mara with them as a hostage. We can't allow that, they'll kill her!
Of course losing Mara is a bad thing! What a terrible thing to say!
Who knows how long it will be before they can help? And besides, they'll be in the same situation we are. If you can't help us, <FirstName>, who can?
I... I suppose that's true, it's not. But I don't know what to do! They're holding my cook hostage in there... if we try to get past the barricade, they'll kill her!
Please... can't you help us at all, <FirstName>? I'd hate to see Mara hurt.
Have you tried negotiating with them at all?
And this is a bad thing, yes?
Then I suppose the stories I've heard about you aren't true. I thought Drogan's apprentices were decent folk.
I don't see why you don't just go in there and kill them. You outnumber them, don't you?
People have all kinds of stupid ideas. Why should we be faulted for them?
Is there nothing you can do to help us? They're holding my cook hostage in there. If we try to break through the barricade, they'll kill her for certain!
It's not that simple. They've taken my cook hostage. If we try to get past the barricade they'll kill Mara for certain!
We can't get in there. They're holding my cook hostage... if we try to push past the barricade, they'll kill her for sure! Can you help us, <FirstName>?
Well... the kobolds are all dead. At least it's over now.
Thank the gods all this kobold business is finally over with. Serves them right for attacking the Bubbling Cauldron!
I can't believe you actually let those kobolds go... but I suppose I can respect your reasons for doing so, <FirstName>.
It's too bad Mara had to die. I really wish things had turned out differently. It'll be strange to open the tavern again without her.
I wonder if we'll ever find out what happened to Mara? I... really don't agree with your decision, <FirstName>, but I suppose someone had to make it. Best not to dwell on it.
Of course. Good luck to you, <FirstName>.
That... that's a cruel thing to say. You let them go, and... but I... I suppose you had your reasons. Just... go on and leave me be.
I... I see. Thank you for telling me, <FirstName>. At least we know, now.
At any rate, Mara is alive and that's what's important. Now all I have to do is clean this mess up and try to get things back to normal.
It was a good thing you came by, at any rate, or Mara would have been killed for sure. Here... it's not much, I know, but I hope 50 gold will do as a reward.
I... well, I... the tavern needs to be rebuilt! It... no, no, you're right. Here... 100 gold. It's all I have. You do deserve it.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I... I can't, <FirstName>, as much as I think you deserve it. I need to rebuild this place. Here... take the coin and my thanks. That's all I can do.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Well... even though I've got to scrape together enough to rebuild this place, you're right. Here... take 100 gold and my thanks.
Then take the coin with my thanks. You're a credit to this town, <FirstName>.
Hmm. Mara uses those, I think... perhaps you should ask her if she has any. I'm certain she'd be more than happy to give them to you.
But berries are no reward... here, take the coin with my thanks. You're a credit to this town, <FirstName>.
Truly? You're a kind <man/woman>, <FirstName>. Drogan would be proud of you, I'm sure.
Well, at least all this kobold business is finally over with. That was a good trick you pulled, <FirstName>, luring them out like that. Risky, though.
I can't believe you simply let the kobolds run off with Mara like that, <FirstName>. That was your answer? Bah!
Sorry. The Bubbling Cauldron won't be open again until all this mess is finally cleaned up. Come back another time.
Hah! Good job, getting these vermin out of the kitchen! Now, shall we get rid of them once and for all?
Yip! We kobolds surrender! We leave, you say! You no harm, you say!
Don't be stupid, you little evil beast! If we let you go, you'll just do the same somewhere else! You deserve to die, right, <FirstName>?
Let's get this over with! Kill them all!!
Ahhhh, fine. Have it your way, <FirstName>. I tell you that they'll just be back to torment us again!
Go on then, you little beasts. Get out of my tavern! Go!!
What are you talking about, <FirstName>? These are evil creatures! There's no reasoning with them!
For how long? Forever? These are not people who will regret their ways and can be good citizens again! These are monsters, <FirstName>!
Well, yes... but that's because they had no choice! They're monsters! As soon as we let them go, they'll be off to kill again!
So we should just let them go? Let them suffer nothing for what they've done? Because that's the only option, <FirstName>.
Then we kill them. There's no other way. Let's get this over with! Kill them all!!
Do you need some help?
Forget it. You're on your own.
I'll see what I can do.
Tell me why I should bother helping you.
Fine, fine, I'll see what I can do.
That doesn't sound like a reason. I guess I'll be leaving.
Come to think of it, maybe I should help the kobolds...
Some kind of reward would be an incentive, you know.
If you haven't noticed, Drogan's not here.
Have you tried talking with them?
And losing your cook is a bad thing?
Shouldn't the town guard handle this?
So? I don't see this as my problem.
Why don't you finish them off, then?
Hmmm. I need an herb that might be in your kitchen.
I should go.
Get over it. Mara's dead. I found the body.
I found Mara's body just outside of town. They killed her... I'm sorry.
50 gold?! Do better than that, or kobolds will be the least of your problems!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I'm sure you can do better than that, Lodar.
50 gold would be fine, thanks.
Actually, all I really need is some Helmthorn berries.
No reward is necessary. I was happy to help.
Sounds good to me!
No, I won't break my word to them. Let them go.
That's a little bloodthirsty of you, isn't it?
So then we're no better than they are?
I suppose you're correct. Do what you wish, then.
They're helpless, now. I won't permit a slaughter just to ease your anger.
They have broken the law. We should imprison them.
I convinced them to surrender, didn't I? And they let Mara live?
That's my point. There should be a difference between us and monsters.
Do what must be done, then. I'll not take part.
No, I suppose they should pay for what they've done...
Then yes, we let them go.
We'll teach you to attack us!
You won't get far!
Damn you little monsters! Come out and fight!
Hiding behind a hostage? You little cowards!
Are you going to help us free Mara? If so, you should probably talk to Lodar.
I don't understand why these kobolds attacked Hilltop to begin with. What could they hope to gain?
You just let them walk out of here with Mara? What will happen to her?
Well done, <FirstName>! You saved Mara!
Mara died, after all that. Well... I suppose you did your best, <FirstName>.
Leave me be. Finally got some peace here, now. I just hope they open the tavern soon... I need a drink.
Best be careful, there, youngster. As ye can see, the tavern's had a bit of a problem with kobolds.
Yup. Off ye go there, youngster.
What? I hope ye're joking.
No it ain't, now git. Bloody kids these days could give an old man a heart condition.
Hmph. Here, then. Take it, for what it's worth. I'm going back out there... it'd be less ironic to be robbed by kobolds.
Ye got that right. Now run along and bother someone younger, ye little vagrant.
Kobolds started a fight they couldn't finish. Barricaded themselves in the kitchen, I think, an' got themselves a hostage.
Ye got that right. Can't remember the last time them little kobolds got so brave. They like to steal, usually, but not fight.
Nasty, sneaky buggers. Probably from up in the Nether Mountains, I'd wager. You go out to Blumberg, you'll find good paths that lead up there.
Ye're asking me? Huh. Maybe they got driven out of their caves by somethin' bigger, or maybe they got told to attack. I don't know.
Huh. Maybe so. You <race> folk looks young, an' that's all I have to say about that.
Thanks for the information.
I suppose with everyone so distracted, robbing you will be easy.
Yes, I am. Ha ha! Funny, isn't it?
Not at all. I could use a few extra coins.
Oh, forget it. You probably don't have anything worth taking.
What's going on here, anyhow?
The whole town's been attacked, it seems.
Do you know anything else about kobolds?
Why do you think the kobolds attacked?
Youngster? I'm probably older than you are.
Go and speak to the boss, Nathan. I got chores to do.
Ah, one of Drogan's students! Always nice to see your young face in here. Now, which one are you again?
I am kidding, <FirstName>! Do not get such a sour face; I have not forgotten you. I am not so old as all that. Now, are you here to buy something, or just for a visit?
Do be careful out there. I have seen dark times before, and I think they are back again.
I am always willing to visit with a friendly customer. What would you like to know?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start>A bloody tax already? Why that... wait a minute. There has been no time for any decisions about that. You just made that up!
Ha, ha, ha! Oh my, that was a good one, <FirstName>. You really had me going there for a minute. What a funny <boy/girl> you are. Now was there anything else?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> A bloody tax already? Why I ought to go over to the hall and wring Shuttlescombe's neck! No good mayor, always trying to find new taxes!
Well, he is not getting any from me. I paid my defense tax when I paid my regular tax, and you can tell Shuttlescombe that I said so! Ah, that makes me so mad!
Well, it is not your fault, <FirstName>. I will not blame you, but next time I see the mayor, he'll be hearing my voice alright. What else can I do for you?
Ha! One ran in here, and got its brains dashed out by my hammer and then I threw the corpse outside. That was the last I saw of any kobolds.
I must have missed the main body of kobolds as I worked the forge. I hunted around, but they were gone. I guess the one that came in must have been a straggler.
Is there anything else you wanted to know?
Would you like to buy something now?
Yes.
Oh, right now? Ha, ha, sorry. Bad joke. Some people think I have an odd sense of humor. What do you think, <FirstName>? Am I so very strange?
Well, I am not so very good at serious, my friend. Humor is a wonderful shield that is more difficult to penetrate than the thickest armor.
Ha! I love your sense of humor, <FirstName>! I could stand here all day and swap jokes with you.
I find that highly insulting! You are never to speak to me again.
Ha! I see you are not so easily fooled. That is good, though it does ruin the amusement.
I am joking again! You are too easy to fool, <FirstName>.
Ah, you are too sweet. I could pick you up and give you a big kiss. But I suppose that would not be appropriate.
So you want to know about me? One of the things you should know by now, <FirstName>, is that the people who come to these small frontier towns usually do so for good reason.
Most of us do not wish to talk about the past, and we spend most of our lives trying to pretend it never happened.
That is what I would prefer. Thank you. Now, is there anything else?
Let us just say that I grew up at Zhentil Keep and have only the most unpleasant memories of it. I do not wish to speak of it further.
Now, was there anything else?
Yes, that is true. He came in one day, looking so thin and hungry, I took pity on him and bought his useless old weapon for far more than it was worth.
It would have been an embarrassment to sell it, so I still have it around here somewhere.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Why that lying old... wait a minute! You are pulling my leg, yes? Of course you are! I always loved your sense of humor, <FirstName>.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Well, that lying old cretin! As if I would have any need for this lousy thing.
I suppose it was charity that drove me to buy the poor old sword in the first place. I see no reason to recoup my losses. You may have it.
Is there anything else I can do for you?
I have never seen such beautiful antlers before. Surely these are a great prize. I can feel the magical energies pulsing through them.
I could make a powerful magical helm from these, but the cost would be high. Are you interested in selling them to me, or in having them made into a magical helm?
I will pay you 100 gold for these rarities.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I am sorry, <FirstName>, but I do not have so much extra gold that I can afford to be throwing it away.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Ah, <FirstName>, you are such a charmer. I swear, you could talk Ilmater into beating a cripple! Ha!
I will offer you 150 gold, but that is the most I can pay you. Is that acceptable?
It was good doing business with you. Ah, these are beautiful.
It was good doing business with you. Ah, these are beautiful.
I told you I would pay you 150 gold, and I shall, but that is all.
It will cost you 1000 gold, but I think it will be worth your while. Have you the gold for such an enterprise?
What would you have me do? Bear the price myself?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I would like to do this for much less. I would even like to do this for 500 gold.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Good for you, young <FirstName>! I am glad to see you are starting to stiffen your spine and stand up for yourself. Now give me the 1000 gold, or quit wasting my time.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Ha! You are such a prankster, young <FirstName>! Fine, since you tell such good jokes, I will do this for 500 gold. But do not be spreading this around.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Do I look like such a fool to you? Take your wishful thinking elsewhere; I will not be moved.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Ha! You are such a prankster, young <FirstName>! Fine, since you tell such good jokes, I will do this for 500 gold. But do not be spreading this around.
Excellent, Don't worry about the gold right now...Pay me when the work is completed. I shall get right to work on this. Return in a while and I shall have it done for you.
I have offered you a discount you cannot refuse. 500 gold and I shall make this helm for you.
I do hope you mean my inventory and not my massive bosom, ha, ha! Sorry, old jokes are the best.
You have returned, <FirstName>. What can I do for you now?
Do come back now.
I do not know him. Well... I guess I do know him, but there is a part of me that wishes I did not. So, how is the mindless fool?
Dead? What do you mean? How is he dying?
You know he is a prisoner and yet you did nothing to free him? That shows a better sense of judgment than I would have given you credit for, ha, ha.
How was he captured by gnolls? I did not think he led an active enough lifestyle to be captured by anything more than a flask of cheap wine.
Well, if you are looking to me to go and rescue him, think again. I have had little to do with him and he with me. I guess if you want to rescue him, I would be alright with that.
As you will. It does not hurt my feelings any. Anything else I can do for you?
I do not think you understand the situation, <FirstName>. I really do not care for my brother. Asking me for gold to save him is foolishness.
Ah, now you have made me feel bad. Fine, I will help you out, but do not go telling others that I am getting soft. Here is 200 gold. You have disappointed me though.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Ha! Good one, <FirstName>! Give you gold to rescue that lout.
That is like saying, "Your competition's store is on fire. Give me gold and I will put the fire out." Ha! What a sense of humor you have.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Well, he is not worth much, but I guess I can pay you 200 gold. I would have thought a man of adventure would already have rescued him.
I guess your value as a person is only worth as much as your purse. Now go rescue the fool and stop wasting my time.
Well, good luck with that. I hope everything goes well. I do not wish him dead, but lightly wounded I am fine with.
Ah, <FirstName>, I should have treated him better. His father, Tyrosh, was an orc who worked for the Zhents.
My mother was a slave that got pregnant when she was given as a reward to Tyrosh. He was killed shortly after impregnating her, and then Glendir was born.
I was born a few years later, from a human father, but I never knew him any better than Glendir knew Tyrosh. I do not know why I resented Glendir so much, but we never did get along very well.
Ah well, just another poor choice to haunt my dreams. Was there anything else you needed?
Well, since you failed to be any kind of success at all, I guess you will be giving my gold back now, right?
Bah, you can take your justifications to a higher court. I once thought we were friends.
Bah, of course you did! I do not even know why I bothered to ask you. I once thought we were friends.
Well, you can buy and sell your equipment someplace else. I will have nothing more to do with you!
Hades take you, <boy/girl>.
You do not stand a chance against me, <boy/girl>.
Ha, <FirstName>, you never fail to amuse me! Keep the gold, you will have more use of it than I would. Just do not go telling anyone about this. I should have done more to help.
Of course, for you, anything.
Have you rescued that no-excuse, lout of a brother of mine yet?
Then you had better get working on it. I paid you good gold, and I have no patience for laziness.
Get out of my shop, <FirstName>. You are no longer welcome here.
So my half-brother is back. I am not sure whether I should thank you or slap you upside the head.
With his house burned down, he'll be staying with me, until he gets back on his feet. Do you have any idea how much he can eat? And he gets drunk and spills wine on my rug!
Ah, I guess I cannot blame you. I just hope he finds a job soon. Did you want anything today?
What are you talking about? Let me see that. What... who... argh, that stupid brother of mine! You should have just left him for dead, rather than pay so much.
I do not have that kind of gold, nor am I likely to see that much gold anytime soon. I fear you have been taken in, <FirstName>. You will have to hunt for recompense elsewhere.
Goodbye.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Ha! I have mentioned how much I love your sense of humor, have I not?
Ah, I guess I should not leave all of the onus on you. It's not your fault my brother is a good-for-nothing wastrel.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Ah, I understand why you would be feeling that way, <FirstName>, but you took a risk and I am afraid you cannot fault me for your losses.
Just chalk it up to experience and use your mind a little more next time. A half-orc just is not worth 2000 gold.
Actually, I would have to agree with Fiona here, I would never pay so much for Xanos. I might pay that much to see him locked in a cell... hmm.
I take exception to that! I am worth far more than a mere 2000 gold!
Ah, well, of course I did not mean you Xanos, but you are an extraordinary half-orc; a cut above all the rest.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Ah, I guess I should not leave all of the onus on you. It's not your fault my brother is a good-for-nothing wastrel.
Take these boots. They have magical properties that should help you out. That is all I can give you though. I have to get back to work now. Goodbye.
Good for you! I want you to tip the velvet, but something tells me I am out of luck.
Goodbye.
<StartAction>[Blushes]</Start> Uh... never mind. All I am saying is that my brother's rescue is already costing me a lot. Why should I reward you?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I would be willing to take a donation from you towards supporting him, but a reward? Get out of here. You are starting to annoy me.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Ah, I suppose his life ought to be worth something. Here is 100 gold, but do not be telling others about this. I do not need a soft reputation around here.
Now, was there anything else you needed?
Ah, that is a bit of a painful story. His father, Tyrosh, was an orc who worked for the Zhents. My mother was a slave that got pregnant when she was given as a reward to Tyrosh.
He was killed shortly after impregnating her, and then Glendir was born. I was born a few years later, from a human father, but I never knew him any better than Glendir knew Tyrosh.
I do not know why I resented Glendir so much, but we never did get along very well. But enough painful memories. Anything else you would like?
My half-orc brother, Glendir, was captured by gnolls. I guess you didn't recognize him, but you set him free.
Please, if you're waiting for the helm, you'll have to come back later, after I have finished crafting it. Now is there something else?

Ahhh, <FirstName>. I see you are back for your helm, but you don't seem to have enough to pay for it right now. No matter, I'll hold it for you until you are able to pay. Is there something else I can do for you in the meantime?
Ahhh, here is your helm, <FirstName>. It took all of my powers of craftsmanship and hours of skill, but the effort was worth it, at least, I hope you will think so.
Neither, thanks. Goodbye.
I would like to ask you some questions.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - lie]</Start> Have you heard about the new kobold defense tax?
Did you have problems with the kobolds?
That is all my questions.
No, thanks. Goodbye.
Would you tell me about yourself?
Please stop fooling around. I was trying to be serious.
Yes, you are about the most annoying person I have ever met.
No. I think you are pretty normal.
What I meant to say, is you are fat, ugly and completely out of your mind.
Fine, then I'll just see your inventory and then I'll go.
Is this another joke?
I'm sorry.
Yes, but I like you all the same.
Fine, I didn't really want to hear it anyways.
I will respect your privacy.
Why?
What was so bad for you?
Piper said he sold you his sword.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - lie]</Start> That is not the story he tells. He says you stole it from him!
I want to buy it.
Could I have it?
I found these magical antlers. Do you know anything about them?
Neither, goodbye.
I will sell them to you.
Maybe I would like the helm, after all.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> For such powerful items, you could certainly spare more than that.
Never mind.
No, I want the helm.
I will take it.
I will take it.
I want the helm.
I changed my mind. How much will you buy them for?
That is too much.
<StartAction>[Cast Charm]</Start> You would like to do this for much less.
Never mind, goodbye.
Here is the gold.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - Intimidate]</Start> I think allowing you to live should give me a nice discount.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Couldn't you help an old friend out? I have always felt so close to you.
I will pay.
I would like to see your goods.
Goodbye.
I met a half-orc named Glendir, who claims to be your brother.
He's doing well; if you count being a prisoner of hungry gnolls as a good thing.
I imagine he will be dead soon.
He is being held by a group of gnolls.
I imagine the gnolls will devour him soon.
He is a prisoner of a group of gnolls.
I am not going to save him.
I will only rescue him if I am getting paid.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Your brother's life must be worth something to you?
I am working on it.
I have news for you. Your brother, Glendir, is dead.
Not a chance! You gambled and you lost.
No, I already spent it.
Fine, goodbye.
Then you are of no more use to me. I think I will enjoy killing you.
Of course. I am sorry, Fiona.
I would like to see your goods.
Not yet.
I have this promissory note.
Goodbye.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - Intimidate]</Start> I'll be getting something from you, if you know what is good for you!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You could give me some equipment instead of the gold.
I want a reward.
Fine. Goodbye.
What does that mean?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I deserve something for my efforts.
How is Glendir, a half-orc, your brother?
What are you talking about?
Greetings once again, my friend. Is there something I can do for you?
I greet you, friend. Come and warm yourself by my fire. It is a cold <day/night> and the road, as you can see, is more dangerous than usual.
Then I bid you farewell, <sir/madam>, and wish you the best of luck.
I would gladly break bread with you, but I am short on supplies at the moment. Still, I'm gladder for the company.
It has been a long and tedious winter's <day/night> for me.
Now... what brings a <race> <man/woman> such as yourself to these parts? You are from the village of Hilltop, I take it?
Of course. It was not my intention to pry. What would you like to ask?
Very well. It was good to meet you, friend... another time, perhaps.
I am hunting, if you must know. My quarry here is the elusive Shadow Hart.
My name is Ferran Valiantheart, ranger and arcane archer of the High Forest wood elves, at your service.
Indeed. I am one of a select few who have dedicated ourselves to the mastery of the bow... combining magic and archery into one discipline.
It is a path that is closed to your kind, I am afraid, though I mean no disrespect to the bowmanship skills of your race.
You are of elven blood... while this might not be your path, currently, perhaps it is something you might consider in the future.
You are of elven blood yourself. I have the sense that perhaps this might be a path you might follow one day, as well.
I was nearby and happened to see a group of kobolds fleeing from the direction of Hilltop. As you can see, they met with an ambush.
A group of gnolls leapt out from the forest, taking the kobolds by surprise. They exchanged words, but I could not hear clearly... I believe the gnolls were demanding something.
Regardless, it was obvious that the kobolds were not about to comply. They fought, but the gnolls had the obvious advantage.
Some of the kobolds ran towards the elven crypt, I believe, while a larger group fled north towards the mountains.
Of course. What do you wish to ask?
It... is the burial place for the elven warriors of Ascalhorn from long ago. It is a shameful tale of our people, and therefore the crypt lies forgotten.
If the kobolds did, indeed, enter within, they will not last long. Better that they had remained without and died at the hands of the gnolls.
I am surprised that the haunting voices that echo through the crypt did not drive them out immediately.
Hmm. As a matter of fact, I believe I saw a single kobold come out of the elven crypt not long ago. He seemed skittish and frightened... perhaps a messenger or lone survivor.
He headed east, strangely. I would have thought he would go north towards the mountains... east lies the human village of Blumberg. Why would he go there?
Perhaps he was confused, I cannot say. If the kobold showed his face in the human village, however, I doubt that he still lives.
They looted what corpses remained, of course, and took a group of surviving kobolds prisoner and headed east.
I am unsure. Perhaps they turned south and entered the High Forest. I am told that there are several gnoll caves there.
Why would I? Kobolds and gnolls are both evil creatures... let them slaughter each other, if that is their desire. It is too bad they did not wipe each other out.
At any rate, hunting these creatures is not why I am here. I just happened to witness the event, that is all.
There is not much to tell. These are the foothills of the Nether Mountains, and the road you are on leads eastward to the human village of Blumberg.
To the south of here lies the edge of the High Forest. A dangerous place to travel, if you are unfamiliar with it.
There are trails that lead higher into the mountains up north. The Nether Mountains are home to kobolds and orcs... best beware.
Truly? Then you are more than you seem. Those tracks belong to the elusive Shadow Hart... my quarry and the reason I am hunting in these foothills.
Indeed. It is a rare and wonderful beast, white as the snow all around us and possessing the unique ability to vanish into the winds.
I am loathe to kill such a magnificent beast, but I simply must have its horns. They are part of the only cure for an illness my wife has contracted, I'm afraid.
I thank you. I rather think it will be a long hunt, yet.
I need no help, thank you, but on the off-chance you might find and take down the beast on your own I would gladly reward you for the horns.
The Hart is a unique and lovely creature, it is true... but so is my wife, friend. Killing the Hart is a tragedy, but my wife is worth more to me than my own life.
I do not expect you to understand. This is something I must do. I must get the horns of the Shadow Hart or perish in the attempt.
He does not vanish entirely. Indeed, if you have ever seen a blink dog, the Shadow Hart moves very similarly... it teleports short distances away in order to flee.
This does not make it impossible to hunt, but it does make it very difficult. Still... I have no choice. I must have those horns or perish in the attempt.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I... no, I am sorry, but I cannot. It is a shameful tale. Perhaps another time, friend.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I... suppose it would be of no harm to tell you a little of the tale, even though you are not of elven blood yourself.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Very well... I will tell you a little of the tale, though only because you are of elven blood yourself.
That crypt belongs to the warriors of Ascalhorn, the capital and crown jewel of the ancient elven nation of Earlan.
No doubt you have never heard of such a place. It fell into ruin long ago, you see, when its rulers became jealous of the power of man.
They sought out dark arts to give them power... and in so doing destroyed themselves. This crypt... this is the last that remains of their honored dead.
Not for those who do not enter to violate its buried or steal its treasures. Few of us enter to pay respects any more... it is a past we would rather forget.
This crypt was built by my own people, you see, to honor those warriors of Ascalhorn who turned to fight against the evil of its rulers.
They were traitors to their own land, but did what needed to be done. It is the last of Ascalhorn that stands. A bitter tale, to be true.
Ah, but I would speak no more of it. Enter the crypt for yourself, if you wish to pay your respects. But be wary.
We hated what Ascalhorn's pride had turned it into. It is a past we would rather forget.
No, not this place. The lords of Ascalhorn did not build this crypt, you see.
Perhaps. It is a past that we would rather forget, however, if not the lesson it taught us.
Those... those are the horns, indeed! However did you... no, I daren't ask. This is a most fortunate day! My wife shall be cured! May I have them, friend?
But... but I must have them! I have been hunting this creature for over a year! The life of my beloved hangs in the balance... please do not deny me this!
Then... then you have forced my hand. I... I am sorry.
Oh thank you, thank you! I will never forget you for this!
I must be off. I pray I am not too late to save her... thank you for this!!
I... I am not sure I have anything of value to offer you... other than my bow. It is a magical bow, handed down in my bloodline... will you take it in exchange?
I... I have nothing else! Please! The life of my beloved is at stake, here! Have you no heart?!
Such... such greed! You will never give it to me, will you?! Then you have forced my hand!!
Then take it. The life of my beloved is worth more than any heirloom.
Ah. I was not attempting to pry, of course. Is there something I can help you with, friend?
Ah, I see. In that case you have both good and bad luck. The kobolds passed by on this very road. As you can see, however, they met an ambush.
I was nearby and watched the entire event as it occurred. I can tell you what I saw, if you wish.
What?! You would rob a fellow traveler on the road?! I've no valuables to interest your greed, rogue, so begone!
Sometimes I wonder why I leave the High Forest at all, if this is the manner of "civilized" behavior I encounter. I hope you meet justice, cretin, and soon!
<StartCheck>[Failed]</Start> I will not cower before the face of such vileness! Corellon guide my fury!!
We shall see, vile cretin!
How disappointing. A <brother/sister> of my own blood, lowered to the level of a common thief! I've no valuables to interest your greed, so begone!
I greet you, <brother/sister> of the woods. It lightens my heart to see another of our blood outside of the High Forest.
Come and warm yourself by my fire, if you wish. It is a cold <day/night> and the road, as you can well see, is more dangerous than usual.
Greetings, friend! I invite you to come up and share my campfire, if you've the time. If not, then I suggest you be cautious... creatures abound in this region today, I fear.
You can hand over your belongings -- now!
Never mind. I have more pressing business.
I'm not interested in your fire, but I have questions.
Thank you. I appreciate the hospitality.
I prefer to ask the questions here.
I should go.
Why are you here in the foothills?
Who are you?
Arcane archer?
Tell me what happened here.
I have some other questions.
Tell me about this elven crypt.
Did you see anything else?
Did you see where that one went?
What did the gnolls do after the battle?
Where do you think they were going?
You didn't intervene or chase after them?
What can you tell me about this area?
I noticed some unusual deer tracks nearby. Do you know anything of them?
Shadow Hart?
Well, good luck on that.
Perhaps I could help you find this creature.
Doesn't it seem wrong to kill one thing to save another?
How does one hunt a beast who disappears?
Are these the horns you're looking for?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Would you tell me the story behind the elven crypt?
Is it very dangerous to enter?
So the rest of the elves hated Ascalhorn?
So it's a place of dark magic?
Honored dead? Shouldn't the crypt be in better shape, then?
I have the horns of the Shadow Hart.
These were damn difficult to acquire. Forget it!
I said no! I'm keeping them.
And what kind of reward are you offering?
Alright, here. Take them and go.
Certainly. Take them and return to your wife.
That depends on the reward, really.
I can't take that from you. Here... take the horns.
What do I need your bow for? Offer something else.
A bow's a good start. What else do you have?
Ahhh, I can't stand this anymore. Take the horns, and keep your stupid bow.
Fine, fine. The bow will have to do.
Nothing else, hey? I'll just hold onto this, then.
I have the Hart's horns... and that's what counts.
A magical bow? That will do.
I am from Hilltop, yes, but my business is my own.
I'm looking for a group of kobolds that attacked Hilltop, actually.
Yes, tell me what happened.
More dangerous than you think. Hand over your belongings, now!
Fine. Forget it, then.
<StartCheck>[Intimidate]</Start> But elves make fine bows and arrows. Hand them over now!
<StartCheck>[Intimidate]</Start> I could always search your corpse and see for myself...
<StartAction>[Attack]</Start> Oh, you'll pay dearly for that mouth of yours!
<StartAction>[Growl...]</Start>
The bear eyes you with an unfriendly disposition. It seems to have great discomfort as it shuffles forward.
The bear's eyes open wide and it lets out a little whine, before you silence it forever.
After a quick inspection you notice that the bear seems to have an arrow embedded in its chest.
The bear gives a morose growl of pain as you walk away.
Just as you finish cleansing the wound, the bear licks your face with its long, rough tongue. It then shambles off into the trees contentedly.
<StartAction>[Send your mind out to touch the bear's mind.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Coup-de-grace]</Start> I will put you out of your misery, bear. It's for the best.
<StartAction>[Examine the bear]</Start>
Do nothing.
<StartAction>[Remove the arrow and cleanse the wound.]</Start>
<StartAction>[growl...]</Start>
The bear wishes it could have a safe place to live, good friends, and a nice, soft halfling to snack on.
The bear wonders if you would make a tasty snack, then decides you are not worth the trouble.
The bear remembers another humanoid creature carrying a smaller creature on its shoulder, into a cave.
The bear seems to wish it could go back to sleep for the rest of winter, unsure why it woke up in the first place.
The bear scratches at a burr in its fur, radiates a welcome to you, then relieves itself on a nearby log.
The bear sniffs at you, wondering if you have any berries or honey, then loses interest in you.
This bear radiates positive thoughts to you, as if it recognizes you as a friend.
The bear sniffs the air, then wanders off into the forest.
The bear sends thoughts of some type of battle that the bear avoided. Large hairy creatures and small lizard like creatures fought on a nearby hill. The bear left before the battle ended.
You see an image of yourself helping another bear with an arrow in its chest. The healed bear then sends thoughts to its kin, telling them to be kind to this friend of nature.
<StartAction>[Send your mind out to touch the bear's mind.]</Start>
Goodbye bear.
Have you seen any kobolds?
Do I know you?
links

Ok - you iz on.
Haha - me not called Rumgut for nothing, ya know...
Oh - me no feel so good..

<StartAction>[Singing... sort of.]</Start> Rumgut be so happy with wife who can cook... me not really care at all how she look... she maybe small, but me no have fit... when she be cooking it no smell like...
Hey... oh, what you be doin' here? You should no be in me cave. Unless you be here for me to eat? You want for me should get me wife to cook you?
Good. And you no come back, or me throw you in pot and make me wife cook you nice.
Sure, see me pretty wife in cage over in corner of cave? She be good cook. Maybe you hop in pot and me show you how good she cook.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You should no poke fun of Rumgut! Me know me voice sound like rock breaking in half. Now, you go, or me get awful mad!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> That be nice of you to say. I guess me no eat you. What you want in Rumgut's cave?
Me can try. Me memory be good, but short. What you want to know?
Me bored of talking. You go now, yes?
Little lizard guys? Them be no trouble, them be good eatin'! Me catch them by little heads and twist them around and then skin them with me big knife.
Then me wife she make good stew out of them and it taste sooo good, me just laugh and eat and drink until me fall asleep. You see more, you send them to Rumgut. That it?
Me all grown up and me be lonely and not like me own cookin' so much. Me wife be real good cook. Me know someday she grow up too and then we be good couple.
We will bash each other on heads and yell and make little ones, just like me mother and father done. Just thinkin' of it make me so happy.
Oh, she will grow up and be me size someday. There not be anyone else me size round here. She will grow, me sure.
Oh, ha, ha, ha, me call meself that, cause me like drinkin' rum so very much, it make me gut get big. When me go out huntin' little goblins and stuff for food, me like to yell chants.
"You little dumb butts, come to Rumgut's, and it be fine, cause we will dine, when you be mine!"
That scare them and them forgets to fight me. Them make mighty fine supper, especially with me wife and her good cookin'.
Ha, ha! A challenge! Me likes you a lot. We drink and see who can drink more. But you be little so me give you chance. Me drink from bottle, you drink flask. It smaller. Here we go!
You chug the mug, me chug the jug! One, two, here be to you! <StartAction>[Drinks a bottle of rum.]</Start>
Oh, you ruin me fun! You get out of me cave right now, or me squash you like... like little squashing thing.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Ha, ha, funny! You wet youself and ground. Me scare you... wait, that be you rum! Why you cheat? And why you waste me rum? Argh!
Now you either fight me or you get in cage with me wife? What it gonna be?
Me squash you now like... little squashing thing.
Maybe me make you into supper later. You get in cage.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> That be pretty good. Now we do another round.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Ha, ha, now you join me wife in cage. Maybe me make you into supper later.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> That be pretty good. Now we do another round.
Lift rum high, to the sky, now drink it down, until we drown! <StartAction>[Drinks another bottle of rum.]</Start>
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start>Me impressed. Me also a little dizzy. One more time, me bet you no can do it!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start>Me impressed. Me also a little dizzy. One more time, me bet you no can do it!
One, two... no, me do that one already. Drink you rum, worthy chum. <StartAction>[Drinks another bottle of rum.]</Start>
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Oh, me no feel so good. You be good person. Me likes you lot. Me gonna... <StartAction>[He falls asleep.]</Start>
Why you want speak to me wife? She not very good talker. She mostly just cry and yell lots, just like Rumgut's mom.
Me guess it be alright for you speak to her. Just treat her nice or Rumgut give you sharp slap to head!
What? Something be wrong with me wife? What we be saving her from? See, she be all nice and safe in me cage.
Wait! You be trying to trick me. You want take me wife away! You no should do that. It make me very angry!
You dare threaten me? Me will crush you into ground like... like big crushing-into-ground thing!
Oh yes, when she be my size I will hug her, and kiss her, and hold her, and I will never let her go. Now, you leavin' soon or what?
You watch who you call stupid. Me no like insults from little people like you. Only me wife call me stupid and get away with it!
No, she just be small person, but she will grow. Someday she be like me mom, and be big too.
That it! Me no have to take this from puny, <race> <boy/girl>! Me will crush you into ground like... like big crushing-into-ground thing!
No, me was that small one time too. When me be young, but then me grow up.
No, me be just big person, she be this big too, someday. You maybe not be this big someday, cause you likely die before you grow. You got big mouth and be kind of ugly.
Uh... thanks, me think. Me gots a great big belly too. You like it?
<StartAction>[Snort]</Start> Ha, ha! Me likes you. You want anything?
Prove it. Me no believe you.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No! You no can make me not love me wife. She be great cook. Now you get gone or me throw you in cage with me wife!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Oh, me guess you be right. Me give you key, but then you leave with her fast, or maybe me change mind and decide to eat you and her.
Me not even remember what we talkin' about now. What you want?
You be quiet in there. Me no want to hear you speak. Me just thinking 'bout what sauce go good with <race> meat.
No! You stole me wife! Now Rumgut will bash you into squishy, much-bashed thing!
Me gonna miss wife. Now me all alone again.

Ummm..ok. Listen, I really think her dad wants her back - to make her all pretty for her wedding night, you know. Kind of a family tradition. How about you let her out and I'll take her back home, get her fixed up and bring her right back.
Well - let me go have a look at her and I'll tell you if she's pretty enough for a man..I mean a giant, like yourself.
I tell you what - If I beat you in a drinking contest - then you let me take her.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Glug Glug.
I will leave now.
You have a wife?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You have a really beautiful voice. I was drawn here by it.
I want to ask you some questions.
That's all my questions.
Have you had troubles with kobolds?
Why do you want a wife?
Why don't you find someone more your size?
Why are you called Rumgut?
I like to drink too. Why, I bet I can drink more than you!
I changed my mind. I do not think I can out drink you.
<StartAction>[Pretend to drink, but spill most on ground.]</Start>
Time to die, Rumgut!
I guess you can lock me up.
<StartAction>[Drink the flask of rum.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Pretend to drink, but spill most on ground.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Drink the flask of rum.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Pretend to drink, but spill most on ground.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Drink the flask of rum.]</Start>
Could I speak to your wife?
I am here to save Becka.
Let her go, or I will have to kill you.
Sounds like you will be a great couple.
Listen stupid. She is a dwarf, which means she will never get bigger.
But she is a dwarf.
You are a giant, idiot!
You are an idiot, giant!
No, that is as big as she gets.
But you are a giant, she's not!
For someone so big, you sure have a small brain.
It would look better if I sliced it open.
No, it makes you look as stupid as you really are.
Uh... sure.
It is very impressive.
I am fully grown.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You have to trust me. She will never be a proper wife.
Oh, forget it!
<StartAction>[The wolf looks at you with a lopsided grin.]</Start>
The wolf wonders if the giant in the cave will throw out some more kobold parts to chew on.
The wolf scratches at a flea bite, wondering if swimming in the river would be worth the effort to get rid of the pest.
The wolf appears bored and wonders when you are going to go hunting together.
The wolf looks you over to decide if you would make a good mate, arriving at the decision that you would not produce good offspring together.
The wolf complains about a stag he was hunting that kept disappearing into thin air.
The wolf wonders how you can stand to move about on two legs, since you are obviously much slower.
Hello, wolf.
Me want god to save me. Me will worship him.
I do not know what to believe. He was right about some things.
The prophet sees all. The prophet knows all.
All praise to the prophet of the new god!
Praise be to the prophet of the new god. All bow before his wisdom!
I cannot believe these people are falling for such obvious lies.
Ah, my back hurts from all the bending and healing I have done this day. Not that I would complain. Servants of Ilmater never complain. It is part of the canon.
Greetings, <FirstName>. How may this servant of Ilmater assist you?
Yes, may Ilmater look favorably upon you.
<FirstName>, I am tired. I am so exhausted I can hardly keep my eyes open. I have drained most of my spells and most of my energy in a few short hours.
I can try to answer some questions for you, but make them quick, please.
Right. So anything else?
The god of endurance, suffering and perseverance, Ilmater cares for those whom nobody else will. We follow the path of poverty, collecting alms for those in need and keeping little for ourselves.
To help the poor and ill, we charge adventurers a fee for healing. Some do not appreciate the need, but ours is not a rich church. Our temples are modest and often in poor repair.
I do not even have a temple, but instead have this small shrine here in the community hall. Perhaps someday Hilltop will be large enough to support a small temple.

<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You always were a greedy soul, <FirstName>. I work in the same hall as the mayor. Believe me, if he decided to tax the only healer in town, he would lose his job the same day.
You should probably go see if there are any lost kobolds you can terrorize into giving you gold. At least then you might be serving a purpose.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> That foolish old goat! He starts drinking again and this is what happens!
Fine I will pay ten gold to this tax, but next election, you had better believe there will be a new Mayor!
Would you really? That would certainly be a wonderful thing to do. How much would you like to donate?
Oh, well... I suppose I should have expected as much. Anything else?
Another donation, <FirstName>! I cannot believe this! Surely you are a rare <man/woman>. With this the community will be improved in so many ways. Thank you. Can I help you with anything else?
<FirstName>! I cannot believe this! Surely you are a rare <man/woman>. With this the community will be improved in so many ways. Thank you. Can I help you with anything else?
Another donation? That is wonderful, <FirstName>. I am glad you feel the desire to do good for others. It seems to be a rare desire these days. Is there anything else?
That is wonderful, <FirstName>. I am glad you feel the desire to do good for others. It seems to be a rare desire these days. Is there anything else?
Oh, um... thanks. I guess I can buy a meal for a poor family. Maybe even two, if they only eat half rations. Anything else?
I do not mean to. I am not even supposed to, but it is very hard somedays. There is never enough gold to do all the work I am supposed to do.
Maybe I need to escape this life, but I doubt it would be any easier elsewhere. Ah, well, I am getting old and maybe someday soon I will retire.
Look, occasionally in a small village like this, you will have a small disaster. But, most of the time, it is just small things.
So when a major catastrophe like this happens, and I have to use a large number of spells in a short time period, I find myself tiring easily.
That's all there is to it. I imagine I'll be feeling better in a week or two, if I ever get any rest.
Away, thank Ilmater! That is all I know, and all I care to know. People of all races were born to suffer. It is my job to try to ease such suffering.
But that does not mean I have to enjoy watching them suffer! I am so sick of it, I cannot even begin to tell you. I have no energy left, so if the kobolds come again... well, it would be bad.
Is there anything else?
Of course, but in order to assist the others of this town, the poor, and those who cannot defend themselves, I will have to ask for a small donation of 20 gold.
Well, it is your life. Anything else?
I guess that depends on how much you value your life. 20 gold is quite cheap, if you look at it as an investment. You are investing in your community, in the church and in your immortal soul.
Viewed from that perspective, I would argue that it is pretty cheap. Perhaps I should even be asking more.
Sorry. If you manage to come up with enough, I would certainly be willing to help you. Anything else?
Very well then.
Anything else I can help you with?
Back again, <FirstName>? How can I help you this time?
Stay away from me, you butcher! Your corrupt soul has revealed its evil nature today!
Goodbye.
I want to ask you some questions.
Never mind.
Tell me about Ilmater.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - lie]</Start> So the new Kobold Defense Tax is going to hurt you then.
Could I make a donation?
Never mind.
100 gold.
10 gold.
1 gold.
You sure complain a great deal.
Why are you so drained?
Do you know where the kobolds went?
That's all my questions.
I need healing.
Never mind.
A small fee? 20 gold is no small fee!
I don't have that much.
Alright, I will pay.
Could I see what items you have for sale?
