What can I do for you today, my friend?
Greetings, <FirstName>, my friend. As you can see, we have a lot of unpacking to do. Fortunately, I was able to find some 'help'. Was there anything you wanted?
Then I shall see you again soon, I hope. Good bye, <FirstName>.
Mmm, an excellent specimen, and it seems to have some magical properties. Still, it would need to be used by the right craftsman to make it into something useable.
I once saw something very similar, made by a kobold of all things. It is unfortunate that I do not know any kobold craftsmen, but I imagine my contacts in Thay might know what to do with it.
The tooth is powerful, yet it will cost me a good sum of gold to transform it into something useful. The best I can offer you is 500 gold.
Ha! Just in case you run into a kobold craftsman? Good luck. Anything else?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, there is too much risk involved. What if I cannot find anyone to shape it into something useful? 500 gold, or nothing, that is the best I can do.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose I can always just raise the end price of the product. I just hope I do not lose money on this deal. 700 gold is the best I can offer.
Excellent. I will get this back to Thay immediately and see if I can find a craftsman to work with it.
Excellent. I will get this back to Thay immediately and see if I can find a craftsman to work with it. Was there anything else?
You would try to sell me a broken artifact? I am so disappointed in you, <FirstName>. I thought we had a good thing going here, and then you would try to cheat me?
I am not interested in garbage, even if it was once valuable. Broken magic is dangerous magic. Was there anything else; maybe something not broken?
That is an unusual artifact, <FirstName>. Are you sure you wish to part with it? I can offer you 1000 gold for it, but I am not sure that it is not worth more than that.
It would take someone with more arcane knowledge than I possess, to tell you the exact value and properties of this item.
Probably a wise decision, though I am curious about what it might be capable of. I do not think I would be anxious for someone like Szazz Tam to get a hold of it.
<StartCheck>[Failed]</Start> I am afraid not. I can only offer you 1000 gold.
Very well, I shall take it off your hands. I wonder who might be interested in buying this? Perhaps my mistress? Maybe I will make it a gift to her.
But enough of this prattle. I worry that I go on so at my age. Imagine how annoying I will be when I get old and never shut up. What else can I do for you?
I see that you have a keen eye for valuable artifacts. I am sure that there are many who would be interested in purchasing this item.
I can offer you 1000 gold for it.
That is unfortunate. But such is life. Anything else?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I can offer you no more than that, I am afraid. 1000 gold is the best I can do.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose I might cut my own profits a bit, or maybe I will just charge more for it. I can go as high as 1200 gold.
An excellent trade, <FirstName>. Together, you and I could go far. Is there anything else?
An excellent trade, <FirstName>. Together, you and I could go far. Is there anything else?
<FirstName>, you never fail to surprise me. There is a great market for such things in Thay. I could offer you 700 gold, or an interesting magic item I recently acquired.
The item is a cloak that belonged to a friend of mine in Thay. When we were young and in school together, his cloak came in quite handy, as the blue glow it gave off protected us from a firetrap.
The trap was supposed to seal off the pleasure slave area from the younger students. Needless to say, our education was that much superior to our classmates. So which would you prefer?
Holding out for a better bargain? Well, I doubt you will find one, but good luck. Anything else?
Though I am loath to part with it, I have no need for it either. I am pleased that we could do business once again. Is there anything else you would like?
700 gold it is. I am pleased that we could do business once again. Is there anything else you would like?
What are you speaking of my friend? What do you have there?
A baby? Azuth take me, what kind of trouble are you trying to bring down upon me, <FirstName>? Are you honestly offering me a local child as a slave?
You are a strange <lad/lass>, but I still like you. I really do. Please, do not strain our friendship like that again though.

Ha! I start to like you more and more, my fine, young friend. It will cost me to raise a child, not to mention to keep the townspeople from noticing, I shall have to send it back to my estates in Thay.
But to prove to you my absolute loyalty to our friendship I will offer you 500 gold. Do not ask for more, for I am being far more than generous.
Then the child is yours. I do not know what you shall do with it, but when it cries at midnight and one and two and three in the morning, remember the offer I made in friendship.
A wise choice, <FirstName>. Mutual admiration is the way a friendship blossoms, good friend. I have the greatest of respect for you.
When the caravans begin to arrive, then I will have proper supplies. Unfortunately, I have only a few things to offer you, but I will give you great prices.
Nothing thanks.
Would you like to buy this dragon's tooth?
Maybe I will just hang on to it.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> It must be worth more than that!
I'll take it.
I'll take it.
Would you like to buy this tower statue?
Would you like to buy this mummified hand?
I guess not.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Can you not offer me more for it?
Alright, deal.
I don't care. I just want the gold.
Would you like to buy this magical mask?
I guess not.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> This is a very valuable item. Surely you can offer me more?
I'll take it.
I'll take it.
Would you be interested in a dragon's egg?
Neither thanks.
I will take the cloak.
I will take the gold.
Would you like to buy a slave?
No, I was just testing you.
Uh... maybe?
Yes. If you have the right price.
I don't think so.
I will take it.
May I see what you have for sale?
T'is a better life out here than back in Thay.
A large group of creatures passed through this area recently, according to the tracks.
A large group of humanoids came from the forest and headed towards the road not long ago. According to the tracks, they took the same route back.

A large group of gnolls, perhaps three dozen, followed this path out of the forest towards the road not long ago. About half that many gnolls returned by the same route later. The tracks indicate that they took with them perhaps half a dozen kobolds... perhaps prisoners?
The small humanoid tracks in the area are numerous and scattered. They seem to head in every direction, almost.

There are many small humanoid tracks seemingly running to and fro in the area... probably belonging to kobolds. There seem to be far more of the older tracks heading towards Hilltop than returning to the mountains in the north.

There are scatterings of many small humanoid tracks in the area... kobold tracks, without a doubt. The older and more numerous tracks head towards Hilltop. A much smaller number head north, back towards the mountains, and those tracks seem to indicate the kobolds were running or fleeing at the time.
There is a scattering of small humanoid tracks... probably kobold... heading in this direction. You suspect that these kobolds fled from the battle nearby.
A large group of humanoids came from the forest and headed towards the road not long ago. According to the tracks, they took the same route back.
It is obvious from the tracks that a group of kobolds fled the battle at some point and ran in this direction. There appears to have been little pursuit by any other creatures.
<StartAction>[There is an old inscription on this pillar. The language is unfamiliar, but further study could possibly reveal its nature.]</Start>
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> <StartAction>[The inscriptions appear to be in the elven tongue, describing the history of the fallen city, Ascalhorn.]</Start>
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> <StartAction>[Though you discern that the writing is some form of story or history for a city called "Ascalhorn", you cannot make out the details.]</Start>
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> <StartAction>[The inscriptions appear to be in the elven tongue, describing the history of the fallen city, Ascalhorn.]</Start>
<StartAction>[The words inscribed on this pillar are in the elven tongue, describing the history of the fallen city, Ascalhorn.]</Start>
"All together, come and mourn, For our fair city, Ascalhorn."

"Like a crowning jewel was Ascalhorn, for proud Earlan, her beauty borne. Yet even at the height of power, when we ascended like a tower, And other lands most jealous grew, still we sought to prove us true, For mastery over ancient force."

"We looked at the growing race of man, and fear of weakness through us ran, Reaching down to Shadow's heart, for greater forces than our art, But like reaching out to touch the sun, we were burned, our strength undone, And evil through our city did course."

"So, for the evil that we had become, it was up to us to make undone, We tore it down and slew our kin, and in blood and death repaid our sin, We are the traitors and the faithful, and in death we lay here shameful, Forever shall our souls feel this remorse."

"May those who come upon our sleeping, do not waste your time in weeping, For evil done and good repaid, we hope our lives a balance made, And do not harshly judge us now; we gave our all, best we knew how; But all together, come and mourn, for our fair city, Ascalhorn."
<StartAction>[Leave the pillar alone.]</Start>
<StartCheck>[Decipher Script]</Start> <StartAction>[Attempt to translate the runes.]</Start>
<StartCheck>[Lore]</Start> <StartAction>[Attempt to translate the runes.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Leave the pillar alone.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Read the history.]</Start>
Squeak... Squeak...
As your mind brushes against theirs, you discover the bat's love for the crypt as a home, and their anger at a recent intrusion of small, scaly lizard-like creatures.
You also get a sense of revulsion from an image of something that stalks the bats. Things with great hunger and nimble legs.
The bats seem to marvel at your presence near their minds; then they lose interest and begin to hunt for insects again.
The strange squeaking of the bats increases as they nimbly dive and catch the crumbs out of the air.
You suddenly feel the presence of a very old bat, one that has lived well beyond the years of a normal rodent. Its mind comes to you clearer than the other bats'.
You see a door at the bottom of the steps and beyond the door you feel a powerful presence of benevolence and duty. The old bat then leaves your mind, but with a clear feeling of friendship.
You see great bloated creatures on eight legs, slipping through the darkness. It quickly becomes obvious that giant spiders have made a nest in the lower levels.
You see a large number of kobolds entering the crypts and descending to the lower level, where the bats seldom venture. They obviously fear something else down there.
Thank you. Goodbye.
<StartAction>[Throw a few crumbs of food to the bats.]</Start>

Kill it! Kill it!
Me kills you good!
Beware, mortal, for you trespass within the tomb of Nilmaldor, Knight-Gallant of Ascalhorn. Why have you come? Looting shall earn you only the foulest of curses to destroy your very soul.
But if you come with a heart of courage, then I welcome you and would speak with you for a turn.
Everything that happens here is my concern, mortal. If you do not wish to speak, so be it... but tread with care. You walk in halls that will not be defiled lightly.
I am no foul fiend come to haunt a murder, if that is what you ask. I am the guardian spirit of this crypt. It is my duty and my honor to watch over the dead of my people.
In life, I was a warrior of rank and privilege. The price was this eternal duty, and I accepted it willingly. But my duty has been foiled, so now here I remain in this single chamber.
I am unable to protect the rest of my brethren, for I have been driven from the rest of the tombs, but perhaps you might be willing to assist me?
I sense that you come here seeking an artifact of power, carried by the foul kobolds who have invaded this restful place.
You agreed to vanquish the spiders that infest the western crypt. All of the spiders and their egg sacs must be destroyed, but I sense the deed has not yet been done.
Ask what questions you have and I shall strive to answer them. This is not a place of urgency, as you can well imagine.
They have barricaded themselves in the southeast crypts. What they plan to do, I have no idea, but they show great fear with each movement.
They are cunning creatures... they learned quickly not to loot the corpses of my brethren, for then the warriors arise and do battle. Few thieves have survived the justice of the dead.
Still, the ugly creatures have no sense of respect and they defile our sanctuary. It would be good to have them gone from this place as soon as possible.
Eons ago, Ascalhorn was the crown jewel and capitol of the realm of Earlan. We were a proud and powerful nation of the fair folk.
I would rather not speak of the details, but our people sought power they should not have and in so doing corrupted all that was once graceful and beautiful.
Being a practitioner of the arcane arts yourself, I am sure you understand how the pursuit of power for its own sake can corrupt even the purest of souls. Such was the case with Ascalhorn.
But as we watched the human race grow in strength, our rulers became jealous and sought to further their power through the pursuit of the darkest arts. It corrupted all that was once beautiful.
We who are buried here are those elves of Ascalhorn who turned against our masters and burned our fair city by our own hands. We are betrayers and saviors both, and here we lie forgotten.
And so we do. We would not see fair Ascalhorn turned into a tyranny of evil and darkness; we could not bear it.
Stronger than our desire to not see fair Ascalhorn turned into a tyranny over man and elves both? What we did was to preserve all others as much as what was good in ourselves.
Perhaps so. I would rather have Ascalhorn remembered for what it once was, but that shall never be.
Many lives were lost, but none of them innocent. Such is the price we paid for our pride. My only hope is that the gods one day forgive us our folly.
Is there anything else you would like to know?
I am the guardian of this crypt, mortal. It is my eternal duty and my honor to watch over the dead of my people.
I felt their fearful passing a short time ago, and they remain within the crypt still. Know that they have caused great mischief and destruction here... I would be eager to have them gone.
I would consider it a boon, in fact, should you remove the vermin. Indeed, if you are willing to render me assistance, I believe I can even provide you a simple manner to accomplish that feat.
An age ago, a malevolent wraith invaded our crypt. I did battle with the creature and destroyed it, but not before it weakened me greatly.
Ever since I have been forced to remain close to my own remains. I cannot roam the crypt freely as I once did... and this means I cannot perform my duty.
Living creatures... giant spiders, in fact... have infested one of the western tombs. They have damaged much and I can do nothing.
If you be bold enough to destroy these spiders and their egg sacs, mortal, I would be more than willing to aid you with the kobolds.
If you refer to wealth, then there is little I can do for you. What possessions the dead keep in this hallowed place are not for you. All I can offer is to assist you with your goal.
I see. Should you have a change of heart, mortal, then speak to me again. Until that time I warn you to tread lightly in these halls.
I am well pleased to know there is such a <man/woman> of courage left in the living world. Return to me once your task has been completed.
You return to my tomb. Do you have the courage to assist me now. mortal?
Beware, mortal, for you trespass within the tomb of Nilmaldor, Knight-Gallant of Ascalhorn. I warn you not to disturb the graves of my elven brethren.
However, I would reward you for a service you unwittingly provided. You destroyed an infestation of spiders that had defiled our resting place.
If you told me your purpose for entering our crypt, perhaps I could decide upon an appropriate reward.
Then be gone, mortal, before our tomb soon becomes your grave also.
You are a common grave robber? Then you deserve little, but perhaps if I gave you access to treasure you would leave my companions to their rest.
I welcome your return, adventurer.
Time means nothing to the dead. Come and go as you wish.
To be rid of their filth and destruction fills me with joy. Now I shall help you be done with the creatures you hunt.
The kobolds are barricaded in a room that was once also an elaborate trap. A grave-robber of long ago once disabled this trap... but it is merely disabled, not destroyed.
The trap can be reactivated in a separate control room, which can be accessed by way of a secret door in the hallway south of the entrance to the kobolds' barricaded hall.
Destroy them as you wish, it matters little to me. I offer the knowledge of this trap only to make your task easier, as the numbers of the kobolds may be too great for any single warrior.
Now that you know it is there, it should not be too hard to find.
Use the lever inside to enable the trap, and then take one of the magical helms to protect you from the poisonous effect of the trap.
Once the trap is enabled, just step on the pressure plate in the kobold's barricaded room and the gas will stun the kobolds. You should make short work of them after that.
As you desire, mortal. Before you go, there is one thing I would present you with, for your courage and assistance.
I was about to give you something else, something worthy of the courage you have shown me, yet your impatience does not bode well. Perhaps you are not deserving of more.
You have earned nothing but my contempt. Leave quickly, before this tomb becomes your own grave!
There is one more thing, brave adventurer.
In the upper crypt is a reliquary that holds an item of value to us. I would see it returned to the hands of the living, but only to one who is worthy.
Take this key, and use it to enter the eastern hall of the upper crypt. Perhaps you shall find this item of use.
Go, and escape this tomb soon, before it becomes your own grave.
You throw this honor back at me, do you? Go, fool... leave this place. May your rewards be exactly what you deserve.
Farewell, and may your bravery carry you far in your future endeavors, mortal.
I have no more advice for you, adventurer. Go, and may you learn much in your journeys.
I sense that the kobold presence has been ended. Now perhaps peace shall reign in this place once again.
I welcome your return, adventurer.
To be rid of their filth and destruction fills me with joy. And since you have also dealt with the kobold intruders, I believe you deserve a reward.
And you must be the one I have to thank for not only their infestation, but that of the spiders in the western crypts as well. You are deserving of reward, I think.
And you must be the one I have to thank for their elimination. Might you consider using your strength to aid me in a task, stranger?
Then leave quickly, before this tomb becomes your own grave.
An age ago, a malevolent wraith invaded our crypt. I did battle with the creature and destroyed it, but not before it weakened me greatly.
Ever since I have been forced to remain close to my own remains. I cannot roam the crypt freely as I once did... and this means I cannot perform my duty.
Living creatures... giant spiders, in fact... have infested one of the western tombs. They have damaged much and I can do nothing.
If you were to destroy the spiders and all of their egg sacs, mortal, I would be most grateful and would reward you for your kindness.
Ah, the mighty slayer of our defilers returns. I sense the spiders are now destroyed. You have my thanks for such generous assistance.
<StartAction>[Nilmaldor seems distracted in thought and ignores you.]</Start>
You were instructed to leave. Now you will face my eternal wrath, defiler of the dead!
Be gone, spirit. My presence is none of your concern.
What kind of undead creature are you?
Tell me what help you need.
May I ask you some questions?
I will be going now. Goodbye.
What have the kobolds been up to?
Where are your people from?
You deserve your fate, as I see it.
Then your masters were fools. The dark arts should have made them stronger.
Such is the price paid for consorting with evil.
That is a terrible shame.
You want to speak with me? What for?
I seek a group of kobolds who may have entered this crypt.
The kobolds are here? That's all I needed to know. Farewell.
I don't need your help, spirit.
You can tell me what you want, but don't get your hopes up.
What do you need my help with?
I'll only do this for the right reward.
I guess you're stuck with the spiders then. Sorry.
I have no time for spider-killing. I have enough problems of my own.
I suppose so, if it will make my job easier.
I will help you..
No, goodbye.
I will help you.
It is none of your business, spirit.
I seek treasure.
I seek the kobolds who recently entered this crypt.
I should go.
I have destroyed a nest of spiders and their eggs.
This sounds complicated. Why don't I just kill the kobolds?
How do I find the secret entrance?
Please, continue.
Now it is time to go slaughter some helpless kobolds.
That's it? That's all I get for killing all those spiders?
Just give me the reward. I have earned it.
I am sorry. I am just tired.
That should make my job much easier. Thank you, spirit.
Ah, magic! Now I shall be more powerful than ever!
Great, more fighting, thanks a lot.
You are very kind, good spirit. Thank you.
The spiders and their eggs are destroyed.
I have no time for that.
Tell me what aid you need.
Safe becomes death and death becomes safe when one has what he desires.
<StartAction>[While faded and cracked with age, the statue depicts a handsome elven man wielding a glittering sword and wearing an amulet engraved with a crescent moon.]</Start>
<StartAction>[The elf appears to gaze down at you with sad, unearthly eyes and you are left with the definite impression that you are watched. An inscription at the statue's base reads:]</Start>
"I who shall watch over Those Who Rest bid you to cast a prayer in My name: Corellon Larethian, Creator of the Elves and First of the Seldarine."
<StartAction>Leave the statue alone.</Start>
<StartAction>Spit on the statue.</Start>
<StartAction>Pretend to pray faithfully.</Start>
<StartAction>Pray faithfully.</Start>
<StartAction>[A sticky nest of webbing contains several glistening globes that can only be egg sacs... enough, no doubt, to populate the crypt with spiders for generations to come.]</Start>
They are destroyed with a satisfying explosion of liquids.
Although you know it must be done, your love of nature takes all enjoyment from a job well done.
<StartAction>Leave it alone.</Start>
<StartAction>Crush the egg sacs.</Start>

<StartAction>A message has been chiseled into the face of this granite marker in several languages. While almost faded, it is still legible:</Start>
"Herein lie the brave warriors of fair Ascalhorn. Know ye that they perished with honor, and that the memory of their grim duty shall fill our hearts with sadness for all eternity."
"If thou dost enter this hallowed place, enter with respect. Those who seek only to defile shall be granted no mercy."
Ack, ack! Me speaks not to you! You should not be here at all!
Ack! You helps me good. Me be very thankful. You takes mummy hand and you go. Urko had mummy hand, so you search him body. Yip! Me lead kobolds back to our home now..
Something tells you that this door will open when you are allowed to leave. Master Drogan's orders.
This lone straggler apparently didn't make it, and has been serving as dinner for the rats since.
The kobolds fled this way and continued north, according to the tracks in the dust. This lone straggler has been severely gnawed on by the local rat population.

The kobolds clearly passed this way, being chased by rats that managed to take down this lone straggler (and have been feasting upon him for at least several hours). The tracks in the dust show that the kobolds continued to flee north, going lower into the crypt.
You have proved yourself worthy, paladin. Take the trappings of your new station and go forth to fulfill your destiny.
There are signs of sticky webbing at various places on the doorway. You suspect that spiders are nearby... giant ones, in fact.
The dust on the ground has been disturbed heavily by small tracks... kobolds, without a doubt.
There are numerous tracks belonging to humanoids... kobolds, no doubt... heading north. You cannot determine how many, exactly, but more than a dozen at least.

There are numerous kobold tracks scuffed into the disturbed dust, here. Around twenty or so kobolds ran through this area in a hurry, heading north. There is no evidence of them returning the same way, although examining the tracks closely leads you to believe that at least one kobold snuck back out of the crypt very recently.
According to the disturbed dust, you believe the kobolds have passed through this section of the hall several times.
The kobolds obviously continued along this hallway, but you cannot tell which direction they took at the intersection.
The kobolds continued this way, according to the tracks, and turned right at the intersection.
There are many tracks in the dust. Wherever the kobolds are hiding, they are likely very close.
The kobold tracks along this hall are heavy. Wherever they are hiding, it is nearby and likely further down the hall.

It's obvious to you that the kobolds slowed along this hallway, and numerous tracks run back and forth along its length. You are quite sure that the kobold lair is close... perhaps further down the hall from here at the next doorway.
The bear turns to regard you with its fierce eyes and growls low in its throat. This beast has obviously been beaten and starved to turn it into a killer.
The bear stares at you suspiciously. It's thoughts are full of pain and hunger... obviously the gnolls have conditioned it to become a killer.
The bear turns its pain-filled thoughts elsewhere for now, wondering faintly if you too will beat it if it acts wrongly.
Since you have control over the bear for the moment, you quickly distract it and then kill it. Its thoughts of shock and hate fade away as it dies.
The images the bear sends you are a mixture of hatred and pain. It knows little of the gnolls beyond the torture they have inflicted on the beast.
You gather some scraps to feed to the bear, and it all but flies into a rage as it chews down the meat quickly. Obviously it half-expects you to take its meal away.
Rather than making the bear more agreeable, feeding it seems to make it more suspicious. From the images in its mind, it seems the gnolls only fed it before combat.
You attempt to pat the bear's fur and speak to it calmly, but it flinches away from you as if expecting to be beaten.
Even though the bear knows instinctively that you are a friend, the gnolls have all but ruined the bear's mind. Inside its hate-filled mind, the bear wishes it was dead.
Whispering a prayer to the gods of nature, you call it near and suddenly give it a quick and merciful death. Its last, fleeting thoughts are of gratitude.
<StartAction>Leave the bear alone.</Start>

You... you're <race>! Please... all the gnolls seem to have left the cave! Is that true? Are we free to go?
We... we are? You're sure? Oh, thank you, my <lord/lady>, thank you!
I... I know it is much to ask, but there was another amongst us who survived. His name is Glendir, but the gnolls took him. He... he could be alive, somewhere...
Before we go, we must know... is the village of Hilltop safe? It's the only settlement near this forest, and we can't return to Blumberg now.
Then... then we must make the trek westward towards Silverymoon. I can only hope we will all survive to see it. Fare you well, my <lord/lady>.
Then we must chance that Hilltop still stands. I can only pray it is so. Fare you well, my <lord/lady>.
That is such a relief, thank the gods! Tell me, my <lord/lady>... might we know the name of our savior?
As you wish. May the gods watch over you, my <lord/lady>.
Thank you, <FirstName>. May the gods watch over you always.
You... you are too generous! Thank you ever so much, <FirstName>. Fare you well, and may the gods watch over you always!
It is generous of you to offer, my <lord/lady> but we would not want to be a burden. We can make it on our own. Tell me... might we know the name of our savior?
You... you wouldn't! Please don't say such a thing!!
We... we have nothing, stranger. The gnolls took us prisoner in Blumberg... all we have are the rags they left us with.
Does... that mean you will not free us? Please, my <lord/lady>, say that isn't so! Nobody could be that cruel-hearted!
Then... then we are stuck here, still. Stuck here until we die. You are a cruel, evil <man/woman>, you are.
We are from Blumberg... or, rather, I should say we were. The gnolls descended on our village not more than a day ago.
We don't know why they came or what they wanted. They... they killed most of us. We're all that's left.
Oh, please... is there no way you could release us? I'm begging you! We will surely die here if we do not escape!
Oh, please... is there no way you could release us? I'm begging you! We will surely die here if we do not escape!
Oh, please... if there's any pity in you, you'll free us from this misery! Have mercy on us, stranger!
You would abandon innocent folk in need? Then... then we are doomed.
Oh, please... if the gnolls are really gone, could we not flee from here? Is it not safe?
You have? I... I don't know how you did it, but you are a marvel of a <man/woman> to accomplish such a feat! Does this mean we can leave this horrid place?
You... you're <race>? Are you in league with these gnolls somehow? Was it you who ordered us turned into slaves?
I... I... y-yes, my <lord/lady>...
I... you are an evil, cruel <man/woman> for what you've done to us. I hope the gods make you pay for this!
Then please, my <lord/lady>! Take pity on us! Free us from this hell-hole, I beg you!
You... you're willing to anger these gnolls and free us?
Bless you, my <lord/lady>! Bless you!
Then... then we are doomed. Go then... go and do whatever you believe is so important that you abandon innocent folk to such a gruesome fate.
Oh, thank you! Thank you! Please hurry, my <lord/lady>!
I will believe that when I see it.
We... we have nothing, stranger. The gnolls took us prisoner in Blumberg... all we have are the rags they left us with.
Does... that mean you will not free us? Please, my <lord/lady>, say that isn't so! Nobody could be that cruel-hearted!
You've... taken control of them? How did... never mind that, couldn't you free us, then? Couldn't you let us go?
You... you're <race>! Thank the gods! Please, my <lord/lady>... please let us out of this place! The gnolls will be the death of us for sure!
I... I think we will have to take our chances, then. Thank you, my <lord/lady> for setting us free.
What do you want? To torment us helpless folk?! If these gnolls are really gone can we not even leave this hellish place?

It's you again! Please tell us that we are free to go, please!
Very well, my <lord/lady>, but be quick I beg you!
What do you want with us? Are you here to torment us more?! Will you not free us from this place?
It's you again! Please tell us that we are free to go, please!
Please! Please help us be free of this place, we beg you!

<StartAction>[Lie]</Start> Hilltop is in ruins. You don't want to go there.
I don't really care where you go, just go.

My name is unimportant.
Give thanks to the gods and that will be enough recognition for me.
My name is <FirstName>.
My name is <FirstName>. And here... 100 gold to help you rebuild your lives.

Fine, fine. I will speak to the chieftain.

I suppose I could, at that. Very well... you're free to go.
You're free to go. The way is clear.
What do I care? Come or go, as you wish.

You again? Are you going to let me out of here or not? Please, I'm begging you!
Uhh... is everything okay?
Lead on.
Alright. Don't go too far, though. These caves are frightening.
That looks like the exit there. Thank you for saving me! I don't think I would have made it without you.
Of course. Follow me.
Find it on your own. I don't have time to baby-sit.
You aren't going anywhere. Time to die!
The exit? Haven't you sworn allegiance to me?
You'll pay for this with your life, fool!
Start running... I don't want to see you ever again!
No, you *will* serve me. As promised.
Oh, forget it, then. It wasn't even worth it.
Fine. Follow me.
You *are* joking, right?
Don't you think it's time you told me who you really are?
Well, you're free now. Find your own way home.
Then I suppose I have to kill you now.
Good to know. Now hand over the promissory note.
True... fine, keep it then.
We'll see about that.
Now that sounds more like the truth.
A smith in Hilltop?
First there's the matter of that promissory note.
First there's the matter of that promissory note.
Forget it. I've got other things to do.
Hold on, I'll see what I can do.
I can't let you out. The gnolls will get angry if I do.
It may be dangerous, but I'll do what I can.
If I had some guarantee your father would pay...
I'll speak to the chieftain on your behalf.
Give me one good reason I should let you out.
First tell me who you are.
In that case, you can stay in the cage.
Oh really? The Baron's son, you say?
And just how do I make sure I get my money?
Now that does sound promising.
No, I don't think so. Have a nice stay.
Let you out? After all that lying?
Start writing that note and I'll see what I can do.
So you're trying to cheat me!
So I give it to the non-existent Baron of Hilltop.
I'm sure I could get more money than *that*.
I suppose two thousand gold will have to do.
Why stop there? Why not keep lying?
Alright, what are you hiding? Do I have to beat it out of you?
Even I can see through that act.
Do I look that stupid to you?
Tell me who you really are before I start poking you with sharp objects.
But there is no Baron of Hilltop.
In that case, you can stay in the cage.
Now that sounds more like the truth.
A smith in Hilltop?
How about swearing everlasting loyalty to me?
Hmmm... no, not worth it. You stay in there.
That's better. I'll see what I can do.
Everything's fine. Never mind.
Follow me again.
Wait here for now.
You're going to have to find your own way out from here.

<StartAction>[Ring the gong.]</Start>

Is name that gnolls say sometimes. They say that J'Nah wants all items of power. Maybe is chieftain?
They big and hairy and they gots bad breath?
Ummm... nothing. We kobolds never fights with gnolls before. We not knows why they comes and attacks us, honest!
Umm... we heads home after raid on human village and gnolls attack. Lots of kobolds dies or runs, but we gets captured. They going to eats us for sure!
Umm... yes? You, ummm... you not lives in human village, do you?
Me not know. Master gives Urko magic knife to hurts dwarf with, he says it got special poison. But Urko flee battle with gnolls... he not here.
We only gots one item when gnolls takes us prisoner... big dragon tooth. But gnolls takes it away long time ago.
We not knows what happens to rest of items. Other kobolds flee with them, maybe, or maybe gnolls gots them all.
Master sends us to steal items of power from dwarf... Master tells us we have to go quickly! He not tells us why.

You hears of Master? Yes, Master is great dragon Tymofarrar! He want items of power and he wants them yesterday. Is big mystery to us.
Oh... you is human. Of course you lives in human village. Ummm... we is sorry?
Oh, no, we not tries anything. We... we not even gots weapons! How we tries something?

You is big <race> meanie!

Because you is nice and merciful <race> person?
Oh, just lets us out! Me is begging you!!
Me answers all questions when you lets us out! Just lets us out!! We not wants to be stew for hairy gnolls!
We waits here and looks for weapons. If door to chieftain room be open, we come running after you starts fight! Fight fight fight!!
Just little kobolds? You're going to die, vermin!

You're evil little monsters and you deserve to die!!

Then run, and don't stop running. I don't want to see you ever again!
Then answer some of my questions, and be quick about it.
Alright, go on. Get out of here, all of you.
I want some questions answered first.
Nothing, never mind.
Forget it! Now you die!
No! Now you pay for what you did in Hilltop!

I'll see what I can do, hold on.

The pool before you is covered with runes, but it is an unknown and ancient language. Carved into its rim appears to be five large symbols.
The pool is calm but glowing faintly. You get the impression that this device has a specific function here.
As the token sinks into the bubbling water, it too dissolves. The pool begins to glow even more brightly, and the bubbling becomes so frantic it nearly spills over its rim.
You no longer have a token available.
As the token sinks into the water, it dissolves and the pool begins to glow and bubble softly.
The symbols are clearly marked: a flame, a raindrop, a stone, a whirlwind and the last has all the symbols in one circle. It seems each can be pressed into the platform.
The whirlwind symbol lights up and the pool emits a bright magical flash. A censer suddenly appears in your hand.
The whirlwind symbol lights up and the pool emits a bright magical flash. A censer suddenly appears in your hand. The pool, however, is still actively bubbling.
The stone symbol lights up and the pool emits a bright magical flash. A stone suddenly appears in your hand.
The stone symbol lights up and the pool emits a bright magical flash. A stone suddenly appears in your hand. The pool, however, is still actively bubbling.
The raindrop symbol lights up and the pool emits a bright magical flash. A bowl suddenly appears in your hand.
The raindrop symbol lights up and the pool emits a bright magical flash. A bowl suddenly appears in your hand. The pool, however, is still actively bubbling.
The flame symbol lights up and the pool emits a bright magical flash. A brazier suddenly appears in your hand.
The flame symbol lights up and the pool emits a bright magical flash. A brazier suddenly appears in your hand. The pool, however, is still actively bubbling.
You press the symbol and it lights up briefly, and then dims. Nothing else occurs.
The 4--symbol carving lights up and the pool emits a bright magical flash. A robe suddenly appears in your hand.

<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> While you spend a short time studying the runes, you are not certain you can make any sense of them at all.
They depict some kind of silver token being placed inside the pool nearby, but beyond that you can discern nothing.

<StartHighlight>You hear whispers within your mind and realize this creature is speaking to you telepathically. Its name is Azath and you feel a strong desire for magic.</Start>
<StartHighlight>The creature seems unmoved and its yearning for magic only increases.</Start>
<StartHighlight>Images flash through your mind depicting a scene where you disappear in a flash and reappear within the Ancient Ruins, where you found J'nah.</Start>
<StartHighlight>The images seem to be some kind of offer by Azath... it is what Azath was constructed for. But it feeds off of the magic from any spell to gain power.</Start>

<StartHighlight>Azath ponders this, hovering, and then sends images to you of magical potions. You get the impression it can take the magic from these, as well, but it would have to choose the potion.</Start>
<StartHighlight>Azath floats over and begins inspecting your bags, emitting images of curious exploration...</Start>
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> <StartHighlight>The creature thinks on this for a long moment and finally sends images of refusal. It is too hungry.</Start>
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> <StartHighlight>The creature thinks on this for a long moment and then slowly agrees. The images it sends to your mind seem suspicious.</Start>
<StartHighlight>Azath appears to consider this for a long moment, and then sends images to your mind that seem to convey agreement.</Start>
<StartHighlight>Azath sends images of pleasure and thanks to your mind.</Start>
<StartHighlight>Azath sends images of sadness. It can do nothing to assist you.</Start>
<StartHighlight>Azath sends images to you of excitement and expectation. Any spell will do, apparently, and it seems eager to begin.</Start>

What do you think, Master Jumper?
You had better shut up and listen!
Yes, the Chief must have the power!
Maybe I was a little hasty. Would you reconsider, Chief?
Be quiet Klumph!
Calm down or I'll tie you down!
But I don't know what to do with it.
You could have just done that in the first place.
I'll do my best.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> He cannot be the chief without power.
That is a little open. Master Jumper, what do you think?
That sounds fair.
Enough! We won't get anywhere with insults.
That would solve a lot of problems.
<StartAction>[Snicker]</Start>
Don't get upset. Klumph, that'll be enough.
Klumph, show some respect for your Chief!
Once per year.
Once every two months.
Once per month.
Are we in agreement then?
No. You get to live.
You get your rod back.
What do you want?
It's about time, now give him the rod and let's go.
Good, now, Master Jumper, is there anything you want?
That's terrible. You can't just give him a wife!
That sounds like a good deal.
Just get the rod and let's get going.
What will your sister say?
I can't believe this.
What do you mean you'll give him a wife?
Once per week.
Hey, no threats. Let's try to work this out amicably.
Do you really want to die Master Jumper?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You can trust me with it.
I was just exploring.
You just make sure they are careful too. Goodbye.
I will be careful. Goodbye.
I want to ask you some questions.
I don't have any more questions.
I am going now.
I want to see Tymofarrar.
I have questions about you.
Enough about you.
Are you happy being the chief?
Could a non-kobold become the chief?
How did you become the chief?
You beat up all the other contenders?
That's great!
That's horrible!
They kill the others?
And you had the best speech?
I have questions about your caves.
Enough about your caves.
Where do you keep your valuables?
When did you come to these caves?
I have questions about Tymofarrar.
Can I go see Tymofarrar?
Why is there a massive boulder in the way to Tymofarrar?
Why is Tymofarrar here?
Enough about the dragon.
How old is Tymofarrar?
I have come to see Tymofarrar.
The Master Jumper could help me.
Because of the massive boulder?
You will let me go see him!
Why is that impossible?
Why won't they listen to you?
You are the chief. Make them listen.
What is a Master Jumper?
Who is the Master Jumper?
Could I use the rod?
Why did you want to see Tymofarrar?
Where is the Master Jumper?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You will let the Master Jumper help me, or else you will die.
The Master Jumper is dead.
Goodbye.
That's disgusting.
No.
A kobold? You have got to be kidding!
links
Artifacts? Hmm. Every adventurer I have ever met was seeking magical items of some sort. What kind of artifacts would you be looking for?
You invade my private bolthole and then presume to tell me what is and is not my business? Your temerity is astounding. I wish I knew whether it was mere bravado or true confidence.
It just so happens that I have a magical artifact in my possession, and would be willing to trade it for one I am seeking. Would you be interested in a little proposition?
The only way you could know that is if the gnolls told you. Damn their traitorous and foolish hides. I might have to destroy them earlier than I expected.
They certainly have not proven their worth as guards. I shall have the captain flayed alive and then decide if they shall live.
Very well, it is true that I have recovered the dragon's tooth, but it is not the artifact I was seeking. If you are interested in a trade, perhaps we can work something out.
Ah, this explains so much. You must be <FirstName>, the <race> student of Drogans. You see? I have done my research.
I hope you are not accusing me of arranging their theft. I was greatly angered when the items were removed from there and I sent my gnolls to stop the kobolds.
Unfortunately my gnolls were less successful than I hoped, and they allowed many of the kobolds to escape, along with the artifacts.
You think you can just walk out of here, knowing where my secret lair is? I hardly think so. I am afraid fate has chosen a very short thread for your life. Goodbye, pest.
I do not care for your tone, <boy/girl>. Watch your tongue around me or you might just lose it.
You look and sound suspicious, which makes me think you know more than you are letting on.
What makes you think I would need to pay for your services? Mayhap, what I really want is a new slave.
Cunning enough to evade my traps; strong enough to defeat my guards; this should be interesting indeed. Must I now contend with a new enemy, stranger?
With all of the skills you must possess to have gained entrance to my lair, it would be a shame to slaughter you. Perhaps we could even become friends. Come; tell me who you are.
Ah, you must be one of those who judge swiftly, even without full knowledge of the situation. Everything is always black and white for you, is it?
I am curious. You call me evil, yet I would know exactly what you base your judgment on. Do you actually have evidence that I am evil?
Those empty-minded minions? I use them as a hunter uses a bow. A weapon may be used to kill a good woman, or to protect that same woman.
So you are one of Drogan's students. I suppose I should have recognized you. Unfortunately you are even more foolish than the old dwarf. I do not have the artifacts.
I was not the one who organized the attack on your quaint little school, in fact my gnolls attacked the kobolds who carried out the raid and attempted to wrest the artifacts from them.
Unfortunately my gnolls proved to be even less useful than predicted and they allowed many of the kobolds to escape, carrying the items with them.
Ha! The treachery of that wyrm knows no bounds. I actually love the irony that he would send you to slay me because I am evil!
I suppose if a demon told you your own mother was a devil, you would take his words at face value and cut off her head? Be realistic, what does the conniving old wyrm want from me?
I use them as a hunter uses a bow. A weapon may be used to kill a good woman, or to protect that same woman.
My gnolls are here to protect me and to further my purposes. When they are of no more use to me, I can dispose of them as easily as an old lover.
Even if you still perceive me as evil, could there be an alternate destiny for significant people, such as ourselves, that reaches beyond the borders of good and evil?
So be it. This day brings your death.
I see I am dealing with one of the slower minded individuals of your race. That is unfortunate, as I do not suffer fools lightly.
If you wish to be destroyed, I am more than willing to accommodate you. But if you are not positive that we need to be enemies, maybe we could find common purpose?
Why do you not tell me what drove you to enter my bolthole?
You could be telling the truth, though I will assume nothing for the moment. I suppose I could make use of the talents of one who is good at overcoming obstacles.
Very well. I find myself in a position where I need to recover certain artifacts. I was going to recover these artifacts from the past owner, when someone I thought to be an ally double-crossed me.
There are three missing artifacts. One is a mummified hand, the next a mask, and finally, a tower. While I would like to have all of these items, the only one I absolutely must have is the tower.
One thousand gold and a magically enchanted dragon tooth would be yours in exchange for the tower. It is an excellent deal, I assure you.

I think you have been deceiving me about what knowledge you truly possess. Still... it is of no matter to me what deceptions you might be attempting. I think you will find I can pierce your most tangled lies.
Because I am in a forgiving mood, I will give you one more chance. Are you interested?
I face an evil and deadly foe; a most cruel beast, Tymofarrar, a white dragon.

"The frightful king of winter ruled from his crystal splinter, and all around would bow to him alone. If one misspoke a single word, and the mighty dragon overheard, frozen death from him was quickly blown."
That is a line from an epic, written about Tymofarrar's sire many years ago. Although in many ways Tymofarrar has yet to reach such heights of power, still he is a deadly foe.
What do you mean? Of course he has the tower, his servants returned it to him, I am positive.
He is full of tricks and wicked lies, but do not be fooled by them. He has the tower, of that I am positive. Most cunning is my foe, with teeth and ice to back up his position.
One of the dragon's servants? Why did he not simply return the tower to his master?
What? Who is this Deekin? Where did he get the tower?
Hmm... but he claimed to still have the pieces? Obviously he must have. The only way this kobold will survive is if Tymofarrar does not. The white dragon does not just set his servants free.
I have never heard of Tymofarrar allowing a servant to go free. This could still work. I could help you destroy the dragon, but you would have to return the tower to me when you get it.
Yes, you would be performing a deed of legendary proportions. Still it will be a difficult battle, and I would not allow an ally to face this creature blind, or I would simply be short an ally.
Do not fear. I would not allow an ally to face this creature blind, or I would simply be short an ally.
Would you have me hide the truth from you? I would not allow an ally to face this creature blind, or I would simply be short an ally.
I have something that might help you face Tymofarrar, but it would only work once, so you would have to make it count.
If you agree to do this for me, I will give the item to you. My magic will enchant it, so you cannot use it, except within close proximity of the dragon.
It is the Phylactery of Ice, a weapon I just recently discovered. Breaking it infuses your body with the essence of an ice elemental, giving you great strength and resistance to cold.
There is also a side benefit, a touch of irony to Tymofarrar's end. Several years ago, he was defeated by a powerful frost giant. He is young, and he seems to fear and hate them now.

When the elemental enters your body, you will assume the form of a frost giant. Perhaps you will not even have to fight Tymofarrar. When he sees a frost giant charging at him, he might turn tail and flee.
<StartAction>[Sigh]</Start> I suppose I have to kill you now. You know far to much about me to be allowed to live. What a shame.
<StartAction>[Sigh]</Start> I suppose I have to kill you now. What a shame.
You mean besides the pleasure of my brilliant smile? Oh, I suppose I could give you a powerful artifact and 1000 gold, in exchange for the tower.
I happen to have a magically infused dragon tooth in my collection of rare items. I would willingly trade it for the tower. I am sure you would find the tooth of great use.
I will show you how it works, after you return the tower to me. The death of Tymofarrar is only a side benefit; it is the recovery of the tower he stole that is far more important.
I would trade the dragon's tooth for the tower, and 1000 gold beside. Surely that is a worthy offer. The dragon's tooth is more powerful, but it is not what I need.
Excellent. Here is the phylactery; remember not to break it until you are in the same cave as the dragon.
I do not expect to see you again until you have the tower, so if there is anything else, you should ask them now.
Be wary of tricks and traps, the white dragon is quite capable of the most dangerous cunning.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I think you had better count yourself lucky to survive our meeting. You do not want to face my wrath, for my fury knows no bounds.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose you might need a little something to motivate you. Take this gold, it is but a sample of your reward.
Anything else?
I am willing to answer questions, if they are relevant or I find them interesting.
I am sorry I could not be more informative, but secrecy is a way of life. At least take some comfort in knowing that I did not lie to you.
You are out of your league foolish male. I would never give myself to one of your kind. Besides, my mate has already been arranged for me, and he is far more powerful than you.
I would say you have a choice to make. Will you serve the treacherous beast, or will you serve me? I think you will find that I part with treasure far more easily than the greedy dragon.
You have made your last mistake, fool. Hades take you and that damned dragon!
A wise choice. Any other questions?
Have you ever been told to do something that is very important, but not known why it was important? If you have, you will know how infuriating it can be.
I cannot tell you something I do not know, but if I did know, I still could not tell you. I am afraid I cannot be very helpful. Perhaps if you asked me something else?
If I told you that, as clichй as it might sound, I really would have to kill you. Just believe me that when my people rise to power, you will be thankful you joined with me. Anything else?
I was planning on it, but face it, if I fail, I am dead. If you fail, I still live. I have many important things to do and this is merely a step towards my ultimate goals.
You may not like my logic, but you can hardly fault it. Now, will you do this thing for me?
That traitorous wyrm that dares to bear the noble title of dragon? What does the conniving creature want from me?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> There will be no truce! You can fight me and die, or you can help me and kill Tymofarrar. There is no other option.
The avarice and greed of a dragon knows no bounds. He knows very well that I must have the tower he stole, and yet he sends a collector for the one I have.
So you have come to kill me? Or do you desire to make a small profit and gain a magical artifact as well?
I think you underestimate my powers. If Tymofarrar frightens you, you know nothing of what I could do to you. Now choose, death or riches.
You? Ha, ha, ha! You have no chance of defeating us both. The best you can hope for is to choose the right ally, one who can help you defeat the other. I am the right choice, but it is up to you.
You will die first, but that treacherous dragon will follow soon after!
Such confidence is admirable, even in one of the lesser races. Still, do not underestimate me, or it will be the death of you. Just a friendly warning.
Now, I will have your name, or I will have your head mounted on a pike.
Such confidence is admirable, especially in one of the elven race. Still, do not underestimate me, or it will be the death of you. Just a friendly warning.
There is a possibility that you might be telling the truth, I suppose. What makes you think I would need to pay for your services? Mayhap, what I really want is a new slave.
There is a possibility that you might be telling the truth, I suppose. What makes you think I would need your friendship? Mayhap, what I really want is a new slave.
You may have reached me, but that does not mean you could hurt me. On the other hand, you do present an interesting point. My gnolls have not been as effective as I may have hoped.
But too often have I seen others in the past, trusting those who offer kind words of friendship, only to be betrayed.
I consider myself wiser than those fools, so it would take more than words to convince me that you are a worthy accomplice.
Tell me why you are really here. I find that coincidence or chance is the explanation of liars and politicians. Feel free to tell the truth; our meeting can end only one of two ways.
What a stunning deduction! You really are a genius, you know. I know you overheard at least part of my conversation with... my superior, so obviously you know I seek something.
But maybe you know what I am looking for some other way? Try being more open and honest with me about your goals. It could be that we have more in common than you might think.
I usually deal with such matters on my own. One must be vigilant of one's friends, lest they turn and loose their venom on you. The fate of traitors has always been death.
I have many enemies, though few that I fear. It is one's friends that one needs to be vigilant against, lest they turn and loose their venom on you.
Is there a particular enemy you had in mind, or were you aiming at being vague in hopes that I might reveal more information?
Pah! That old fool? He is no longer of any consideration to me. From what I have heard, he will be no more worry to anyone soon.
However, you have perked my interest. What exactly do you have to do with Drogan? I have heard things about his school, including the description of one like you.
<FirstName>, the <race> student, I believe. Yes, I was blind before, but I see you now. I have done my research and I know my enemies.
You are a small, petty fool, and you will die a most ignoble death!

Would you offer to help me? Well, I suppose I have indirectly assisted you before. It was my gnolls who attacked the kobolds that invaded your village. I even recovered your master's magic dragon tooth.
With a common enemy, maybe we can work together, despite the disdain with which I must hold your master in. Since I hold my own... superior in similar disdain, I hope you can forgive my attitude.
What have those meddling fools got to do with me? They should not even know of my existence. Come tell me what you know of them.
Satisfy me that they are your enemy too, or else prepare to meet a swift end.
No, I am not. I am what is known as a Daemonfey, sun elves bred with demons to produce my family. You are very perceptive.
Of course, since our existence is a secret, I am afraid I shall have to destroy you so completely that you could not even be resurrected. Goodbye fool.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You are a poor liar. I bet you are in league with those bloody meddlers. I know Drogan is one of them; perhaps you are one of his students?
It matters not. Your fate was sealed the moment you mentioned Harpers. Goodbye fool.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> You hunt Harpers? Now that is the kind of pastime I could truly enjoy.
There are some artifacts I seek that the harpers have been protecting. I was unable to acquire them before an old ally betrayed me and attacked the harper school where they were being held.
I know that name! That meddling elf-bitch has interfered in our plans before. If she is hunting you then you just led her right to my secret bolthole!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I know that name! That meddling elf-bitch has interfered in our plans before. If she is hunting you then you just led her right to my secret bolthole!
I have no patience for such idiocy. All Ayala will find here is your dead body!
What? You think I fear a pathetic fool like that? He has fewer brains than a goat. I am hardly surprised if he has petty ambitions to regain control of his tribe.
He shall be dealt with, in my leisure. No, I am hardly impressed and this conversation is beginning to bore me. Speak quickly, or this interview will end at the same moment as your life.
And what would these things be? Do you have a pretty flower to offer me? Do not think I am easily impressed.
I am sure it will be, but you will not be alive to witness that day.
That traitorous serpent that dares to bear the noble title of dragon? Do not think that by mentioning that name you win your way into my good graces.
Do you serve him? If not, then how do you know him?

"The frightful king of winter ruled from his crystal splinter, and all around would bow to him alone. If one misspoke a single word, and the mighty dragon overheard, frozen death from him was quickly blown."
That is a line from an epic, written about Tymofarrar's sire many years ago. Although in many ways Tymofarrar has yet to reach such heights of power, still he is a deadly foe.
Would you pit yourself against the might of this young wyrm? Are you so brave, or foolish?
An interesting choice, but one which does not fit with my present needs. No, I am afraid you will simply not be of much use to me.
As I cannot simply allow you to walk out of my secret bolthole, I am afraid this is your unlucky day. But then again, I find people usually make their own luck.
Goodbye, foolish one.
I wish I could know for certain whether your confidence is the result of competence or foolishness. Perhaps it is a bit of both.
Your plan does fit well into my own personal desires, so if you are interested, I can offer you some assistance. There is a price for my help, of course.
I seek an artifact in the shape of a tower. Tymofarrar has stolen this tower from its rightful owner, and I want it. I will provide a powerful magical item to help you kill Tymofarrar.
Do not try to play me for a fool! I will not tolerate such attitude. I am J'nah, as you just overheard. I warn you now; do not underestimate me, or you will surely perish.
Now, if you are finished trying to deceive one who is far smarter than you, you may tell me who you are.
So, you are the one who killed Tymofarrar. Do not be surprised that I know this already; I watched you do it with my magic.
I am Daemonfey; elf bred to demon, so my magic is very powerful. Of course, until recently we have been imprisoned.
It is one of those long, tragic tales that elven bards will often go into great detail about. But the past is irrelevant. I do not suppose you care to hear about me anyways.
Oh dear, I hate to tell you this, but I am afraid I cannot just allow you to walk out of here and tell others about me.
What is important is that we have awoken again; to find more of our elven kin are ready to join us. The first step we must take is to find powerful allies to aid us in destroying our enemies.
Soon we shall rise, with our demon and elf kin and Silverymoon shall be destroyed. We will conquer the Silver Marches, enslave the lesser races and begin our conquest of the Faerun!
I look forward to personally sacrificing Alustriel on my altar. I often dream of slitting open her throat and feeling her blood crawl down my hands. I wonder how sweet it shall taste?
<StartAction>[Sigh]</Start> But alas, my people are not yet ready to reveal themselves. Until we are ready, I am afraid that our secret must be closely guarded.
You have returned. Do you bring the tower with you?
Then there is no point in wasting my time. Go now, before I lose patience with you.
I hope that means you have brought me the tower. Tymofarrar's death brings me a small amount of pleasure, but the tower is what I must have.
What do you mean? He had to have it! His kobolds escaped my gnolls.

Then one of the kobolds must still have it. Well, I am sure I can track some foolish kobold down. I am just pleased that you were able to kill Tymofarrar, as he was the only one powerful enough, around here, to stop my plans.
Indeed? Well, I am sure I can track some foolish kobold down. I am just pleased that you were able to kill Tymofarrar, as he was the only one powerful enough, around here, to stop my plans.
And have you recovered the tower from Tymofarrar's servant?

Well, it is of no matter. I am sure I can track some foolish kobold down. I am just pleased that you were able to kill Tymofarrar, as he was the only one powerful enough, around here, to stop my plans.
Since you have proven to be capable, perhaps I should tell you a bit about me, and my plans; that is, if you are interested.
Oh dear, I hate to tell you this, but I am afraid my plans have changed, now that Tymofarrar is dead. I cannot just allow you to walk out of here and tell others about me.
No, I think that your life is about to come to a sudden and very tragic ending. Goodbye, sweet fool.
Do not be so impatient, <FirstName>. You will get your well-deserved reward in due time. Now, do you care to learn something?
Very well, I shall give you your reward.
My people are known as the Daemonfey, a powerful race created through the interbreeding of sun elves and demons. Unfortunately, until recently we have been imprisoned.
It is one of those long, tragic tales that elven bards will often go into great detail about. But the past is irrelevant.
What is important is that we have awoken again; to find more of our elven kin are ready to join us. The first step we must take is to find powerful allies to aid us in destroying our enemies.
I am afraid it is you that must be destroyed. You have been a useful, temporary ally, but I simply am not ready for the rest of the world to know of my existence.
Goodbye, foolish one.
Please, try not to interrupt me. It has been a long time since I was able to tell someone about all this. I wish to revel in our coming glory, but find myself forced to hide in secret boltholes.

But this shall soon end! We shall rise, with our demon and elf kin and Silverymoon shall be destroyed. We will conquer the Silver Marches, enslave the lesser races and begin our conquest of the Faerun!
I look forward to personally sacrificing Alustriel on my altar. I often dream of slitting open her throat and feeling her blood crawl down my hands. I wonder how sweet it shall taste?
<StartAction>[Sigh]</Start> But alas, my people are not yet ready to reveal themselves. Until we are ready, I am afraid that our secret must be closely guarded.
You are elven, so most likely you have heard the ancient tales of our beginnings. I am Daemonfey; elf bred to demon. Of course, until recently we have been imprisoned.
I do not know where you stand, but I wanted you to know exactly who you have been working for. It has become quite fashionable amongst many elves to study our past. But the past is not important.
My own brother betrayed me once. I escaped the carefully laid trap, unraveled his scheming and hunted him down.
It was strange; his heart tasted the same as all the others I have eaten. I guess I expected it would be bitter from all the deceit he practiced. I imagine yours will taste just as sweet.
I am seeking some artifacts.
None of your business.
No, I think I will just be going.
A dragon's tooth.
The only way I would trust you is if you were dead.
State your offer.
Ones that were stolen from my school.
I guess I had better go then.
You are lying, at least about some of it.
So you didn't recover any of them?
I know you have the tooth.
I might consider working with you, for the right price.
You can call me <Master/Mistress> of Shadows.
I am one who has come to end your evil!
Even your own followers say you are evil.
You stole Master Drogan's artifacts.
Tymofarrar told me what you are like.
You surround yourself with evil creatures.
You are evil and I must smite you.
I have no idea what you mean.
I suppose it is possible.
I was simply exploring. I enjoy a challenge.
So you already have the dragon's tooth?
What is in it for me, if I find this tower?
No, I think I will be leaving now.
I thought there were four artifacts.
Where would I find these artifacts?
He is not the one who has the tower.
I spoke to Tymofarrar and he thought you had the tower.
I found one of his servants, Deekin. He has hidden the tower.
He has hidden the tower and wants to be free of Tymofarrar.
No, Deekin has hidden the tower.
He's a stupid kobold and he broke the tower.
He is a kobold and he never returned the tower to Tymofarrar because he wants to be free.
A creature of great evil; the perfect quest!
I cannot face a dragon!
How would you suggest I defeat him?
And you expect me to face that?
Yes, I get it. Only use it near the dragon; now get on with it.
How does it work?
What is it?
I don't think I want to fight him.
I think I had better kill you instead.
What do I get out of this?
I will do it.
I will be going now.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> How about some gold up front?
I want to ask you some questions.
That is all my questions.
You are quite attractive. How about we spend a little private time together?
What would you say if I told you Tymofarrar sent me to kill you?
Now that I have something to help me defeat both of you, I think I will do just that.
I think I will kill you after all.
I will kill Tymofarrar for you.
What do you need the tower for?
What are you? You do not seem to be truly elven.
Why don't you use it then?
I come, bringing you a message from Tymofarrar.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - lie]</Start> He would like to arrange a truce.
He would like to see you chained to a stake, ready for supper. His supper.
He wants the artifacts you stole from him.
He wants you dead.
If you give me your artifact I will let you live.
Perhaps I should just kill you both!
What do you offer?
I will honor my deal with Tymofarrar.
I haven't decided if we are friends or enemies, yet.
Why should I tell you my name?
I am <FirstName>, a mercenary seeking employment.
My name is <FirstName>, J'nah. I'm interested in being friends.
It was too easy to reach you here. You need my protection.
Then I suppose I will have to kill you.
What could I do to prove myself?
I am here to kill you.
I believe you are looking for something.
I might be able to help you deal with your traitor.
You need an alliance against a common enemy.
I speak of the old dwarf, Drogan.
Now that introductions are in order, why don't we get down to business?
That information won't save your life.
I don't have to be an enemy.
I guess I'll be going now.
I will not work with you. I will destroy you!
Do you speak of Tymofarrar?
Tell me of this enemy.
I spoke of the harpers.
<StartHighlight>[Insight]</Start> You are not fully elven, are you?
<StartCheck>[Persuade - lie]</Start> I am hunting members of the Harpers and they are hunting you.
There are two harpers nearby; Drogan and a ranger known as Ayala.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - lie]</Start>We are both being hunted by a harper named Ayala.
I spoke of your gnoll chieftain.
I think there are other things that interest you.
Your death shall be impressive!
I was thinking of Tymofarrar.
One of his servants is hiding from him and I want to help.
I met him, but I was unimpressed.
He betrayed you and I would like to help you get your revenge.
I come as his messenger.
I want to kill him.
Maybe not.
If I had some help, I might.
I do not fear him.
That is my plan.
First, tell me who you are.
No thanks.
I guess I'll hear what you have to say.
I am very interested.
That is disgusting! Don't expect me to help.
That sounds quite pleasurable.
Not yet.
The dragon is dead.
Tymofarrar did not have it.
The tower was never returned.
A kobold named Deekin hid it.
One of his servants kept it.
Not yet.
I hoped maybe you had found him.
I cannot find Deekin.
No, goodbye.
I think I will kill you instead.
No, I want my reward now.
I demand my reward, right now!
Fine, tell me.

Oh, not *this* again. Either you have some trick up your sleeve or this will be a very short and painful encounter, little one.
I've already spoken as much about J'Nah as I wish to, warmling.
Is that so? You wish to speak about the elven witch?
I've already spoken about how J'Nah foiled my plan to acquire all the artifacts, warmling. I have but a useless mask... if any have these items you seek, it is her.
The artifacts from the human village? Indeed?
Ah, yes. Deekin's name comes up once again, does it? So what about him, then?
Yes, yes, it's been mentioned to me that Deekin wishes to be free. How very wonderful for the free-spirited little traitor.
I might be willing to discuss the matter with you. I want to know first, however... what do you know of J'Nah?
I don't see why I should discuss anything at all with you, seeing as you're involved with J'Nah. Or are you?

Ahhh, I suppose I should not be so sore with the little lad. I really should never have sent him off to steal those artifacts, really.

Let me take that off your hands... and here, take this as a token. I'm sure it's worth more than a simple kobold stick to you.

Oh, fine, fine. Run along and don't bother me, then. Why you even came here is a mystery to me, I'm sure.
My, but you're a single-minded one, aren't you? I do hope you have something up your sleeves, lest I be overcome with deja vu.
Oh. So it is. Is it time to appoint another Master Jumper already? That would explain why the way up to their caves has been closed for so long.
Let me take that off your hands... and here, take this as a token. I'm sure it's worth more than a simple kobold stick to you.

Hmph. So J'Nah made you a counter-offer, did she? How very typical. For your sake, warmling, I hope she armed you well!
I see. You've decided to go through with your arrangement with J'Nah after all? A pity. I hope she armed you well, warmling.
Then what are you waiting for? Off you go. Shoo. You have much to do.

And I promised that I would not only release Deekin but give you more, as well. If you've thought of something else you want, we can discuss it once J'Nah is dead.

Ahhh, good. I do so love the sight of gold.

<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Hmmm. While it's not worth much to me, it *is* part of my horde. If you would like it, I'm willing to let you negotiate for it.

You asked that Deekin be released. I say it is done. Give this... doll... back to Deekin. He shall know what it means.
You asked first for gold and magic. I believe this should be acceptable... at least for a start, yes?
You have done me a good turn, my intrepid little <race> <man/woman>. In return I shall do you one: your death shall be swift and relatively painless.
That's rather accepting of you, my little friend. Any last words before we proceed?
Tsk tsk. You needn't be such a poor sport, warmling. I certainly hope you'll be at least a little bit of a challenge... I could use the exercise.

Pfah. I am too tired and cautious to play with upstart small races all day. Have it your way, warmling... you get one reward from me. Name it.

<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Hmph. I don't like how that sounds. You are being very slippery, little warmling, impugning my draconic pride.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> What?! She said this, did she? Hmph... of all the nerve, maligning my draconic heritage, I should... oh wait, you already did that...

I also agreed to work with J'Nah, didn't I? Alas, I'm a greedy dragon that isn't about to part with treasure unless I absolutely must.
You are still due a reward from me, my little friend. Come... tell me what you wish, and let there be no hard feelings between us.
Yes? What is it that you wish now, warmling?
