Well, well, well. A little intruder, is it? <StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start> Alright, let's get a look at you, then.
Hmmmn... mmmm... yes, interesting. Are you quite aware that you're a <race> <man/woman>, warmling?
Oh, the usual. You humans have a bit of a smell to you, odd as it is. Nothing as offensive as an orc's... more like a rabbit's. Yes, more like that.
And do not think I missed that display of insolence, little one. Fortunately for you, when all you've got for company is kobolds you're often willing to overlook such foibles in your other guests.
Now, let's see... it's been a while since I saw my last human. Your type breeds so quickly, however, I suppose it was inevitable.
Hmmm. And you've come pretty much alone, have you? Very interesting.
So! What are you supposed to be, little <race> <man/woman>? I was thinking that you were perhaps the knight of a great kingdom, but then it occurred to me I may as well ask.
While that is true enough, I *was* enjoying myself with the diversion. It's not every day I encounter a sentient who isn't screaming in abject terror, you know.
So! Enough of what I want. I'd like to find out what you want, warmling. Surely you came here for a reason?
You wish us to work together, do you? Or do you desire to work for me? More likely you desire me to assist you with something you cannot accomplish on your own.
As interesting a proposition as that sounds, I find it difficult to believe that you came all the way down here on the off-chance I was in an agreeable mood.
There is another reason for your appearance in my cave, warmling, and I wish to hear it.
Mmm. I don't much care for being threatened, little one. You'd best have something to back up that insolent mouth of yours, or perhaps you should shut it.
Ah. The dwarven wizard. You are associated with him in some manner, then? Yes, I should have suspected something like this.
J'Nah. <StartAction>[Growl!]</Start> How the mere name of that creature fills me with bile. The sheer audacity! The temerity! It is an affront to my draconic stature, I tell you!
You seem to imply that I regret any actions I have taken to get back at that elven witch. In truth, the only thing I regret is consorting with her in the first place.
Perhaps much, perhaps little. Regardless, the topic of the elven witch has been broached and I shall grumble about her at my leisure.
You are the one who brought the elven sorceress up, little one, not I. And now I shall speak of her at my leisure.
The elven witch sent you to deal with me, did she not? All I wish is to relate the tale of what lies behind our conflict.
J'Nah first approached me two moons ago, sending a letter introducing herself and making a proposal that she knew I would find hard to resist.
There were magical artifacts of great power within easy reach, she said, guarded by a dwarven wizard. Working together we could overcome him.
All she desired in return for her aid, she claimed, was a single artifact... the rest I could keep for myself.
A statue of a tower, I believe. I imagine now it is the only artifact with any real worth.
I agreed to her terms, and found out after my kobolds returned from the raid that she had *dared* to attack them! She tried to take all the artifacts herself!!
Try to keep up with me, warmling. Yes, it is J'Nah who commanded the gnolls to attack my kobolds. I had, after all, sent them in early to take all the artifacts for myself.
Exactly. I wanted to see this tower statue for myself before I even considered releasing it to her. Why would she want it, after all, unless it was the best?
I am a dragon and I will not allow myself to be tricked by a mere lesser being. The fact that she attacked my minions only proves her deceitful intent.
Tell me... what do *you* know of J'Nah, little one? For all I know you could have been sent here by her.
Speaking of which, it was you who mentioned the witch's name. Why is that, I wonder? Did she send you here, little one?
Truly? Now that, my little friend, is a fortunate thing... for both of us.
There is a saying amongst dragons, warmling. It goes thus: "Sweet as blood, rich as flame, rarer than gold this deadly game." Do you know what it speaks of?
Err... no. No, it speaks of revenge, of course. Cold, sweet revenge.
It speaks of revenge, of course. Cold, sweet revenge.
Very good. Revenge, indeed.
I desire vengeance upon J'Nah. Kill her for me, little one, and you shall be rewarded.
Such words are pleasant to hear. Very well, little one... a bargain it is.
Here... I am giving you a flask full of powder. Use it on J'Nah and she will be severely weakened. It plays havoc, you see, with her... unique physiology.
Another gift for you. This is a key... do you see that square-shaped rock beside the wall? Use the key on it and you will be brought straight outside.
Head south of these mountains into the region you call the High Forest. There is a cave of gnolls there which J'Nah rules.
Go and do what you must, warmling. I wish you luck.
You should know where J'Nah's cave lies, yes? Go there and do what you must, warmling. I wish you luck.
Should you refuse? Why... then I suppose I would decide to be upset over the great number of kobolds you no doubt have slain in order to get here.
Well, I *am* a dragon, my little friend. There is no reason for us to go that route, however, is there? I can reward you so well.
Now that is a fair question, naturally. I would not expect you to perform such a feat on my behalf without some sort of compensation.
Do you wish gold? Magic? What sort of reward interests you, warmling?

Ahhhh, poor Deekin. For such a little kobold he has very big dreams. Very foolish dreams, to be sure, but dreams nonetheless. I should never have sent him away.
But if you wish him freed, it will be done. That and other rewards as well, for his freedom is but a small, small thing.

Now will you do as I ask, hmmm?
Indeed. You're welcome to it... that and other rewards, too, as I hardly think the mask is suitable by itself.
Mmm. I only possess that useless mask, and you're welcome to it... that and other rewards, too, as I hardly think the mask is suitable by itself.
Ahhh... I see. Very well, warmling. It is a small price to pay... there are plenty of humanoids in these mountains to keep me fed and my kobolds occupied, I am sure.
Especially considering I didn't keep it with J'Nah, yes, I see your point.
Perhaps this will assure you of my sincerity: you have my oath on the draconic blood of my white ancestors that you shall be rewarded as promised and left unharmed.
Do not question my word further, warmling. Such an oath is not given lightly even amongst the most evil of my brethren. Now... do you agree to my task?
Do not question my word further, warmling. Such an oath is not given lightly even amongst the most evil of my brethren. Now... do you have a reward in mind, even?
I would be willing to free Deekin from my service, for instance. Does that interest you?
<StartAction>[Chuckle!]</Start> Poor little Deekin, is it? Very well, warmling... what else might you ask of me? Gold? Magic?
<StartAction>[Chuckle!]</Start> Very well, you'll have that and other rewards as well, for his freedom is but a small thing.
I will tell you where to find her, naturally.
I will give you something that will make killing the sorceress much easier, of course. You did not think I would send you in empty-handed, did you?
Ahhh, now that is an excellent question. I imagine I very well could do such a thing... hunt down the little villainess and exact my revenge personally.
J'Nah, however, has... superiors. Superiors who wield a great deal of power. I would rather not anger them, if I can avoid it.
I do not know for certain. I can only suspect. Still... I would rather the risk be yours than mine. I'm certain you understand.
Bah! No truce! There shall be no peace between us!
Why the witch would send you on such a fool's errand I do not know. I, however, have a different offer for you... if you would consider it.
I see. That is good, for it gives me an idea.
Hmmm. I sense that you lie to me, little one. But no matter. If you are deceitful, perhaps you will consider a proposal from myself?
I see. That is good, for it gives me an idea.
I see. But I do not have the statue... only a useless mask. Tell me, little one... would you be open to a proposal of a different sort?
I see. But, as I have already said, I do not have the statue. Tell me, little one... would you be open to a proposal of a different sort?
Mmm. Then I eat you, of course. I rather thought that would be obvious.
And? Do you intend to go through with such a hopeless mission, little one? Or are you open to... negotiation?
And here you are, sent by the witch to kill me. Do you intend to go through with the hopeless mission, little one? Or are you open to... negotiation?
Ah. I do hope you have something to back up that impertinent mouth of yours, warmling, or this could be a short battle indeed.
I'm afraid not, little one. You've bored me, I fear.
That is a fortunate thing... for both of us.
<StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start> Sadly, no, just a mask with no real power. I wanted to see that tower statue for myself before I released it... why would she want it, after all, unless it was the best?
<StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start> As I already said, just the mask. I wanted to see that tower statue for myself before I released it... why would she want it, after all, unless it was the best?
And what is the relevance of that? I wanted to see this statue for myself before I even considered releasing it. Why would she want it, after all, unless it was the best?
No, I don't believe so. Not that I cared. I sent my kobolds in early to take all the artifacts for myself, but she showed great temerity in attacking me back!
Indeed. I had sent in my kobolds early in order to take all the artifacts for myself. But what does that matter? How dare she attack me!
I do not believe that was her intent. I had sent in my kobolds early to take all the artifacts for myself. It was she that had the gall to actually attack me for it.
I had sent in my kobolds early to take all the artifacts for myself. I had not planned on giving her anything. But she had the distinct gall to actually attack me for it.
Indeed. The tower statue.
Laugh if you wish, little one. The elven sorceress has provoked my wrath more than any other creatures has ever dared.
Hmph. I could not care less what the elven witch thinks. She goes too far with this insult!
Correction: I sent the kobolds to steal artifacts, not to attack the human village. Kobolds being what they are, however, I'm sure they got carried away.
Not that I'm very concerned over the matter, but just how is it that you know these were *my* kobolds? This isn't the only cave of kobolds in these mountains, warmling.
Clever, clever <race> <man/woman>. Lucky for you I am not concerned over the matter, or I would be angry at being outsmarted by someone so small.
So Deekin told you about me, did he? That is not so very surprising. I should never have sent him on the mission to the human village in the first place.
Mmm. I must say that this entire business with the artifacts has been rather irritating. I never really needed them to begin with, and acquiring them has been more difficult than I'd have liked.
All that effort, for instance, and what do I end up with? A mask that I cannot even use. J'Nah lied about the power these objects hold... and a great many other things, as well, I am certain.
Ahhh, Deekin. My finest experiment, really. You can lead a kobold to water, but can you make him think?
At first I thought I would never be able to teach the little lad anything at all. All he would do is cower about me and cry "Master!" if I so much as twitched.
But he improved remarkably with time. Obviously you've encountered him somewhere in the world above, yes? Tell me: where is he now?
Not very. Keep your information if you wish, I'll track down little Deekin eventually... it's of no great concern.
But you said you wished to talk about Deekin, didn't you? What about him?
That's very silly. Deekin doesn't want me dead... not truly. I know the lad quite well. This is all about him being free again, isn't it?
So take it from him. What do I care? Why would you need to come all this way to tell me that?
Ahhhh, poor Deekin. For such a little kobold he has very big dreams. Very foolish dreams, to be sure, but dreams nonetheless. I should never have sent him away.
No? I could force the answer out of you, I'm sure, if I truly desired it. But I don't just yet... and we've been having such a pleasant discussion, why ruin it?
<StartAction>[Sniff! Sniff!]</Start> Hmmm. I smell a lie on you, warmling. Why would you lie on little, insignificant Deekin's behalf, hmm? No matter.
Hiding in a human village? How very odd. Well, so be it... I'll simply have to retrieve him sometime, if he hasn't gotten himself killed already, that is.
Oh. So it is. Is it time to appoint another Master Jumper already? That would explain why the way up to their caves has been closed for so long.
Let me take that off your hands... and here, take this as a token. I'm sure it's worth more than a simple kobold stick to you.
Now I'm sure you came down here for a better reason than to turn over some stick you probably killed for, hmm?
No? Well, that's very sad. I do so enjoy being amused.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> <StartAction>[Sniff! Sniff!]</Start> Truly? I don't catch the barest whiff of magic in you, even. Now that is quite a talent, warmling, I'll admit. I am impressed.

<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> <StartAction>[Sniff! Sniff!]</Start> Yes, well... I can smell magic on you, warmling, but you're no Elminster the Sage. Make no mistake, though, I'm still quivering in my scales.
Oh dear. Trying to negotiate with the puritanical can be such a bother. At least you look like a knight. I shall just pretend, if it's all right with you.
So what does that mean? I don't even rank a proper knight from an actual kingdom? <StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start> No offense, warmling, but a dragon has to have his standards.
Mmm. A religious type, are you? Would you believe an orc convert to Cyric once attempted to proselytize me? I believe he's still in a block of ice around here.
Nature has servants? Do you do her laundry, then? Does she wake you in the night to fetch her cake? Oh, you needn't glare, warmling... I am only teasing you.
Did you say "martial" arts? I must admit I've never heard of such an odd thing. Does that mean you use your hands? Those little appendages? Seriously?
Yes, well, not to insult the great amount of effort I'm sure you put into your castings, but that's nothing new in these parts. Even kobolds carry a little draconic blood in them, you know.
Is that so? Are you here searching for a dragon's treasure horde, then? If that were the case, one would think it odd that you'd announce such to the dragon, no?
At any rate... I realize this may not be your forte, warmling, but might you indulge a bored dragon with a song, perhaps? The kobolds are simply awful at such things, you see.
Well in that case forget I asked. I once had a troglodyte attempt a song-and-dance routine that... let's just say the nightmares were not worth it.
At any rate... I've heard that elven folk are gifted with a flair for poetry and such. Might you indulge a bored dragon with a little entertainment, hmmm?
Hmmm. Tempting, but no. I've heard too many long and rambling tales as of late... I'd likely fall asleep, and then what would you get up to?
Truly? I'm rather fond of bards, to tell you honestly. Music, poetry, tales of adventure... all of them make the long years pass that much more enjoyably.
Seeing as you're a bard, perhaps you'll agree to play me a little song? Something to lift a bored dragon's spirits, hmmm? I could use the entertainment.
Have it your way, warmling. Though I can't say I am not disappointed. <StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start>
Mmm. Perhaps a little, although I do so enjoy a good song.
My, my, my. Now that is a fine talent you have there, warmling. Much better than the so-called entertainment I used to get.
Here... take this. Consider it a trinket of favor bestowed upon you by a grateful patron of the arts, yes?
And let's see... hmmm. You're not alone, either, are you? Most interesting.
But enough of that. What else do you have with you? Mmmm. A dwarven woman, is it? A beardless dwarven woman, no less.
You act aged and superior, dragon, but I can see your true age. Do not think that all who are small are also short of wit.
A good thing for you, too, little one, else you'd barely possess the intelligence to carry your weapon, mm?
Mock me if you wish, dragon. I am not frightened of you.
Frightened? Why ever should you be frightened? We are merely conversing here, aren't we? Like civilized sentient beings, yes?
But enough of that. What else do you have with you? Mmmm. A half-orc with bad taste in clothing, I see.
Wha-aat? I am to be judged by an overgrown lizard that lives in a cave? I think not!
Mind your manners, little one. I've never found that poor taste equaled poor taste, if you get my meaning. Still... there is all that orcish blood to get past.
Are you suggesting you would eat the great Xanos?!
Ugh. Not unless I had to, that's for certain.
And that's about it, is it? Hmmm. I wonder if I should be insulted or pleased at such a poor showing.
Now, then, let's see. Hmmm. You've others here, as well. Well, that's to be expected, I suppose.
Now, then... what else do you have with you? Mmmm. A dwarven woman, is it? A beardless dwarven woman, no less.
I believe I had a pair of your grey brethren tunnel their way in here several years ago. Rather stubborn, they were. Stringy, too, not half as tender as I prefer.
I've always wondered... why does your kind not mix blood with the elves? Or the dwarves? Or the gnomes, now there's a thought. Never mind, keep your secrets.
I wonder... when was the last time I saw one of your kind? Elves, yes. Humans, yes. But the only place they've mixed was in my stomachs.
Hmmm. The last elf I saw was... well, now, it was a whole army of elves, wasn't it? I don't recall what they were so upset about, but there you have it.
When was the last time I saw a gnome? Hmmm. Some of your grey-kin spilled into my cavern a long time ago, I believe. Rather bland and chewy, to be honest.
Hmmm. When was the last time I saw one of your kind? I seem to remember halflings as crunchy yet unfilling, but I don't remember how.
Are you joking? I've yet to meet a dwarf who didn't smell like a slab of rock and look the part, as well. I must say I've seen better beards, however.
Well, the smell, for starters. It's rather unique, and not all the human blood in Faerun will hide it much.
It's difficult with your kind, but I'd have to go with the ears. Sometimes they're hard to spot, however, with all that shaggy human hair your people possess.
Oh, the usual... the ears, the slight bone structure, that sense of superiority etched into your facial expression. Oh, don't bother denying it.
It's true, I thought you were perhaps a halfling at first. The nose is a bit of a giveaway, I'm afraid. Are you gnomes sensitive about such things?
The diminutive stature and the oddly-shaped head, if you must know. Why, you're no larger than one of my tiny kobolds, are you?
You needn't get so excited, little one. It's hard enough to tell the small races from one another even without all your silly in-breeding, so don't get angry at me.
Of course I have. If I'd never seen one of you, I wouldn't be able to identify you now, would I? Though I admit all the in-breeding does get confusing.
Nothing wrong with *your* eyes, I see. The name is Tymofarrar, little one. You may add on "the White", "the Magnificent" or any other appellation you feel matches my grandeur.
So it knows my name, does it? How very interesting. Does this mean I've become famous in the world above? Have you come to worship me adoringly?
No, your kind never does, does it? Not since the really olden days, of course, but let's not jest with ourselves. Those days are long over.
Hmmmn... mmmm... yes, interesting. Are you quite aware that you're an <race> <man/woman>, warmling?
Then get upset. I've come to kill you, dragon.
<StartAction>[Break the Ice Phylactery]</Start> I've got something up my sleeve alright!
I want to talk about J'Nah.
I want to talk about the artifacts you stole.
I want to talk about Deekin.
I think this rod is yours.
Never mind that. I'm here to kill you, dragon.
And if I haven't changed my mind?
Err... then I'll just go back the way I came...
Then you leave me no choice. We fight.
And what would I get if I agreed?
Which proposal is that?
I think this rod is yours.
Actually, I've decided to kill you instead.
<StartAction>[Break the Ice Phylactery]</Start> I'm armed well, indeed.
No, she's not dead yet.
I've been thinking about my reward...
I want to be sure, first, that you'll honor your deal.
<StartAction>[Lie]</Start> It's done. J'Nah is dead.
It's done. J'Nah is dead.
That's enough. I don't want anything.
The time has come for you to die.
I do not want any more "rewards" from you.
Perhaps you're right.
<StartAction>[Break the Ice Phylactery]</Start> My reward will be your death!
I want whatever artifacts you stole from Hilltop.
Give me the mask artifact.
I want you to act as Hilltop's guardian against danger.
I want you to leave Hilltop alone from now on.
I want Deekin released from your service.
I want more gold and magic.
I would like gold and magic.
The time has come for you to die.
I would like to negotiate for the mask artifact.
Forget it.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> That's a little steep for something you don't want.
Very well. 300 gold it is.
Done. Here you go.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I need that mask artifact, as well.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I want whatever artifacts you stole from Hilltop.
Is there enough in the chest to free Deekin?
I would like to negotiate for Deekin's freedom.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Would you consider releasing Deekin from your service, as well?
I should go.
I believe this rod is yours?
Yes, we're through.
But I don't want you to leave Hilltop alone... I want you to guard it from danger.
Why not? Are you saying you can't do it?
Not always, just if it's ever threatened again.
You gave your oath, remember?
You did promise that Hilltop would be safe.
Forget it, then. I'll ask for something else.
No! That's not good enough!
That will have to do.
Uh-oh...
I figured as much. Have it your way, then.
<StartAction>[Break the Ice Phylactery]</Start> How about "phylactery"?
You traitorous creature! I'll kill you for this!
<StartAction>[Break the Ice Phylactery]</Start> How's this for a challenge?
<StartCheck>[Intimidate]</Start> I'm warning you... attack me and I use this phylactery!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Is this really necessary? Can't we talk this over?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> You know, this is just what J'Nah warned me you would do...
J'Nah told me you couldn't be trusted.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> But you're so intelligent, I was sure you could be reasoned with that all this isn't necessary...
<StartCheck>[Persuade/Bluff]</Start> So J'Nah was the more trustworthy of you two.
<StartCheck>[Persuade/Bluff]</Start> So she was right. You aren't noble and benevolent like other dragons.
But I thought you wanted J'Nah dead!
But you agreed to reward me!
Nothing. I should go.
What was your first clue?
What I am isn't important.
I'm hoping we can work together.
I'm here to kill you, actually.
I will destroy you, dragon. Let's end this now.
<StartAction>[Break the Ice Phylactery]</Start> I have something to back up my threat, all right!
You're responsible for nearly killing Master Drogan!
You must pay for sending your kobolds to attack Hilltop!
J'Nah may have sent me to kill you, but that doesn't mean I will do it.
I want to talk about J'Nah.
Are you trying to shift responsibility for what you've done?
What does this have to do with me?
Why? What did this J'Nah do?
Which artifact was that?
J'Nah commands the gnolls, then?
Smart move on your part.
Actually, I killed her.
J'Nah is my enemy, as she is yours.
I don't know.
Umm... life?
Umm... death?
Umm... gems?
Power?
Murder?
Revenge?
Revenge, of course.
Very well. I agree.
And should I refuse?
Then you leave me little choice. I agree.
Then I refuse. I would rather kill you, beast.
What do I get if I agree, then?
You would attack me?
What do I get for doing this?
I'll think of something later.
Magic interests me.
Gold sounds like a good start.
I want Deekin freed from your service.
I want the mask artifact.
I want any of the artifacts you took from Hilltop.
I want Hilltop to be safe.
How do I know you'll even keep your word?
It's a good start.
Not really, no.
Yes, Deekin must be freed.
And where do I find this J'Nah?
And just how would I be able to kill her?
Why not kill her yourself?
Who are these superiors of hers?
And what if I said I already killed her?
<StartAction>[Lie]</Start> She sent me to arrange a truce between you.
No, but I've heard of her.
<StartAction>[Lie]</Start> No, but I've heard of her.
She sent me to retrieve the tower statue.
And if I'm not?
I guess I'll hear your proposal, then.
Not if I kill you first, you won't.
She sent me to kill you, actually.
I can't back out, now. I have to kill you.
Wait! I've changed my mind!
I never intended to do as she asked, anyhow.
I'm willing to listen to what you have to say.
But you didn't get all the artifacts, right?
So you broke your deal with her?
So she lied about only wanting the tower statue?
But she said it was you who betrayed *her*.
But all J'Nah wanted was the tower statue. Why try to take the rest?
But why attack you if the deed was already done?
The tower statue.
The two of you don't get along, do you?
Odd. She says you deserve to die for the same reasons.
I suppose it's a good thing I killed her, then?
You sent those kobolds to attack Hilltop!
I have my sources.
I followed their tracks back here, actually.
J'Nah told me all about it.
Deekin told me about you.
You just told me. That's how I know.
I want to talk about the artifacts you stole.
I'm here to talk to you about Deekin.
How badly do you want to know?
Deekin wants you dead.
Deekin said you sent the kobolds to attack Hilltop.
He has an artifact that I need.
Because I'm here to kill you so I can get it.
Deekin's hidden it. He won't give it to me unless I prove to him you're dead.
Deekin's hidden it. He won't give it to me unless you free him from your service.
I don't understand. Aren't you trying to collect all the artifacts?
He wants to be free of your service.
I'm not going to tell you that.
<StartAction>[Lie]</Start> I believe he's deep within the High Forest.
He's probably hiding in Blumberg.
I believe this rod is yours?
I am not here to amuse you, dragon!
<StartCheck>[Persuade/Bluff]</Start> I am a great and powerful mage! You'd best beware.
I am a champion of law and justice above all else.
I may not be a knight, but I am a warrior.
I am a cleric, dragon. A servant of the gods.
I am a servant of nature, if you must know.
I am a master of the martial arts.
I am no knight. I am a wielder of the arcane arts.
I am a rogue, dragon, and nothing more.
I'm not certain I'd be better than your kobolds.
I could tell you a tale, if you're willing.
I can play you a song, if you wish.
I am a bard, if you must know.
I'd prefer to discuss matters seriously.
I will not be toyed with, dragon!
I do hope you're joking.
Play you a song? Certainly.
Of course I'm aware of that!
Have you never seen my kind before?
Err... you're a dragon, aren't you?
Are you Tymofarrar?
Yip, good thing chief be smart and no tries to kill you.
Yip, me remembers you! You speak to Chief, him will wants to speak to you, yip.
Yip! You talks to chief!
It is likely that this mechanism is here to help lift the boulder, but it seems to be missing the part to make the machine operational.
As you place the rod in the slot, you hear a loud rumbling as the machine comes to life.
Do nothing.
Place the Rod of Ruler in the slot.
The oxen snort in your direction, being typically ornery animals.
The ox has an itch right behind its ear and wishes you would just open the gate a little and come give it a nice scratching. It really thinks you might fall for this ploy to open the gate.
The ox waxes philosophical, wondering if it is really a butterfly dreaming it is an ox, or an ox dreaming it is a butterfly, dreaming it is an ox.

The ox wonders if you could just open the gate a little so it could go for a leisurely stroll. Despite its protests to the opposite, you are pretty sure it would immediately stampede across the bridge.
The ox wonders how stupid the kobolds must be, since they have been trying to breed the oxen, but there are no females in the herd.
The ox tells you that yesterday its good friend Tom was led off to the east and never returned. The week before it was Sam. He is almost positive ox-heaven might be just past the bridge.
The ox huffs about the lack of sunlight to nap in and the lack of delicious fresh grass.
The ox gazes at you with big, soft, oxen eyes and you sense the deep gratitude of the beast.
Hello ox.
On closer inspection, there appears to be a large and obvious keyhole carved into the center of this stone.
On closer inspection, there appears to be a large and obvious keyhole carved into the center of this stone. A large stone key seems to be stuck in the keyhole.
Do nothing.
Insert the stone key into the keyhole.
Turn the key.
On closer inspection, there appears to be a large and obvious keyhole carved into the center of this stone.
On closer inspection, there appears to be a large and obvious keyhole carved into the center of this stone. A large stone key seems to be stuck in the keyhole.
Do nothing.
Insert the stone key into the keyhole.
Turn the key.
Oh, it be you again! That not take very long. You gots good news for Deekin maybe?
Ummm... Deekin not want to be offensive, but Deekin gots big trouble believing that. You gots something to prove Master dead, maybe?
That big surprise? Someone say they kill dragon, you not asks for proof? Killing dragon happen every day where you comes from?
Then Deekin gots no choice. He gots to wait here until <CUSTOM1001> brings him proof. Deekin is sorry.
Mask? Oh... magic stuff we stole. Deekin not know Master even has mask... so how that be proof? Proof you steals back, maybe, but not proof Master be dead.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You think Deekin born yesterday? It not happen that someone kill big dragon every day... Deekin not think asking for proof very big deal.
So you gots proof or not? You say you kill old Master, Deekin say that pretty big claim.
Ahhh! You no loses cool now! Please please, <CUSTOM1001>! Deekin gladly give you statue... he just must be sure!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Ummm... okay, okay. Deekin take your word for it. You looks like you go through hell and back anyways...
...so this mean old Master is dead? He really dead!! Deekin be free, yay!! Deekin be free!
Deekin so happy! You waits here... Deekin get statue and be right back!
Ohhh? And, ummm, what he say, exactly...?
Uh-huh. Deekin thought so... <CUSTOM1001> just wants statue for free. Shames on you! Shames on <CUSTOM1001>!
Deekin just waits right here until you goes and does what he asks.
Well, that hurt Deekin's feelings, it does. But Deekin gots great confidence in abilities of <CUSTOM1001> to convince Old Master!
Oh! Goody! Then you go and does that and Deekin be free! Deekin so happy!
Deekin wait here until you goes and kills that one you say. Cannot be hard as dragon to kill, yes?
Old Master... give you Deekin's doll? <StartAction>[sniff!]</Start> Deekin all choked up now. Deekin really be free! Yay!!
Ummm... yup, that sound like Master, alright. He not gives you doll, maybe? Ahh, is no matter. Deekin free now! Yay!!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> And, ummm... he not gives you anything to gives to Deekin?
Deekin gots hard time believing that you tells the truth. Old Master would gives you something if he say Deekin free.
No no! Please no hurt Deekin! Deekin just want not to be afraid anymore! Please... <CUSTOM1001> talks to old Master, please! Then Deekin give you statue, Deekin promises!
Aahh! Deekin so sorry! Deekin not mean to get <CUSTOM1001> upset! Please forgive little Deekin! Please please!
Oh. Deekin just ask little question of <CUSTOM1001>. Deekin not mean to make <CUSTOM1001> mad, no no! Deekin sorry!
Oh, that be okay. Deekin be very confident that <CUSTOM1001> comes through for Deekin in the end. That how all great stories go!
Maybe... maybe <CUSTOM1001> needs help from Deekin? Deekin help <CUSTOM1001> gladly! Anything <CUSTOM1001> wants!
Deekin didn't think so, but Deekin always willing to try his best. It is one of Deekin's better qualities... or so old Master used to always tell him.
Oh! Deekin knows much, he does! Deekin know all stories and songs, knows bardic lore like back of hand!
What does <CUSTOM1001> wants to know? Deekin, he tell you everything!
Ummm... you just gots to takes word of Deekin on that.
Deekin can describes little statue good. At least... Deekin remembers what it look like before it gets all broken.
But there be shiny little rock inside statue! How Deekin know that if he not gots it?
If <CUSTOM1001> wants to look for statue elsewhere, you can go do that... but you not finds it, and Deekin not be tricked to give it up before he good and ready!
Ummm... Deekin knows you looks for statue, but he not knows why. You tells Deekin then he knows.
You see for yourself when Deekin give you statue, Deekin not lies! You think Deekin not surprised when he see rock inside?
Oh. Well, it does got little shiny rock, Deekin swears. Deekin not know why statue had rock inside. Maybe it hide in there?
Deekin not know much. Deekin never see scary gnoll ever before they attacks us.
They runs out from forest and surrounds us. They say in snarly tongue that they wants all magic stuff we steals, or they kills us.
Urko think he so big and tough, he tell gnolls to blow idea out their hiney. Gnolls not like that. Ummm... last me remember, me fleeing into scary dead place.
Gnolls not come, no. Deekin not know why not. When Deekin sneak out later, gnolls all gone so Deekin run off as quick as he can.
Because they wants magic stuff? Deekin not know.
Kobolds is all Redclaw tribe. We lives in big caves in mountains to north, and old Master lives in bigger cave below us.
All of tribe works to make old Master happy, to keep his belly full. Big Chief and Master Jumper run tribe. Ice Hounds protect old Master.
Ummm... there be magic way in, but only old Master know how to use it. Deekin wishes he knew... sorry.
You think so? There be lots of kobolds. Master not thinks about us much... he always get more, easy.
Deekin not know, really. Deekin never need to try to come into cave... he live below with Master, remember?
But Deekin think there be lots of traps. What kobolds lack in big muscle and big magic they makes up for with big brains. Master call us "cunning worms" and he not kidding.
They be toughest of kobolds. Very mean and nasty to Deekin, they are. They kills anybody who come to bother Master.
Master Jumper is only kobold who can opens up passage to lower cave where old Master be. That make him very important.
Deekin know that Big Chief get jealous of Master Jumper sometimes, but he gots no choice. Master Jumper control who gets to see old Master.
Yup. He big shaman who run tribe, has great dragon blood inside him that make him powerful. He not so important as Master Jumper, though.
You wants to know about old Master? Okay, Deekin tell you what he know, for sure.
Long time. Long before Deekin born, that for sure. Years, maybe.
Deekin is little kobold. Everything seem powerful!
But, ummm, old Master be really big and old. Many generations of Redclaw tribe serves him. He gots powerful spells, too.
He be smart, too, but Deekin think <CUSTOM1001> be smarter. You win, Deekin be sure.

Mystra, the goddess of magic. You might have heard of her. Anything else?

First of all their teeth are too big. Now, if I was creating the world, I would have given them huge claws and retractable teeth, but the gods never really seem to ask my advice.
You see? That is exactly what I mean about questions. I could tell you my name, sure, but would I be telling the truth? You would have no idea.

<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> If it will stop your incessant questioning, then fine. My name is <FirstName>.
How do you know I have the same name as you? Perhaps <FirstName> is not really your name. Maybe you are lying to me.
But let us say for a minute that I had actually traveled to the small, unpleasant village of Hilltop to speak with an old acquaintance.
I might have heard the name, <FirstName>, and liked it so much that I adopted it as my own. The point being, I do not wish to tell you my name, so quit asking!
Sure, why not? It is a nice name. Do you have a problem with it?
I told you right up front that there was a good chance that I might lie about such a question. It is not my fault you did not listen. Besides, that might be my real name.
Good, now what else did you want to know?
Good. I will try to answer any question that does not infringe on my privacy.
If that is what passes for humor in the outer world, then I am glad to have chosen to ignore it. I can ignore you too if you would like.
However, I would rather you either made a purchase and left, or just left. I will answer no more of your questions.
Yes, go on; get out of here. And do not touch my recharging box, unless you have gold to pay for it.
Good.
One hundred gold for each charge.
You put in magic items that need more charges, and they are recharged. And then you pay me.
I charge 500 gold each time, and you can only go to a place you have been before.
Very well. I'll just take the gold and off you go.
Very well. I'll just take the gold and off you go.
Very well. I'll just take the gold and off you go.
Very well. I'll just take the gold and off you go.
What kind of confidence game are you trying to run here? You don't have that kind of gold!
Very well. I'll just take the gold and off you go.
That sounds like a meddling type of question. There is nothing wrong with me, I just do not like strangers, and <lad/lass>, you are stranger than most.
Because it seemed like an appropriate insult at the moment. Now, are you going to buy something, or did you just come to chatter inanely.
You again? What do you want this time <lad/lass>?
If you buy enough, maybe I won't have to go into Silverymoon this year. That would be nice.
You owe me <CUSTOM501> gold, for using my machine.
Trying to leave without paying me, huh? Well, you owe me <CUSTOM501> gold, so pay up!
Have a look then.
Then you will just have to sell me some items, and then pay me what you owe.
Anything else then?
Goodbye.
I won't.
How much does it cost?
What is a recharging box?
Would you be interested in buying a mummified hand?
No thanks.
I'll take it.
Would you be interested in buying a tower statue?
Would you be interested in buying a dragon's tooth?
Never mind.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> It must be worth more than that!
I'll take it.
I'll take it.
Would you be interested in buying a magical mask?
I'll leave it.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> This is a very valuable item. Surely you can offer me more?
I'll take it.
I'll take it.
Would you be interested in buying a dragon egg?
No thanks.
Yes.
I think you might be my problem, with an attitude like that.
I want to ask you some questions.
That's enough questions.
Who is the "Lady" you spoke of?
I am looking for some stolen magical artifacts. Has anybody tried to sell you any?
Do you have any powerful magic items?
I have other questions.
Do you know about the gnolls here in the forest?
Did you notice anything else about her?
Who are you?
<StartCheck>[Persuade - Intimidate]</Start> Tell me your name or I'll have to force it out of you!
I was just joking.
Sorry, my mistake.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Please, tell me your name.
You have the same name as me.
Really?
I think you are lying.
No, that is fine.
Fine, I'll ask you something else.
What name did your mother call you?
Goodbye.
I won't.
How much does it cost?
What is a recharging box?
I want you to teleport me somewhere.
Send me to my party leader.
Send me to the foothills.
Send me to the kobold caves.
Send me to Blumberg.
Send me to Hilltop.
Why are you so uptight?
Why do you say that?
Just show me what you have for sale.
Let me sell you something so I can get enough money.
I do not have enough gold.
Well let me see what I can sell you then.
Fine, I'll pay.

Who's going to clean this up? Not Riisi, no no!
What a mess! What a mess! Me-oh-my, what a mess!
Ooooh, Master Drogan will be so upset!
Hee hee! You not know how to get past the ward! Riisi does!
Oh my, what is this? Is it another kobold come to wreak havoc on Master's things? Well, Riisi will fight them, yes she will. She will protect her master's things this time!
No, no, no, it is someone I recognize. Gladdens my heart, yes it does. Hello there, <FirstName>.
Riisi says goodbye, but will she be missed? No, no, she will be sad and lonely until Master Drogan is better.
Riisi was in great danger, yes I was. I was here when the stupid, ugly kobolds stole Master's stuff, yes, yes, yes!
That is not such a nice way to greet me, <FirstName>, oh no it is not. We should be speaking in nice ways to each other, since we both serve Master, yes we do.
I am still being Riisi, oh yes, I am not dead, that is a good thing. But you should be knowing that kobolds stole Master's stuff, yes they did!
But <FirstName>, you cannot help, for they are gone, and that is sad. But Riisi feels something is wrong with the Master! Tell me what happened to him, please, oh please!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, no, no, Riisi can sense that Master is hurting, yes she can. She would go up to see Master, but he told her, 'Riisi, you stay here,' Yes he did!

<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Oh, Riisi is very glad to hear it. I was worried, oh yes I was. But you have put my mind to rest, yes, yes. Still, Riisi can feel Master has pain, even if he will be alright.
Oh no, oh no, poor, poor Master. Poor, poor Riisi. If Master dies then Riisi will be all alone. Riisi should go up to Master, yes she should.
But Master wanted Riisi to stay down in his laboratory, oh yes, that is what he said. And Riisi must obey kind Master.
Oh, <FirstName>, Riisi feels terrible right now. Maybe if we talk a bit you will make me feel better? Yes, yes, I love to talk! Do you want to hear a riddle?
Questions are not as good as riddles, unless the questions are riddles, but you ask and I will try to answer.
Then Riisi will go back to guarding Master's laboratory, yes I will. I will do a good job for dear Master. No more kobolds can enter here, no, no, no.
Riisi took some of Master's magic things and his key and hid them, yes she did! She hid them from nasty, ugly kobolds in a safe place. Kobolds do not get everything, no they did not!
But now Master is upset and Riisi is afraid that he will not be able to use the things Riisi saved. Oh, what is I to do, <FirstName>?
That is good, because they are Master's items and they do not belong to you, no they don't!
You want Master's magics just like kobolds did. Riisi could give you the items, but kobolds had magic powers to get past Master's ward.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You want Master's magics just like kobolds did. Riisi could give you the items, but kobolds had magic powers to get past Master's ward.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Well, you do not look too much like a kobold, no, no, no. Riisi could give you the items, but kobolds had magic powers to get past Master's ward.
<StartAction>[Gasp.]</Start> What if you be kobold in disguise? Oh me, oh my, then Riisi would be giving Master's magic things to kobolds and that would be very bad, yes, yes, yes!
Testing you, that is the only way Riisi can be sure you are not a kobold. Riisi will tell you riddles, and if you answer true, then you be smarter than a kobold and me give you magic for Master.
What you mean? You would attack your Master's familiar? Riisi knows what is going on, yes she does and you will not be tricking her, nasty little kobold!
Riisi will hide and you will not find her, no you will not! Because you cannot get past the wards, oh no, you cannot. You must try my riddles and prove you are not a kobold.
No, no, no, you may hate riddles, but it is the way Riisi can test you yes. If you want Master's items you must prove you be Master's apprentice.
Riisi will ask you three riddles, yes she will. You get all three riddles right and then I know you not be kobold in disguise.
Riisi likes numbers and I think kobolds too stupid to know them, so tell me, how many nines you use to count to one hundred?
Hmm, Riisi not realize that kobolds know how to count, but then I not know ugly kobolds could break Master's spell either. I better ask you another question, yes, yes, yes.
You must be kobold to be so stupid! Riisi will hide now and keep Master's magic safe.
Yikes! Riisi does not want to die, no she does not! Oh, Riisi is in big trouble now, yes, yes, she is! Oh, what a quandary! Oh, what a dilemma!
If Riisi gives you another chance to prove you no be a kobold, will <FirstName> let me live? Will <he/she>?
Oh, poor Master. Riisi can feel he is suffering and needs help. Maybe you are not a kobold. I will give you another chance, yes I will.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Riisi will not fall for that old trick, no she will not. She knows better than that. I will leave now, yes I will.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Oh, that is sometimes so true. I often forget just how smart Riisi is, yes I do! I guess Riisi could give you another chance.
This is so simple; how can you get it wrong? There are twenty uses of nine on the way to one hundred. How simple can you be?
Perhaps you slept through too many of master Drogan's lessons, <FirstName>, but the answer is twenty.
You answered one riddle correctly already, yes you did, so Riisi will just give you two more riddles to answer, because she is kind and caring, yes she is.
A prisoner is going to be killed and is told by executioner that him must make one statement. If his statement be true, then him will be drowned. If his statement be false, him will be hanged.
What statement can him make to confuse the executioner and not be killed at all?
You will not even guess? Why do you give up when it is so easy?
The executioner would agree with you and you would be drowned! That would not work, no, no, no.
Then the executioner would think you were lying and you would be hanged! That would not work, no, no, no.
Yes! Yes, yes, yes, that is the thing to say! Then the executioner cannot hang you, or you told truth and he should drown you. If him drowns you, then, you lied and should be hanged.
You be pretty smart; much smarter than kobold, I am thinking, but kobolds turned out to be smarter than me thought when them break Master's ward.
This is a hard riddle, so you should take your time to figure it out, yes you should. Are you ready?

There be an island, which is deserted, yes it is. This island has four fruit trees, each with a different kind of fruit. There be a group of wizards who visit the island each year, for they like it, yes they do.
Each wizard eats two types of fruit, but each group of two trees can only have one wizard in common, which means only one wizard can eat from the apple tree and the pear tree.
So, what you must be telling me is, how many wizards belong to this group?
That is very smart of you to know that. It took Riisi a long time to figure that one out. I guess you must be who you seem to be, and I will have to trust you to help Master.
I will go and fetch the items for you from my secret hiding place. Riisi hopes you will really help Master, <FirstName>.
That is not right, no, no, no. I do not know if I can trust you, so Riisi wants to go and hide, so she can protect what she has saved.
But Riisi feels that Master is very scared and is hurting and maybe you are the only one who can help him. Riisi must help you, even if you do not deserve it.
This is supposed to be a challenge? There can only be six wizards using this island, though the riddle itself is as foolish as any I have ever heard.
I am almost certain that the answer must be six. Yes, only six wizards are using the island.
What? The executioner would say you were telling the truth and he would drown you! That would not work, no, no, no.
You... you cannot get anything right. This is the second riddle you got wrong. Riisi is really wondering if you could be a kobold in disguise, yes she is.
Riisi is trembling with fear, yes she is, but I must go on. Will you try the third riddle?
Oh, terror and shivers afflict Riisi, yes they do. She does not make such a good guard for her master and now feels terrible, yes she does.
Riisi thinks that you are not a kobold, but really just a bad person, yes she does. If Riisi was not so worried about Master, she would not help you, no she would not.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You should not push me so hard, <FirstName>. I am trying to help you and keep Master safe at the same time.
You try one more riddle and see if you can do it. Then Riisi will help you, yes she will.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> It is true that this is not so much fun as Riisi had hoped. I suppose Riisi can trust you are not a kobold, just a really thick-witted <class>.
Riisi is glad you like riddles so much, but wishes you were better at them, yes, she does.
Ha! That is a famous old riddle, where I come from. A good rogue should always have a quick mind and a quicker tongue. 'I will be hanged," would baffle the executioner.
Have you no ability to use the least bit of logic, <FirstName>? He would have to tell the executioner that he will be hanged.
Kobolds no be in laboratory, no, not anymore. But Riisi was surprised how them got in.
I saw them coming to the laboratory and I knew they could not get across, and I thought it was going to be such fun watching them from behind the magic circle.
I was about to appear to them and taunt them, yes I was, but then they stopped and you would not believe what they did, no you would not. They threw dust on the circle.
It must have been magic dust, oh yes, or it would not have worked, no, no, no. Stupid ugly kobolds walked right over the symbol and looted all of Master's things.
Well, maybe not all of his stuff, no, no. There be some stuff left. Little bits of stuff that stupid kobolds not think would be important, or no could find.
But you want to know what is still in Master's laboratory, do you?
Oh, Riisi no can tell you that, no, no, no. Master never tells anybody that, except for Riisi. And now Master is upset, oh yes he is. Riisi can feel it, yes, yes, yes.
Master trusted Riisi to protect his treasures and now Riisi has failed. Never will Riisi fail Master again. You no ask to get in anymore, no, no, no!
No! What are you, stupid like kobold? Me said no and me mean no!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No! What are you, stupid like kobold? Me said no and me mean no!
But wait! Riisi knows what is going on, yes she does and you will not be tricking her, nasty little kobold!
You have a nicer way of speaking than a kobold, but I still see the truth.
You must be a kobold in disguise, that is what I mean. You will not be getting past me, nor will I bring the treasure to you!
Unless, maybe if Riisi could test you, then maybe she could bring you Master's items, yes, yes, yes. Maybe Riisi could ask you riddles, that would be good, yes it would.
You cannot get in the way the kobolds did, no you cannot. Riisi cannot even believe that kobolds did get in.
I saw them coming to the laboratory and I knew they could not get across, and I thought it was going to be such fun watching them from behind the magic circle.
I was about to appear to them and taunt them, yes I was, but then they stopped and you would not believe what they did, no you would not. They threw dust on the circle.
It must have been magic dust, oh yes, or it would not have worked, no, no, no. Stupid ugly kobolds walked right over the symbol and looted all of Master's things.
Well, maybe not all of his stuff, no, no. There be some stuff left. Little bits of stuff that stupid kobolds not think would be important, or no could find.
But you cannot get into Master's laboratory, no you may not.

Oh, it was terrible, yes it was. I was just having a nap and dreaming about a lovely meadow filled with flowers and butterflies. It was wonderful, <FirstName>, yes it was. Do you have dreams like that?
You are a very strange <man/woman>, <FirstName>, yes you are.
What a sad, sad life you live, yes you do.
Well, I was woken by a dreadful noise and I immediately turned invisible. When I saw that dreadful kobolds were in the house I thought Master Drogan would come here right away.
I saw them coming to the laboratory and I knew they could not get across, and I thought it was going to be such fun watching them from behind the magic circle.
I was about to appear to them and taunt them, yes I was, but then they stopped and you would not believe what they did, no you would not. They threw dust on the circle.
It must have been magic dust, oh yes, or it would not have worked, no, no, no. Stupid ugly kobolds walked right over the symbol and looted all of Master's things.
Well, maybe not all of his stuff, no, no. There be some stuff left. Little bits of stuff that stupid kobolds not think would be important, or no could find.
Oh, shame on Riisi! Shame, shame, shame! I hid. I was so scared and thought they were powerful kobolds, for they were the first to pass Master's magic.
Now Master will never trust Riisi again, oh no, he will not! Now Master will dismiss Riisi and she will have to leave and return to her home in disgrace.
Except that Master is very loving, and maybe Riisi can earn back his trust by never letting anyone in ever again! Yes, yes, yes, that is it. Riisi will be the best guard ever!
And try not to answer in riddles, little pest. Your mind is like a young puppy, chasing its tail in circles with no idea what it would do if it caught up and took a bite.
Riisi hears a voice, but she does not see where it is coming from. Could it be a ghost?
Oh wait, way down there! It is a voice from a bump in the ground. Riisi did not know that small lumps of dirt could speak, no she did not.
Yes, Riisi is very helpful, yes she is! Dorna is just too slow to understand Riisi's wit.
Oh, <FirstName>, Dorna and Riisi talk like this to each other all the time. It is only playful banter, nothing more.
Yes. Why do we not find out what the annoying little dragon-pest has to say? If we make it think, perhaps its head will implode.
Riisi sees that you have Xanos with you, and he thinks he knows so very, very much, that he should be able to answer all questions you may be having, yes he should.
Oh, <FirstName>, you should not speak to Riisi so, no you should not. She is trying to be helpful, yes she is. Even though you are mean to me, I will still try to help.
Yes, Riisi is very helpful, yes she is! Xanos is just full of ego, with no room for wit.
Oh, <FirstName>, Xanos and Riisi talk like this to each other all the time. It is only playful banter, nothing more.
That is a sad thing to say, yes it is. Riddles make the mind stay sharp. You must have a dull mind if you do not like riddles.
Kobolds have dull minds too, yes they do. And I do not like kobolds at all, no I do not.
Oh, <FirstName>, that is a horrible thing to say, yes it is. It is the kind of thing a stupid, ugly kobold would say, yes it is.
When you say things like that it makes me think awful thoughts. Master Drogan would not want me to do things like that to you, oh no, he would not.
You are ugly, yes, very ugly, like a kobold, but when you say such things it makes you even uglier than a kobold, so let us say nice things to each other.
You are not beautiful, but you are not so ugly as a scaly kobold either, but when you say such things it makes you seem ugly, so let us say nice things to each other.
But you are beautiful, and kobolds are not beautiful, but when you say things like that it makes you seem less beautiful, so let us say nice things to each other.
Oh, yes, yes, my riddle. A fine choice for a fine <man/woman>. Here is my riddle. A woman has five children and half of them are sons. Is this possible?
That is too bad, yes it is. You should have guessed, because there is a good chance you would have gotten it right. You are not much smarter than a kobold, I am afraid.
Oh, no. You are very, very wrong. You are not much smarter than a kobold I am afraid. No, no, not at all.
This is a waste of valuable time, but I should tell you that it is indeed possible for half to be male, so long as the other half is also male.
Oh yes, Xanos, you are being right. You are very smart but I wish you were nicer to me. You are a hard man to like, Xanos, yes, you are.
I can see through this trickster's quick wit, <FirstName>. Obviously if half of the five were male, then the other half would also be male. That is how it would be possible.
Oh yes, Dorna, you are being right. You are much fun and you are good at riddles. I do like you Dorna, yes, I do.
This is just silly, <FirstName>, but I think I know the trick to answering this riddle. Half of the children could be male, but only if the other half is also male.
Oh yes, Mischa, you are being right. You are very smart and you are so nice to me. I do like you Mischa, yes, I do.
Oh, yes, yes, it is true. Riisi thinks you are smarter than you look, or else very lucky.
It is true if the other half of the children are also males. She must have five boys. It is a trick, see? I never said the other half were not boys.
Do you want to talk about something else?
Back you come to speak with Riisi, yes you do. What would you like to know? A riddle, perhaps?
No more kobolds will get by Riisi, no, no, no!
You take this and help Master. I worry about him much, oh yes I do. Good luck be with you, <FirstName>, you will need it.
Master Drogan is okay! Riisi is so happy!! Thank you, thank you!
How Riisi clean all this up? This be so impossible!
Riisi cannot wait to see Master Drogan!
Whee!! Riisi feels good again!!
Goodbye.
What happened here, Riisi?
So, Master Drogan's annoying familiar, Riisi, survived.
Hello Riisi, how are you?
Drogan was wounded and will likely die.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - Lie]</Start> Master Drogan is fine.
Master Drogan was poisoned by the kobolds.
I want to ask you some questions.
I have no more questions.
What is in the laboratory?
I don't care about your items.
I will take the items to Drogan.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Give the items to me.
Give me the items or I'll strangle you.
Fine, ask me your riddles, stupid faerie dragon.
I hate riddles.
Alright, ask me your riddles then.
Ask me your riddles.
You help me, or your life ends now!
If you give me what I want, then yes.
I don't want to hurt you, but you must take this seriously, Riisi.
Yes, just get on with it.
No, please, wait! Master Drogan desperately needs our help!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Riisi, you are just too smart for me. Please give me another chance.
I don't know.
I am guilty.
I am innocent.
I will be hanged.
Just get on with it.
Yes.
Sixteen.
Twelve.
Ten.
Eight.
Six.
Four.
I will be drowned.
If you ask me one more riddle, I'll end your irritating little life!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> This isn't going well. Riisi, could you please just trust me?
I love riddles. Please, continue.
Yes, I will try it.
A little dirt disrupted Drogan's protective magic?
What did that do?
That is what I asked you in the first place!
Yes, please tell me.
How do I get into the laboratory?
You let me in, or I will wring your leathery little neck!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Surely you can trust me to go in.
I think you are confused, fair creature.
Stupid fairie dragon, who are you calling a kobold?
What are you talking about?
A little dirt disrupted Drogan's protective magic?
What did that do?
Why can't I go in?
Can you tell me exactly what the kobolds did?
And in this dream, is there a knight in shining armor, who speaks poetry to you?
Do your dreams have naked nymphs and dryads too?
No, I don't have stupid dreams like that. Now, get on with it.
Get to the story.
Yes, but please get to what happened.
A little dirt disrupted Drogan's protective magic?
What did that do?
What did you do when the kobolds crossed the barrier?
Dorna is right. Do you have a single, useful thing to say, Riisi?
Dorna, Riisi is trying to be helpful, leave her alone.
Alright, that will be enough out of both of you.
Xanos is right. Do you have a single, useful thing to say, Riisi?
Xanos, Riisi is trying to be helpful, leave her alone.
Alright, that will be enough out of both of you.
I hate riddles.
Kobolds are fun to kill. I wonder if faerie dragons are fun to kill too?
Tell me your riddle.
I don't know.
No.
Yes.
Drogan, you live! Mystra be praised!
It was... the artifacts they were after. They are stolen... all four of them. I could do nothing...
I thought as much. How could anyone have found out you even had them? This is terrible news.
When Drogan retired to Hilltop, the Harpers entrusted four dangerous artifacts to his care. We thought this area remote enough that they would be safe.
They were. I... do not know... how they were discovered...
We'll have to find out. Those artifacts are too powerful and dangerous to be left in unknown hands.
I can't leave. Drogan will die unless I tend to this poison. The help I can offer is limited until he gets better.
I'm glad you agree. I won't be able to follow you, however... I need to stay here and tend to Drogan's poison.
That's good to hear. I will need to stay here and tend to Drogan's poison... the help I can offer is limited until he gets better.
<FirstName>... my eldest student. It is... up to you. It is vital... that you find these items and bring them back...
Such... such courage. Dear <boy/girl>, you do me proud...
Only you can... do this. You are needed, my <boy/girl>... you must have courage!
There are rewards... beyond wealth, my <boy/girl>. Only you can do this. You... are needed, you must have courage!
There is... no-one else. The other apprentices... can only follow your lead. You are needed, my <boy/girl>... you must have courage!
Your ring... will protect you. <FirstName>, my <boy/girl>... you are needed. You must have courage!
This will be your... final test. I know that you are ready! So much... so much relies on you. I know... you will not let me down...
I... I cannot... unnnghhh!...
Drogan? He's... passed out from the pain. It is up to you, then, <FirstName>, as he said. You must recover these artifacts before they can be put to dangerous use.
There are no others in this area that I know of. And even should I send word of what has happened, it would be too late before anyone could respond.
No, it is truly up to you to find the artifacts if they are going to be found at all. Your preparation is paramount at this point.
I'm sure you have many questions, <FirstName>... and I will help you as much as I can. There is much you must prepare for, first, however.
Even the longest journey begins with a few simple steps, <FirstName>. You know what you must do... you simply have to prepare for it.
If you need assistance, think of asking Dorna or Xanos to accompany you. The others can remain here and help guard the school.
That would be me. I wish I could go with you, <FirstName>. You are so lucky.
And <he/she> will be luckier still to have the great Xanos by <his/her> side!
Get over yourself already, Xanos. <FirstName> will pick whomever <he/she> picks... and it will probably be someone <he/she> can stand.
Yes, yes, as I said. Me!
There is also bound to be some equipment here in the school which can help you. See if you can find some. Healing equipment especially... if you can't find potions, healing kits will have to do.
As for the artifacts themselves, I can tell you what I know about them if you wish. It's not much, but it might help.
Beyond that, all that remains is to go out into Hilltop and follow the trail of the kobolds. It should not be difficult... their passing will have been noticed, I'm sure.
I will help you as much as I can, but my first duty is to keep Drogan alive. Whatever this poison is inside him, I intend to fight it.
Excellent. I will tend to Drogan, then. Return to me when you have discovered anything.
Not well. Until I get those supplies, I'm not sure I'll see much of an improvement. Remember: I still need <CUSTOM1005> as soon as possible.
Poorly. It takes all the magic I can muster to keep the poison from killing him. I will do what I can... he is a strong dwarf, I'm sure he will pull through.
Yes, actually, perhaps there is. I believe the poison is a magically-altered form of snake venom... perhaps from an asp or something similar.
If that is the case, there may be some herbs that can speed Drogan's recovery. There is an herbalist in Hilltop who should have them.
Go to the herbalist and tell him that you need a tressym tongue, some charcoal and some helmthorn berries. Then bring those back to me.
Fine, for now, thanks to those herbs. He lapses in and out of consciousness and still needs my attention, but the prognosis is good.
You can try to speak to him if you wish. His mind is a bit... fevered, however, so do not overtax him.
I will go with you, <FirstName>. You will have need of my powerful magics and not so much of Dorna's little sneakings, yes?
Powerful magics? Are you talking about the few little spells you can fire off before you run screaming like a naked halfling?
I know nothing what you speak of, little dwarf. Xanos has great magics and fights well to boot!
I see. Well maybe you'll introduce me to him, sometime.
I'll go with you, <FirstName>. Our skills will complement each other... and besides, I expect you'll need some muscle to back you up.
Muscle? Eh? All I see is little dwarf with very big mouth.
Better that than a big half-orc with an oversized ego.
You make fun of Xanos, but you shall see. <FirstName> will pick Xanos gladly and then Xanos will laugh at you. Ha ha ha!
There are other students who can accompany you on this mission. You might also think of asking Dorna or Xanos to accompany you. The others can remain here and guard the school.
And what do you intend to do, <FirstName>? Let Drogan die? Let whoever was behind this attack do as they wish with these artifacts?
Is this what Drogan trained you to become? Someone so selfish that <he/she> would sooner stand around and act like a petulant child than face a real adventure when it arises?
Thank the gods. I was beginning to wonder what sort of <man/woman> Drogan chose as his prize pupil... I'm glad to see he was not mistaken.
Drogan's life is already on the line, as are many others who will be endangered should those artifacts not be retrieved. And they do not have the benefit of your ring!
Oh no? If the fact that Drogan is responsible for what you are now and trusts you is not enough, then do it for yourself!
Gods help us that we would have to turn to one so craven for aid, but one would think you would look forward to the experience to back up your mouth at the very least!
Or is that not why you came to this school, seeking wealth or power? Whatever your reasons, find them... but you *will* help us in this!
The gods help us if one such as you is considered by Drogan to be his prize pupil. If you are able to do this, however, I suppose his trust is justified.
I doubt your hands are any better than the hands the artifacts currently lie in... but I am not their keeper. Find and retrieve them. That will be enough.
I am not in charge of you in the slightest, <FirstName>. I am here to help Drogan and see these artifacts returned, that's all.
Nothing? The poison resists? How can that be? This is no simple toxin these kobolds have used, here.
How could they have acquired such a poison, I wonder. And why did they come all this way just to strike at Master Drogan? There must be an answer!
What kind of question is that? Of course he is not going to die, not if I can help it. Does that disappoint you somehow?
Please ignore <FirstName>'s rudeness, my lady. We appreciate your assistance, naturally, it's just that... we don't know who you are.
I don't know, to tell the truth. The fact that this poison resists curative magic disturbs me greatly. I shall try my best to aid him.
I find it more than a little suspicious that some helpful stranger would show up just as these little creatures attack, eh?
How rude! This lady aids us without asking for anything in return. Would you repay her with suspicion?
Rude or not, I'd like an answer, as well. You have remarkable timing, my lady.
Of course you are suspicious. I would be, as well, were I in your shoes. Allow me to introduce myself: my name is Ayala Windspear.
I have been following the tracks of these kobolds for almost two days, now. I thought it odd that they would range so far from their home caves in the Nether Mountains.
I never imagined they would do something like this, however. As soon as I realized they were headed for Hilltop I came as quickly as I could... but too late.
Believe me or not, as you wish. I was only passing through this area when I noticed the activity of these kobolds. It was my responsibility to investigate.
There will be time enough for that. Our first priority is to find out why this happened... and what can be done to help Drogan.
But I don't understand... why would anyone want to attack Master Drogan?
I was just passing through this area, to be perfectly honest. It's my responsibility to take note of strange occurrences and investigate them, however.
What do you mean it's your responsibility?
I am a Harper, as is Drogan. Do you know what a Harper is?
I'm sure everyone is shocked. The Harpers are a group of fools who meddle in the affairs of others to maintain their own interests.
That is a viewpoint born of ignorance. We Harpers band together to fight evil wherever it arises, even though some may call it 'meddling'.
This naturally means that the Harpers have many enemies. I suspect one of them is responsible for this attack. I hope I am wrong.
I... believe... I can shed some light on that...
Master Drogan!
One that secretly meddles in the affairs of others, whether they are welcome or not.
Indeed, you are well-informed. Doing so has left the Harpers with many enemies, however. It may be one of those that is behind this attack.
That's it? The little beasts are all gone? Then I shall see to Drogan now. I can only imagine what they did to make him fall.
Poison? I cannot tell the type, but I should be able to counter it with my magic. Hold on, good dwarf...
Have you any news of the artifacts, <FirstName>?
Excellent. To be honest, this artifact was the one I was most afraid of ending up in the wrong hands. Belpheron was a frightening villain, to say the least.
I do remember something about this hand, now that I think about it. It... it is possible that it might be able to point the way to the other artifacts. Quite literally.
You could try... using the hand to direct you to them, if you feel it is necessary. Do you want to keep it for that?
As you wish. It's probably for the best... there's no telling just what Belpheron's hand is capable of, really.
I see. I won't argue with you for now... at least it's not in unknown hands. I'd be careful with that, <FirstName>. You don't know what it can do.
Very well. Be careful with it. It's ability to point out things may not be all it's capable of, <FirstName>.
You have? Good. I don't know what powers the tooth might bring to a dragon or similar creature, but the possibilities are frightening enough.
Good work, <FirstName>. That makes one less artifact that we need to worry about.
Have you found anything else, yet?
J'Nah? Hmmm. I can't say that I do, really, though the name does... ring a bell. A sorceress, you say?
I will think on it, <FirstName>. In the meantime, I suggest you find her lair and learn who she is... or who she serves. This information may be vital.
Tymofarrar... that does sound familiar. He is a young white dragon from the Nether Mountains, I believe. Relatively benign, as far as his kind can be... but very selfish.
Is he the one that is behind the kobolds? That would make sense. Tymofarrar would want the artifacts for himself if he ever heard of them.
But how did he hear of them? Tymofarrar is a potent beast, <FirstName>, but he is no great wizard and not overly intelligent for a dragon.
Very odd. Your only recourse may be to find his lair in the Nether Mountains and learn more. You must be stealthy, however... battling him would be your death.
And there's no other way to get it from him? Then you may have to help him, <FirstName>. Hopefully what he wants isn't... distasteful.
Have you learned anything else?
Ambushed by gnolls? The only gnolls from this area come from the High Forest... but they've no reason to attack the kobolds.
Could it be that someone sent the gnolls to steal the artifacts for themselves? But then someone else would have had to know about them.
You may have to look into both the gnolls and the kobolds in order to find th rest of the artifacts, <FirstName>. Be careful.
Thank the gods! Let me see what you have...
...hmmm. I still need a tressym tongue. Without it, I can't help Drogan. Please do what you can, <FirstName>.
...hmmm. I still need some charcoal. Without it, I can't help Drogan. Please do what you can, <FirstName>.
...hmmm. I still need some helmthorn berries. Without them, I can't help Drogan. Please do what you can, <FirstName>.
...hmmm. I still need some helmthorn berries and some charcoal. Without them, I can't help Drogan. Please do what you can, <FirstName>.
...hmmm. I still need some helmthorn berries and a tressym tongue. Without them, I can't help Drogan. Please do what you can, <FirstName>.
...hmmm. I still need a tressym tongue and some charcoal. Without them, I can't help Drogan. Please do what you can, <FirstName>.
Good, good. I have all the herbs I need for Drogan, now. Thank you, <FirstName>... you've managed wonderfully.
There. That should do it. Hopefully we will see some kind of improvement soon.
You're certain? Never mind... I'm sure you're trying your best, <FirstName>.
Is there something I can help you with, then?
Then I wish you luck, <FirstName>. Return to me when you have discovered anything.
I can try. Where do you need to go?
I believe I can. Allow me to scry their location...
There. I will send you there now, <FirstName>. Hold on.
A grim thought, isn't it? I would suggest that this might not be a good idea if whatever wounded you so terribly is still there. Are you ready to go?
Let's see... I just need the location from the ring. Yes... there. I have it. Hold on and I'll send you there now.
Are you certain? If you left danger in the spot you came from, it will still be there. I would not want you to waste crystals unnecessarily.
Alright. I should be able to pick up the location from your ring... yes, good, it's within range. One moment, please...
What would you like to know?
You want to know more about... me? Whatever for? My past isn't important here.
I'm not trying to be unfriendly, <FirstName>... it's just that there are far more important things to do here than chatting with each other.
Believe me, <FirstName>, when I say we will have plenty of time to swap stories once this is all over, alright?
Drogan recognized me. Isn't that enough?
Good point. Regardless, you're going to have to take my word for it this once. Now I'm sure you have something better to do...
I see. No offense, friend, but you're not my type. And this isn't exactly my idea of the perfect time.
You want to swap tales while I care for your dying mentor? Maybe another time, my friend.
Oh? Very cute. If you see some, do let me know.
Only very little. I came across their tracks when crossing one of the mountain paths through the Nether Mountains to the north.
When I realized that they had left the highlands and come down into the valley, I became alarmed. For kobolds to range so far from their home caves is unusual.
Kobolds are tiny, draconic predators that rely more on their cunning than their strength to survive. For them to be so bold means they either have much to gain... or much more to fear.
There's not much more to tell, I think. The Harpers seek to maintain a balance in the world even in the face of those who would abuse their powers.
Some claim we are spies, others consider us dangerous meddlers or even outright assassins. In truth we are a little of all things, when the situation warrants it.
You know... it was always our hope that Drogan's students might take the cue from their tutor and become Harpers themselves, in fact. What do you think of that?
That's good. You certainly seem like the sort of <man/woman> who would do well amongst the Harpers. We will have to wait and see.
Oh? I wonder why that would be? You don't strike me as the sort of <man/woman> who would be interested. We'll have to wait and see.
Well, you have plenty of time. It would be too soon to even consider membership in the Harpers... but perhaps this is your chance, no?
Truly? That's too bad. You seem like the kind of <man/woman> the Harpers could use more of.
Hmm. Perhaps that's for the best. You strike me as the sort of <man/woman> who wouldn't sit well with the Harper ideals.
I know a little about these artifacts, but keep in mind that anything I tell you comes mostly from memory. I wish I had more detailed information to offer.
Let's see... if I remember correctly, there are four artifacts in total: a mummified hand, a dragon's tooth, a statue of a tower and a mask.
All four of them have considerable power of a malevolent nature, although we have yet to discover an application for any of this power.
The fact that the power exists could be tempting enough for some... and it's very possible that there may be someone out there who knows more about these artifacts than we do.
The trouble will be figuring out which artifact the thief is, in fact, interested in... and what they intend to do with it. Considering the nature of these items, it is certainly evil.
And where, exactly, would somewhere safe be? Behind the walls of a keep, surrounded by guards? What better way to announce that you hide something of value.
No, the Harpers believed that this school was remote enough and nondescript enough to be considered safe from molestation. For many years that has indeed been the case.
That once belonged to a high priest of the Lord of Shadows, I believe, and is imbued with considerable power... though nobody has figured out how to use it.
Seeing as the God of Thieves rarely produces items of benevolent purpose, it was decided best to keep the mask safe and out of his followers' hands.
Perhaps someone has figured out how to use the mask's power? If so, any amount of mischief could be expected as a result.
I... actually do not know much about that. I believe it was found in a desert tomb many years ago, and one of our wizards detected powerful and destructive magic within it.
The nature of the magic could not be discerned, however, so it was put aside to be kept safe until more could be discovered about it.
I have my doubts that the statue would be of use to anyone. Perhaps its theft was only incidental because it lay with the rest.
A remnant of the great wyrm Hephaestagon, a great dragon that also wielded the most evil of the black arts.
The dragon died long ago... but it's possible that the kobolds could have some interest in it, seeing as they are of draconic origin themselves.
