A Cure for Drogan

The Harper, Ayala, has asked you to acquire three herbs that will aid in Master Drogan's recovery: tressym tongue, charcoal and helmthorn berries. These can probably be purchased at the herbalist shop in Hilltop.
The Harper, Ayala, has asked you to acquire three herbs that will aid in Master Drogan's recovery: tressym tongue, charcoal and helmthorn berries. You have found one of the ingredients needed.
The Harper, Ayala, has asked you to acquire three herbs that will aid in Master Drogan's recovery: tressym tongue, charcoal and helmthorn berries. You have found two of the ingredients needed.
You have managed to gain all three herbal ingredients Ayala specified for Master Drogan's cure. These will need to be brought directly to her back at Drogan's house.
Ayala reports that the herbs you acquired have had the desired effect: Master Drogan is doing much better and will likely recover, thanks to you.

The herbalist in Hilltop gladly gave you the herbs he had... but was out of helmthorn berries. If you still have need of them, he mentioned that the cook at the Bubbling Cauldron bought some from him recently and might still have some.
An Excess of Prophet
Haniah, the mayor's assistant has asked that Piper, a self-proclaimed prophet, be quieted. She would like you to handle it without violence, if possible.
Haniah, the mayor's assistant has asked that Piper, a self-proclaimed prophet, be quieted. She would like you to handle it without violence, if possible. Piper was killed, which might upset Haniah.

Haniah, the mayor's assistant has asked that Piper, a self-proclaimed prophet, be quieted. She would like you to handle it without violence, if possible. Piper has been convinced to leave town and will no longer be a problem. Haniah will want to hear of this at once.

Haniah, the mayor's assistant has asked that Piper, a self-proclaimed prophet, be quieted. She would like you to handle it without violence, if possible. With the death of Piper, Haniah was very upset and is no longer speaking to you.

Haniah, the mayor's assistant has asked that Piper, a self-proclaimed prophet, be quieted. She would like you to handle it without violence, if possible. Piper has been convinced to become a guard and will no longer be a problem. Haniah will want to hear of this at once.

Haniah, the mayor's assistant has asked that Piper, a self-proclaimed prophet, be quieted. She would like you to handle it without violence, if possible. Haniah was very grateful to you for taking care of this problem.
A strange prophet named Piper seemed to be causing a disturbance in the streets with his prophecies of doom. You felt it prudent to dispose of him.

Haniah, the mayor's assistant has asked that Piper, a self-proclaimed prophet, be quieted. She would like you to handle it without violence, if possible. Piper has been discredited and will no longer be a problem. Haniah will want to hear of this at once.

Haniah, the mayor's assistant has asked that Piper, a self-proclaimed prophet, be quieted. She would like you to handle it without violence, if possible. Piper has requested that his sword, which he sold to Fiona, the blacksmith, be returned so he can become a guard.
Blocked Passage
A large rock sits in front of a passage in the kobold caves. How anyone could get past the boulder is unknown.
Master Jumper Klumph, a kobold, is a prisoner who claims he can move the boulder that blocks the passage to Tymofarrar, if he gets the Rod of Ruler back from the kobold chief.

Master Jumper Klumph, a kobold, is a prisoner who claims he can move the boulder that blocks the passage to Tymofarrar, if he gets the Rod of Ruler back from the kobold chief. The Master Jumper now has the rod and will wait in the passage where the boulder sits.

Master Jumper Klumph, a kobold, is a prisoner who claims he can move the boulder that blocks the passage to Tymofarrar, if he gets the Rod of Ruler back from the kobold chief. The Master Jumper has opened the passage in a very unusual way, and Tymofarrar's cave awaits.
A large rock sits in front of a passage in the gnoll caves. A machine was found that lifted the boulder, once the machine was fixed.
Fled Into the Crypt
A group of kobolds have fled into a nearby crypt. It is probable that they will know something about the stolen artifacts.

A group of kobolds have fled into a nearby crypt. It is probable that they will know something about the stolen artifacts. Nilmaldor, a spirit of a long dead elven knight, claims he could help get rid of the kobolds, if a nest of spiders is destroyed first.

A group of kobolds have fled into a nearby crypt. It is probable that they will know something about the stolen artifacts. Nilmaldor explained how to activate a trap in the kobolds' barricaded room. There is a secret passage at the southeastern side of the crypt. It leads to a room where a lever can reset the trap. There are protective helmets that stop the poisonous gas, so one can enter the kobolds' room, step on the pressure plate, and finish off the kobolds.
The Mummified Hand relic has been recovered from the kobolds' leader in the crypt.
Horns of the Shadow Hart
An elven ranger by the name of Ferran seeks the horns of a unique creature known as the Shadow Hart: a white stag that has the ability to teleport short distances away from its attackers.
The horns of the Shadow Hart were given to Ferran, who needed them as a cure for his ailing wife. He was overjoyed and left immediately to find his wife.

An elven ranger by the name of Ferran seeks the horns of a unique creature known as the Shadow Hart: a white stag that has the ability to teleport short distances away from its attackers. The stag has been warned away, however, and has gone somewhere safe.
An elven ranger by the name of Ferran sought the horns of a unique creature known as the Shadow Hart. With his death, however, his hunt has ended.

Though you had collected the horns of the Shadow Hart, your refusal to give them to the desperate Ferran has resulted in him attacking you and taking the horns from your body. No doubt he has already left the area to return to his ailing wife.
The horns of the Shadow Hart were collected and sold to Fiona - the smith in Hilltop.
J'nah's Request

An arrogant elf-like woman has taken control of the gnolls in the High Forest. She has requested that Tymofarrar be killed and the tower artifact returned to her. To aid in killing the dragon, J'nah has provided a Phylactery of Ice, which will infuse whoever breaks it with the power of an ice elemental. It can only be used in close proximity to Tymofarrar.

An arrogant elf-like woman has taken control of the gnolls in the High Forest. She has requested that Tymofarrar be killed and the tower artifact returned to her. Tymofarrar is dead, but the tower has not been recovered. J'nah might wish to hear about her rival's death.

An arrogant elf-like woman has taken control of the gnolls in the High Forest. She has requested that Tymofarrar be killed and the tower artifact returned to her. J'nah betrayed her trust and was destroyed for her actions.

An arrogant elf-like woman has taken control of the gnolls in the High Forest. She has requested that Tymofarrar be killed and the tower artifact returned to her. J'nah was fooled into believing she had found a new ally and then killed.
Kobolds in the Kitchen

It appears that a standoff has ensued at the Bubbling Cauldron tavern. A group of kobolds that attacked the tavern have barricaded themselves inside the kitchen... along with the tavern's cook, Mara, as their hostage. The innkeeper, Lodar, is quite desperate to get rid of the kobolds and save her.
A group of kobolds had barricaded themselves in the kitchen of the Bubbling Cauldron along with the cook, Mara, as their hostage. Mara did not survive the ensuing battle.
A group of kobolds had barricaded themselves in the kitchen of the Bubbling Cauldron along with the cook, Mara, as their hostage. In the end, Mara was safely rescued and was quite grateful.

A group of kobolds had barricaded themselves in the kitchen of the Bubbling Cauldron along with the cook, Mara, as their hostage. The kobolds were allowed to leave... and Mara has been carried off to an unknown fate.

A group of kobolds had barricaded themselves in the kitchen of the Bubbling Cauldron along with the cook, Mara, as their hostage. The kobolds were allowed to leave along with Mara, who was later discovered shortly outside the town... dead.

A group of kobolds had barricaded themselves in the kitchen of the Bubbling Cauldron along with the cook, Mara, as their hostage. You aided the kobolds in their escape attempt, killing Mara along with the innkeeper and all the townsfolk present.
Not Playing with a Full Deck

A group of kobolds raided a halfling caravan in Hilltop and made off with some of their equipment... including a deck of cards, which the leader of the caravan, Katriana, says is quite important to their fortune-teller, Daschnaya. If you recover the cards, she'd appreciate them returned.
The fortune-telling cards have been recovered from the kobold thieves and returned to Daschnaya at the halfling caravan.

When asked about the kobolds who stole the halfling supplies, Torias mentioned that they fled north to an abandoned farmhouse. Some of them jumped into the river to the east and escaped, but Torias believes some might still be in the farm.

Katriana was pleased that you found Daschnaya's cards. She gave you a key to her wagon, asking you to return the cards to Daschnaya personally. She suggested that Daschnaya might be willing to give you a free reading in exchange.

A group of kobolds raided a halfling caravan in Hilltop and made off with some of their equipment... including a deck of cards which the leader of the caravan, Katriana, says is quite important to their fortune-teller, Daschnaya. If you recover the cards, she'd appreciate them returned. Torias stated that the kobolds had fled the caravan camp heading northwards towards an abandoned farmhouse on the hill. Some of them jumped into the river to the east and escaped, but Torias believes some might still be in the farm.

As Torias had claimed, some of the kobolds were indeed still within the abandoned farmhouse. Not much of the halfling caravan's supplies appear to remain except for what seems to be a deck of antique fortune-telling cards.

A group of kobolds raided a halfling caravan in Hilltop and made off with some of their equipment... including a deck of cards, which the leader of the caravan, Katriana, says is quite important to their fortune-teller, Daschnaya. If you recover the cards, she'd appreciate them returned. You have found the cards in the cellar of the old farmhouse in Hilltop
Rescue Glendir
While in the gnoll caves, a half-orc prisoner named Glendir was found. He was quite desperate to be rescued.
While in the gnoll caves, a half-orc prisoner named Glendir was found. Desperate to be rescued, he was released from his cell and escorted to the exit from the caves successfully.

While in the gnoll caves, a half-orc prisoner named Glendir was found. He was quite desperate to be rescued. While Glendir was freed, he was hoping for an escort from the caves, but he was left to find his own way out.

While in the gnoll caves, a half-orc prisoner named Glendir was found. He was quite desperate to be rescued. While Glendir was freed, he was hoping for an escort from the caves, but he was left to find his own way out. Unfortunately, Glendir did not make it out. His lifeless body has been found.
While in the gnoll caves, a half-orc prisoner named Glendir was found. He was quite desperate to be rescued. While Glendir was freed, unfortunately, he did not survive the journey out of the caves.
Rescue My Family
Nora Blake is frantic because her family is in peril. Kobolds have invaded her home where her husband and young child are trapped. She wants someone to go in and rescue them.

Nora Blake is frantic because her family is in peril. Kobolds have invaded her home where her husband and young child are trapped. She wants someone to go in and rescue them. The child is rescued. Nora will want him back.

Nora Blake is frantic because her family is in peril. Kobolds have invaded her home where her husband and young child are trapped. She wants someone to go in and rescue them. Unfortunately the child died in the rescue attempt. Nora will need to know about this.

Nora Blake is frantic because her family is in peril. Kobolds have invaded her home where her husband and young child are trapped. She wants someone to go in and rescue them. Unfortunately the child died in the rescue attempt. Nora was devastated when she heard the news.

Nora Blake is frantic because her family is in peril. Kobolds have invaded her home where her husband and young child are trapped. She wants someone to go in and rescue them. The baby was rescued, but then sold to Szaren, the Red Wizard of Thay, for a tidy profit.

Nora Blake is frantic because her family is in peril. Kobolds have invaded her home where her husband and young child are trapped. She wants someone to go in and rescue them. The child is rescued. Nora was glad to have him back.

Nora Blake is frantic because her family is in peril. Kobolds have invaded her home where her husband and young child are trapped. She wants someone to go in and rescue them. The baby was rescued, but not returned to Nora.
Nora Blake is frantic because her family is in peril. Kobolds have invaded her home where her husband and young child are trapped. She wants someone to go in and rescue them. Nora was refused help.

Nora Blake is frantic because her family is in peril. Kobolds have invaded her home where her husband and young child are trapped. She wants someone to go in and rescue them. The baby was rescued, but Nora was murdered.
Rumgut Needs a Wife

Nathan Hurst, a duergar homesteader in the foothills of Hilltop is desperate to regain his daughter, who has been kidnapped by a hill giant named Rumgut. He has carried her off to his cave, somewhere to the west.

Nathan Hurst, a duergar homesteader in the foothills of Hilltop is desperate to regain his daughter, who has been kidnapped by a hill giant named Rumgut. He has carried her off to his cave, somewhere to the west. Rumgut has been dealt with and Rebecca has returned to her family. A reward awaits the rescuer at Nathan's home.

Nathan Hurst, a duergar homesteader in the foothills of Hilltop is desperate to regain his daughter, who has been kidnapped by a hill giant named Rumgut. He has carried her off to his cave, somewhere to the west. Rumgut was dealt with, but Rebecca was terrorized by her rescuer. As a protective father, Nathan will probably be hostile towards further intrusions into his family.
A giant named Rumgut seems to have captured a dwarven girl to be his 'wife'. Whoever she is, she would like to be rescued.

Nathan Hurst, a duergar homesteader in the foothills of Hilltop is desperate to regain his daughter, who has been kidnapped by a hill giant named Rumgut. He has carried her off to his cave, somewhere to the west. Becka is dead and Nathan will want to know about it.

Nathan Hurst, a duergar homesteader in the foothills of Hilltop is desperate to regain his daughter, who has been kidnapped by a hill giant named Rumgut. He has carried her off to his cave, somewhere to the west. Nathan was devastated by the news of Becka's death.

Nathan Hurst, a duergar homesteader in the foothills of Hilltop is desperate to regain his daughter, who has been kidnapped by a hill giant named Rumgut. He has carried her off to his cave, somewhere to the west. Nathan was pleased to be reunited with his daughter.

Nathan Hurst, a duergar homesteader in the foothills of Hilltop is desperate to regain his daughter, who has been kidnapped by a hill giant named Rumgut. He has carried her off to his cave, somewhere to the west. Nathan has been murdered.
Spiders Infestation
Nilmaldor, the spirit of an elven knight has asked adventurers to exterminate a spider infestation in a western crypt. The spiders' egg sacs must also be destroyed before Nilmaldor will be happy.
The spiders' egg sacs in the elven crypt have been destroyed. Nilmaldor should be informed immediately.
Nilmaldor was grateful for the extermination of the spider infestation.
A large nest of giant spiders was discovered and destroyed, crushing their egg sacs in the process.
Thayvian Enclave
Szaren, a red wizard of Thay, has asked you to use your influence with the mayor to help him set up an enclave here in Hilltop.
Szaren, a red wizard of Thay, has asked you to use your influence with the mayor to help him set up an enclave here in Hilltop. The mayor has agreed to the request.

Szaren, a red wizard of Thay, has asked you to use your influence with the mayor to help him set up an enclave here in Hilltop. The mayor has been assassinated and his assistant, Haniah will not stop Szaren from his goal.

Szaren, a red wizard of Thay, has asked you to use your influence with the mayor to help him set up an enclave here in Hilltop. You have agreed with Haniah that this would be dangerous and that Szaren should leave town.

Szaren, a red wizard of Thay, has asked you to use your influence with the mayor to help him set up an enclave here in Hilltop. Szaren was pleased that he has permission to start his enclave and has returned to Thay to gather his goods and arrange for a caravan to bring supplies, slaves and guards.

Szaren, a red wizard of Thay, has asked you to use your influence with the mayor to help him set up an enclave here in Hilltop. You have succeeded in stopping Szaren from importing his supplies, slaves and guards.
The Dragon's Tooth

One of the artifacts missing is a tooth that once belonged to an ancient, evil wyrm named Hephaestagon. The power the tooth contains is unknown, but seeing as the kobolds themselves are a draconic race they may know more of how to unlock it.
Recovered from the sorceress J'Nah, the dragon tooth artifact has been safely turned over for safe-keeping.
Although you successfully recovered the tooth artifact from the sorceress J'Nah, you have decided against reporting that fact and have instead kept the tooth for yourself.
The Dragon's Tooth has been recovered and is now in your possession. It should probably be brought back to Ayala and turned over to her, unless you wish to keep it.
The Elven Test

After helping Nilmaldor, he told of an old elven magical item that is hidden in the crypt. Getting the cloak was an ancient elven test for young, aspiring soldiers. A key for the door at the eastern side of the upper crypt was provided.
An ancient elven magical item has been recovered from the elven crypt.
After helping Nilmaldor, he told of an old elven magical item that is hidden in the crypt. Getting the cloak was an ancient elven test for young, aspiring soldiers. You have failed the test.
The Gnoll Slaves
A large group of slaves has been found in the gnoll caves. The slaves asked for help escaping.
A large group of slaves has been found in the gnoll caves. The slaves asked for help escaping, but were murdered instead.
The slaves escaped the gnoll caves, rejoicing as they left. They are on their way to Hilltop.
A large group of slaves has been found in the gnoll caves. They have been freed and are making the long trek towards Silverymoon.
The Kobold Prisoners
A group of kobolds have been found within the gnoll caves, apparently being held as prisoners in a dungeon.
A group of kobolds have been found within the gnoll caves and were all killed.
A group of kobolds have been found within the gnoll caves. They were released from their prison and allowed to escape.

A group of kobolds have been found within the gnoll caves, apparently being held as prisoners in a dungeon. They were released and subsequently persuaded to help fight against the gnoll captors. All that will be needed to gain their help is to open the door between their prison and the chieftain's room once the fight begins.

A group of kobolds have been found within the gnoll caves, apparently being held as prisoners in a dungeon. They were released and subsequently persuaded to help fight against the gnoll captors, but were eventually betrayed and killed.
The Lost Sword

The spirit of an elven warrior was discovered in the crypts. The spirit claims that he cannot rest until his sword is returned to him. Apparently a grave robber stole his sword a long time ago, but he can still feel it inside the crypt.

The spirit of an elven warrior was discovered in the crypts. The spirit claims that he cannot rest until his sword is returned to him. Apparently a grave robber stole his sword a long time ago, but he can still feel it inside the crypt. The sword of the dead elven warrior has been recovered and should be returned for a reward.

The spirit of an elven warrior was discovered in the crypts. The spirit claims that he cannot rest until his sword is returned to him. Apparently a grave robber stole his sword a long time ago, but he can still feel it inside the crypt. The spirit was grateful for the retrieval of his sword.
The Mask

This is one of the artifacts stolen from Drogan by the kobolds. It is a mask that once belonged to a high priest of the god of thieves, Mask. While possessing great power, its abilities are unknown... though potentially very dangerous, considering the source.
Recovered from Tymofarrar, the mask artifact has been safely handed over for safe-keeping.
Although you successfully recovered the mask artifact from Tymofarrar, you have decided against reporting that fact and have instead kept the mask for yourself.
The Mask has been recovered and is now in your possession. It should probably be brought back to Ayala and turned over to her, unless you wish to keep it.
The Missing Artifacts

Master Drogan has been terribly injured by a band of kobolds that have stolen four artifacts that were given to him for safe-keeping. You are the only one who can track down these kobolds and recover the artifacts. If you find them, bring them back to Ayala at the house.

Drogan was recovered by the time you returned with the broken Tower Statue, and upon his closer inspection of it he found that it had all along shielded from detection within it a crystal of enormous power. This crystal is what the powerful enemy behind J'Nah really sought, and Drogan has suggested seeking out a man by the name of Garrick Halassar in the Anauroch Desert to identify it... it is the only way to find out what this enemy really wants. The best way to reach Garrick will be to travel with the halfling caravan as it crosses the desert, something that Drogan will now arrange.

Master Drogan has been terribly injured by a band of kobolds that have stolen four artifacts that were given to him for safe-keeping. Ayala listed off the four artifacts as follows: a mummified hand, a tower statue, a dragon's tooth and a mask, all possessed of unknown but powerful and dangerous magic. You are the only one who can track down the kobolds and recover these artifacts. If you find them, bring them back to Ayala at the house.
The Mummified Hand

One of the missing artifacts is the mummified hand of the lich, Belpheron, and is said to still retain some of his power. Whoever stole it may be trying to access this power or even seeking to resurrect the lich, himself.
Recovered from the kobolds in the elven crypt, the mummified hand has been safely turned over for safe-keeping.
The mummified hand artifact has been recovered, but Ayala suggested that you hold onto it... she believes that the hand might be useable to track down the locations of the other artifacts.
Although you successfully recovered the mummified hand artifact from the kobolds in the elven tomb, you have decided against reporting that fact and have instead kept the hand for yourself.
The Mummified Hand has been recovered and is now in your possession. It should probably be brought back to Ayala and turned over to her, unless you wish to keep it.
The Tower Statue

This is one of the artifacts stolen from Drogan by the kobolds. While it was discerned to have considerable power within it, the nature of that power remains a mystery. The artifact was put safely aside until a time when its power could be properly determined.

The Tower Statue is, apparently, in the possession of a kobold by the name of Deekin. Deekin is a servant of a dragon, Tymofarrar, who rules over the kobold tribe, and Deekin fears his reprisal because he broke the statue during the gnoll attack. Deekin is willing to hand over the statue if Tymofarrar is either talked into releasing him... or somehow killed. Until one of these things happen, Deekin will be hiding out within a shop in Blumberg, a village to the east of the foothills.

With Tymofarrar dead, Deekin was more than happy to hand over the broken Tower Statue. As Deekin had claimed, the statue held a small crystal inside it that glows brightly. What the crystal might be remains a mystery at the moment.

Tymofarrar has agreed to release Deekin from his service, and has given you a... well, a shoe... to give to him as proof of that. Hopefully this will convince Deekin to hand over the Tower Statue he has hidden.

Released from Tymofarrar's service, Deekin was more than happy to hand over the broken Tower Statue. As Deekin had claimed, the statue held a small crystal inside it that glows brightly. What the crystal might be remains a mystery at the moment. Drogan will want to see the Tower Statue right away.

Released from Tymofarrar's service, Deekin was more than happy to hand over the broken Tower Statue. As Deekin had claimed, the statue held a small crystal inside it that glows brightly. What the crystal might be remains a mystery at the moment. Drogan was pleased with the recovery of the Tower Statue.
Tymofarrar's Revenge

The white dragon, Tymofarrar, has asked that J'nah, an elven woman who controls the gnolls in the High Forest, be dispatched as soon as possible, in return for great reward. He wants revenge on her because she attacked him, after he betrayed her. To assist in defeating J'nah, Tymofarrar provided a powder that he claimed would dispel her magical powers.

The white dragon, Tymofarrar, has asked that J'nah, an elven woman who controls the gnolls in the High Forest, be dispatched as soon as possible, in return for great reward. He wants revenge on her because she attacked him, after he betrayed her. J'nah has been defeated. Tymofarrar will want to know about it.

The white dragon, Tymofarrar, has asked that J'nah, an elven woman who controls the gnolls in the High Forest, be dispatched as soon as possible, in return for great reward. He wants revenge on her because she attacked him, after he betrayed her. Tymofarrar was pleased to hear of his rival's demise.

The white dragon, Tymofarrar, has asked that J'nah, an elven woman who controls the gnolls in the High Forest, be dispatched as soon as possible, in return for great reward. He wants revenge on her because she attacked him, after he betrayed her. Tymofarrar was killed, ending his reign over the kobolds.

The white dragon, Tymofarrar, has asked that J'nah, an elven woman who controls the gnolls in the High Forest, be dispatched as soon as possible, in return for great reward. He wants revenge on her because she attacked him, after he betrayed her. Tymofarrar broke faith and was killed, ending his reign over the kobolds.

Wands with minor spells such as Acid Splash are often given to spellcasters in training for self-defense.
Influential Sorcerers through the Ages

An engraved plate inside the front cover of the book identifies it as the property of Xanos Messarmos, one of your fellow apprentices, which is unsurprising considering that this is his room.
The book seems to concern the histories and deeds of powerful sorcerers who had a lasting effect on the lands of Faerun. Several passages have been underlined and have cryptic notes in the margin. Without exception these noted sections deal with sorcerers who used their magic to gain control of some city or kingdom.

This dog-eared and well-worn book contains several dozen prayers to Mystra, goddess of magic, who is often called simply "The Lady" by her devotees.

101 Tales of Adventure

This is a storybook that recounts the adventures of many of Faerun's best-known heroes. Jam stains and scribbles render some of the stories almost illegible and many of the woodcut illustrations have been 'enhanced' with strategically placed moustaches.

You have found a secret door. This is bound to lead somewhere interesting.
The horns of the Shadow Hart were collected and Fiona - the smith in Hilltop, is making a magical helm from them.
The horns of the Shadow Hart were given to Fiona - the smith in Hilltop. She made you a magical helm from them.
Aaaiiiiiiii!!!!
Uh… You first!
I kill you!!!
Death to… whoever you are!
Eeek! I'm dying!
Help! Heeeeeelp!
Huh?
Yes, master.
No, master.
Uh… Back to work… Yeah, that's it. Back to work.
Huzzah!
Uh… Excuse me. Hello?
Why, I oughta…
Out of the way. Master Ashtara wants this passage cleared.
*Cough* *Cough* Curse this dust!
Be grateful. If you were still a statue, this could be you we're smashing.
Ow! Blast and bother, I didn't need that toe anyway...
You better do as the Master says. We've got this cave-in under control.
*Sigh* I don't think we're ever getting out.
I'm starting to feel a little claustrophobic. You?
Peering into the crystal ball, you saw another room.
Damn! Damn! Damn!! Where is Zidan? Have you seen him?!
So it appears you have become my slave a little sooner than I had expected. It's a pity, really... Statues are so much easier to transport.
Your task is not yet accomplished, my slave. What can I do to aid in its completion?

The guardians fall silent. You have done well, my slave. My thralls continue to work on the passageway but we are not free yet. For my own safety, I will not remove your collar but you are free to wander where you will.
Ah, the slave returns to his master's feet. Have you seen all the glories of Undrentide? Do you come to me bearing her greatest treasures over your shoulder?
Deekin busy writing great, epic tale of his current master, so he not gots time to talk to you. Maybe Deekin pencil you in as sidekick?
Ummm... you brings Deekin back? Deekin remembers big, booming voice and then *poof!*, Deekin awake again.
Ummm... boss?
Oh... heh heh. The great hero has found little Deekin out. Ummm... maybe the great hero is happy to see Deekin, yes?
Ummm... this is a very dark and scary place. Maybe Deekin should comes with you again? ...So Deekin helps protects you, of course...
You changes your mind, Deekin hopes. You takes Deekin along again, maybe? Epic tale not finished yet!
Deekin is ready to serve!
No hurts Deekin! Pleeeeaassee!
You wants Deekin?
You changes your mind, maybe? You wants Deekin to writes your epic tale now, yes?
Ummm... you goings to take Deekin with you now, yes? This place is very spooky.
For honor and glory!
Do you hear that?
I don't believe we have anything to say to one another. Do your job and I'll be happy.
Well that could have gone far better, couldn't it? I am sorry I let you down.
I would speak with you a moment.
If you're to help Master Drogan, you'll need to get underway as soon as possible. Do you need my help?
I must admit I'm rather looking forward to exploring some of the ruins we're sure to find here. Ancient Netheril has always held a certain fascination for me, you see.
Isn't it grand? We are inside one of the great flying cities. It is... like a tomb in here. A gravestone of greatness long since past.
You're back, I see. Do you need me to travel with you again?
Yes? What do you need?
I'm not needed to guard the house, no matter what Ayala says. Take me with you.
Standing around this camp is not my idea of fun. I'd much rather be out exploring ruins with you.
I hope you need my help. This city may be dead, but I'll bet it's still dangerous.
You... you will die? But...
You have the honor of the stones, Master Drogan. F-farewell.
A-ha! And here you are, just as I thought you might be! I cannot begin to tell you just how relieved I am to see you.
Wait, wait... I haven't yet told you how we must face Heurodis.
That's it! That's it, you've done it! The portal is active!
Wait! No... no!! I should have realized this sooner! What a fool I am!!
Heurodis has laid an insidious trap within the portal's magic! I have never sensed anything of its like before! I did not discover it... and now it is activated!
The portal is sealing... and these ruins are caving in! I... I can hold the portal open for only a short time! Quickly, you must go through!
I... cannot. By holding the portal open, I bare myself to the energies of Heurodis's trap. I will die, but... that does not matter now.
It is up to you, now. You must stop Heurodis if you can. If you cannot... then, I beg you, destroy the mythallar. The resulting explosion will end her threat forever.
Then do what you must. But whatever you do, you must go through! Nothing in this ruin will survive its collapse! Go now... I cannot keep the portal open much longer!
It is more fragile than you think, trust me. Brute force or magic... the slightest crack and its incredible forces will be released! But do so only as a last resort!
I know you will. Quickly, then... go now. I cannot keep the portal open much longer.
I will pray that is the case. Quickly, then... go now. I cannot keep the portal open much longer.
It is up to you, now. You must see this through! Remember the mythallar... destroy it only if you have to, but Heurodis must be stopped!
There is no time to look for another way. I must stay and you must go.
Aye, I know it. I saw the path that lay before you the very first time I saw you. I pray that you will find it long and fulfilling.
Go through, quickly... and I pray the gods go with you!
Fulfill the destiny I saw in you that very first time, long ago, and I am no fool at all, am I?
It... it is.
I am an old adventurer, far past his glory days. You have your whole life ahead of you. I... I can only hope you will use it well.
I am proud to have taken a small hand in making you what you are, dear friend. Go... and may the gods go with you.
Aye, Dorna. I am sorry it has come to this. You have done well for yourself... I am proud of you. Farewell, lass.
Aye, lad. Believe it or not, Xanos, I've always had hope for you. In your heart of hearts you are a good man.
And you give yourself too little. I hope one day that changes. Farewell, dear lad.
If you could only sssee what I sssee, old friend... I am joined with the mythal now! Who needsss earthly eyesss when one can sssee with the sssoul of the world!

I can see all the vassstness of the Anauroch. To the wessst, a Formian queen isss laying an egg that will become her only daughter. To the eassst, the tent of an old Bedine man is buried beneath a sssandssstorm...
And I sssee you, wreathed in the mythal'sss magic, even now. I sssee how death clingsss to you, waiting in the shadowsss. Within the hour, your life will be over...

Undrentide wasss not born a corpssse, fit to be buried and forgotten in the sssandsss of time. It belongsss in the sssky and to the sssky I have returned it! All shall bow before itsss power and before me, itsss massster!

Lossst? It wasss no lossss! Sssuch a sssmall sssacrifice to gain ssso much! I would have gambled everything for even a fraction of the mythal'sss power! Besidesss, my gaze hasss ssserved itsss purpossse, hasss it not? You would know...
Don't be a fool! It protectsss me, don't you sssee? I am sssafe in itsss embrace and, with itsss power, I ssshall have my vengeance upon all the world!
With the mythal'sss power, no harm can come to me. Let usss ssspar for old time'sss sssake, then, atop thissss city as it flies. Thisss time I will turn you to ash, not to ssstone!
Fool! Without the mythal, the city will fall!
Ah. You have come to join me at last.
Not the dwarven mage, Drogan, as I was expecting... but I see you'll do nicely. Tell me... do you have a name?
As you already know, I am Heurodis... daughter of the medusae and sorceress supreme. I welcome you to my new realm: the flying city of Undrentide.
Of course... Undrentide flies no longer. It crashed to the earth long, long ago when all the other flying cities of Netheril did the same... though Undrentide fared better than most.
Be that as it may, Undrentide is buried deep under ages of sand and quite lifeless. It requires the power of ancient Netheril in order to rise once again...
...power that you have brought to me in the form of the mythallar.
Oh, I sensed that it was nearby. I had hoped that my rather public display back at the portal ruin would bring it to me... and here you are.
Now Undrentide shall rise again! And all the power of ancient Netheril that lies within it is mine! All of Faerun shall hear my name and fear me!
And you... you, my petrified subject... you shall have the honor of being the first monument to my victory. You shall get to watch it all! Ha ha ha!
I think this spot's going to have to do for the night. Let's set up camp... and make sure it's secure this time, Torias.
Any news? Have you found Zidan or not?
Ah-ha! There you are, Zidan! You're a sight for sore eyes... I was beginning to think we'd have to wander back to Blacksands before long.
So... are you ready to move on? No point in getting sand in our boots, you know.
We could be in some trouble, friend. The oxen have gone through the water rations much faster than expected. There is an oasis near here, but we have had some trouble with the tribe that guards it.
You have a way of dealing with problems that I seem to lack. If you could just go and talk to the Bedine, maybe they would allow us to restock our water supplies.
I see you have returned. Have you gotten permission to take their water?
Well, we finally got here. I want to thank you for all your help. I know that I was a bit hard on you at times... we probably wouldn't have made it this time without you.
You will probably be wanting to hire a guide to take you to the dig site where your Garrick fellow went. It's a little ways into the desert, I understand, and only the locals really know the way.
I am sure one of the Ao worshippers will be willing to take you. They're a fairly agreeable bunch, if a bit daft. Is there anything else you want before you leave?
The sounds of battle! From downstairs!
Master Drogan is in trouble! Use your rings!
Xanos has no business with you. If you are looking for idle 'chit-chat', look elsewhere.
Hmph. If you were better at this, Xanos would not have to undergo such unpleasantness.
Hold! Xanos wishes to speak!
Hah! It seems the dwarf has finally gotten himself into a bind, and now he needs us to come to his rescue.
This desert is a vile land full of nothing but sand and death, and the quarters are half too small for anyone! What are we doing here?!
So we are within one of the fabled Netherese flying cities, eh? There is much power to be found here, if we are watchful.
You have come to ask Xanos to rejoin you, yes?
What do you want?
So have you come to your senses? You need Xanos's skills, now, yes?
I hope you have come to take Xanos away from this caravan. These halflings grow more irritating by the minute.
Xanos would prefer to join you. It is preferable to standing here doing nothing.
You... sacrifice yourself for us? For Xanos?
You... give me too much credit, Master Drogan.
Death comes to you…
The very sand cries out!
Fools and their flesh are often parted…
Only the blood of our enemies can appease us!
See how I bleed? Heal me, my thralls…
All hands to me! I need your aid!
Death…
Vengeance…
Fury…
Come, let us share wine together.
I would deny you nothing.
It will not be so.
Long life and good journeys…
Ah, the sweet taste of triumph…
There are words I must share with you.
Your life holds no meaning.
Join the battle! Evil must be vanquished!
You will never defeat us!
Run while you can!
A blow well struck!
I need healing at once!
I need another by my side!
<gasp!> The gods shall avenge me!
Greetings, my friend.
Aye.
Nay.
Fare you well.
The gods have smiled on us today!
Allow me to speak.
Nothing you can say shall help you now!
Then they charges into certain death!
He smites his enemy!
Huzzah!
Oh! The kobold is in dire needs of a healer's art!
The tiny bard is beset on all sides! He calls for help!
The enemy is spotted!
<terrified scream> Run away! Run away!
You tells me your name. Me wants to get it right on your epitaph…
You keeps Deekin safe?
Waits here! Deekin comes right back!
Suddenly death was loooooming!
Oh! …the tragedy!
Too late he realizes their cowardly foe had poisoned him...
And just then, his magic fails!
The weapon could do nothing! Doom was at hand!
Come! Come! This way! Follow Deekin!
Ooo! Ooo! Here it is!
Come on, gather round!
Please, let Deekin through! Me not sees through big legs!
A devious mechanism bars their way!
The heroes were on the lookout, wary of danger!
He creeps along like shadow in the night...
Ummm… okay!
Ummm… nope. Me can't do that.
Huzzah!
Me... Not... Carry... All... This... Phew... We gots to get rid of somethings.
Deekin?
Deekin greets the noble hero!
Is okay!
Nope.
Wait! Stop!
Umm… we gots to rest for a moment so me can organize notes.
Could we go do something heroic now, maybe?
Fare well, may your looting be plentiful.
Oh, thank you thank you thank you!
Oh that make Deekin so-oooo mad!!
And there was much rejoicing!
You wants to know what Deekin think?
Oooo! That sound good!
Ummm… you thinks of something else now, okay?
You keeps that up and Deekin write you out of saga completely!
For honor and glory!
By the blood of the All-Father!
Fall before me!
I need to be healed!
Give me a hand here!
There, up ahead.
We must get out of here!
Is that all you've got?
Watch my back!
Stay here and don't move.
If you're going to do something, do it fast!
Ah, Poison! I should have known...
What? Now my magic is failing?
My weapon cannot hurt this one!
Follow me closely, now.
Hmm. Found something.
We should stick together, here.
Please, let me through.
Allow me.
Let me see…
Where the shadow goes, so do I.
Indeed.
I can't do that.
All done here.
I can't carry that. We'll have to leave something behind.
What now?
Well met.
Yes, of course.
Certainly not.
Stop right there!
I believe we should rest soon.
I don't see what we're accomplishing sitting around like this.
Perhaps we'll meet again.
I appreciate that.
By Clangeddin's beard!
I knew this would go well!
Hold on a minute, I have a suggestion.
Hmm.. That may work.
That won't work.
Berronar help me, I'll strike you down where you stand.
We shall triumph this day! Attack!
Back with you!
You will not win this time!
Right shall prevail!
Don't just stand there! Help me!
I need assistance!
Aargh!
Well, hello there.
Very well.
I think not.
I wish you well.
Hah! Well done!
I think I may have something to say about that.
I believe the two of us are about to have a disagreement.
Slaughter them like the vermin they are!
Tremble before my power!
I will see the flesh stripped from your bones!
You shall not survive my wrath!
Servant, heal me at once!
You useless fools, come to my aid!
A mortal comes before me, I see.
As you wish.
Never!
Fool! We shall meet again!
Victory is mine!
I suggest you hear me out.
Wretched creature! Do you think to defy me?
Attack! Kill them all!
Die like the vermin you are!
May the hells take you!
You fall now!
What?! Fix this injury now!
Don't make me call you again... Assist me!
Well, well... What have we here?
I suppose so.
Not a chance.
Next time, I won't be so pleasant.
<laughter> Yes!
Oh, you can bet I have something to say about that...
You'll beg for death before I'm through!
Lay them low! Attack!
Mess with me, will you?
That's it - you're dead!
I could use some healing here!
Give me some back-up, damn it!
Hullo there, friend.
Indeed.
Not on your life.
Travel well.
Hah! Excellent!
Listen to me for a minute.
When I'm done even the buzzards won't want you.
When I'm done even the buzzards won't want you.
For the glory of Mystra, attack!
There will be justice!
Have at you!
Mystra grant me strength!
I need healing!
I can't do this on my own!
Mystra, save me!
Greetings, friend.
Of course.
No.
Fare you well, and may the Lady watch over you.
For glory and honor!
Wait, I have something to say to you.
I don't want to have to hurt you!
All will perish now!
You shall pay for your insolence!
Die, warmling!
I require aid! Now!!
Aid me at once!
So what have we here?
So shall it be.
I think not.
This is not over!
Victory is mine!
Listen to me now.
Do not anger me, warmling.
Let's make this quick, shall we?
Taste true power!
You cannot win!
I need healing, damn you!
I need assistance! Now!
Looks like trouble. Excellent.
You can't possibly win. I'm leaving.
Is that your face or has your neck thrown up?
Protect me, would you? Thanks.
Hold it!
Do something, damn you!
No! It cannot end like this!
Poisoned. Great!
What!?! How is that even possible?
Well this clearly won't work.
This way!
Look at this, will you?
Everyone, together!
One side, fool!
A spell would be far quicker…
Fine. I shall look about, then.
Quiet it is.
Consider it done.
Think again.
There.
I am not a mule! I refuse to carry everything!
Mm?
You have something to say?
Yes.
No.
Stop… Just stop.
I think I need a little "me" time.
At this rate we'll get quite far, won't we?
I've had enough of this.
Thanks. Really.
Shar's blight on you, fool!
Hah-ha! Now that I like!
A-hem!
Well, look at the big brain on you!
I have nothing to say.
You'll not live long, fool!

Type of Feat: Item Creation Prerequisite: Spellcaster Level 5th+. Specifics: The spellcaster can create a wand of any spell of 4th level or lower that he knows. Crafting a wand costs a small amount of XP and gold, depending on the level of the spell to be crafted into the wand. A newly created wand has 1d20 + 1 charge per level of the character (up to a maximum of 50 charges). The costs for crafting a wand depend on the level of the spell as well as the level of the resulting wand: Some examples: A wand of magic missile(5) will costs 3750 gp and 150 XP A wand of acid arrow (5) will cost 7500gp and 300 XP A wand of fireballs (5) will cost 11250 gp and 450 XP
Use: Selected (In order to craft a wand, the character has to cast the spell in question on a specially crafted wand)

Dwarven Defender
Dwarven Defenders
dwarven defender

(PRESTIGE CLASS) The defender is a sponsored champion of a dwarven cause, a dwarven aristocrat, a dwarven deity or the dwarven way of life. As the name might imply, this character is a skilled combatant trained in the arts of defense. A line of dwarven defenders is a far better defense than a 10-foot-thick wall of stone, and much more dangerous.
- Hit Die: d12 - Proficiencies: Simple and Martial Weapons, Light, Medium and Heavy Armor Proficiency, Shields - Skill Points: 2 + Int Modifier.
REQUIREMENTS:
Alignment: Any lawful. Race: Dwarf Feats: Dodge, Toughness. Base Attack Bonus: +7
ABILITIES:
Level 1: Defensive stance 1/day - Gain +2 Str, +4 Con, +2 on all saves, +4 dodge bonus on AC. Defensive awareness - Dexterity bonus to AC even when flat-footed. 3: Defensive stance 2/day. 5: Defensive stance 3/day. Defensive awareness - The character can not be flanked anymore. 6: Damage reduction (3). 7: Defensive stance 4/day. 9: Defensive stance 5/day. 10: Damage reduction (6). Defensive awareness - The character gains a +1 saving throw bonus vs traps.
Defensive Stance

Type of Feat: Class Prerequisite: Dwarven Defender Level 1. When he needs to, the defender can become a stalwart bastion of defense. In this defensive stance, a defender gains phenomenal strength and durability but he cannot move from the spot he is defending. He gains the following benefits: +2 Strength +4 Constitution +2 resistance bonus on all saves +4 dodge bonus to AC At first level, this ability can be used 1/day. Every 2 levels beyond 1, the dwaven defender gains an additional use per day. Use: Selected
Defensive Stance
<CUSTOM0> enters defensive stance.
Dwarven Defender Damage Reduction

Type of Feat: Defensive Specifics: At 6th level, the dwarven defender gains the ability to shrug off 3 points of damage from each blow or attack. At 10th Level the damage reduction increases to 6 points of damage per attack or blow. Epic Progression: For each 4 levels after 10, the damage reduction increases by 3 points. Use: Automatic.
Defensive Awareness (1)

Type of Feat: Class Prerequisite: Dwarven Defender Level 2. Specifics: The character retains his Dex bonus to AC, even if caught flat-footed or attacked by a hidden or invisible creature. Use: Automatic.
Defensive Awareness (2)
Defensive Awareness (3)

Type of Feat: Class Prerequisite: Dwarven Defender Level 5 Specifics: The character can no longer be flanked, since he can react to opponents on opposite sides of him as easily as he can react to a single attack. The character also retains his Dex bonus to AC, even if caught flat-footed or attacked by a hidden or invisible creature. Use: Automatic.

Type of Feat: Class Prerequisite: Dwarven Defender Level 10. Specifics: The character gains an intuitive sense that alerts him to danger from traps, giving him a +1 bonus to Reflex saves made to avoid traps. Additionally the character cannot be flanked, since he can react to opponents on opposite sides of him as easily as he can react to a single attack and also retains his Dex bonus to AC, even if caught flat-footed or attacked by a hidden or invisible creature. Use: Automatic.
Base Damage: 1d6 Base Critical Threat: x2 Base Damage Type: Bludgeoning Weapon Size: Medium Feats Required: Simple, Druid, Monk, Rogue, or Wizard
Hilltop: one of many small villages that dot the most remote regions of the northern wildlands known as the Silver Marches.
Few would choose so cold and inhospitable a land to make their home. Only those seeking a new life -- or to escape their past.
"The North has no memory," they say. But it has more than its share of danger... and evil.
It is in Hilltop that your mentor, Master Drogan, chose to settle after a lifetime of adventure. Here he would pass on his knowledge to you and a select few others with promise.
It is here that evil comes, in the shadows, and behind it a sinister purpose that will see your own promise either realized in full... or extinguished forever.
The caravan makes slow progress as it leaves Hilltop, trudging through snowy hills for several weeks before finally the vast wasteland of the Anauroch Desert opens up before you.
This is a parched land said to be the bones of the once-great Netheril Empire, its complete destruction a mystery lost to the passing of ages.
The mythallar is hers, at long last.
What follows is the oldest of Netherese rituals, lost to time but unearthed from the sands by Heurodis and now used by her to access the power of the mythallar in full.

You know that it is only a matter of time before Undrentide responds to her urging, the power of the mythallar forcing the city to rise slowly through the sands of the Anauroch, forcing it to take to the skies as it once did so long ago.
The groaning city begins to lean in its flight like a wounded bird...

The crash into the ground that marks the second fall of Undrentide is heard and felt throughout Faerun. Most folk will stop and wonder and never know how close Heurodis came to dominating them through the sheer power of the long-buried past.

Some, however, such as the Harpers, know well the part you played in Heurodis's end. They name you a hero and, throughout the realms, songs are sung of the sacrifices that you and Drogan made for them all.

As for your own fate after escaping into the Plane of Shadow, it is unknown even to the Harpers. The slave collar shattered on Ashtara's death, so you are free... . Wherever your adventures lead you, however, one thing is certain: your own tale is far from over..."

If you have the appropriate material components you may use your Craft Trap skill to build a trap.

Choose how lethal the trap will be. The more lethal the trap, the more difficult it is to construct. Minor traps require one component, average traps three, strong traps five, and deadly traps require seven components.
The following list specifies the materials required to construct certain trap types.
A flask of acid is normally used for hurling, but these can also be purchased to make acid traps.
Thunderstone can be bought in many stores.
Skeletons are a good source of these.
Coldstone is often hard to find, as it is usually horded by cold loving creatures.
Choking powder is available in black market stores.
Holy water can often be purchased from temple stores.
Caltrops are often sold in black market stores.
You can buy Tanglefoot Bags in many stores.
This rare mineral can usually only be found by adventuring. Wizards often have chunks of quartz on hand for certain rituals.
You can buy Alchemist's fire in stores.

<StartAction>[laugh!]</Start> That's pretty funny, Deekin.
<StartAction>[groan...]</Start>

Close our eyes, that's what.

Thank you, Deekin. It's been an honor.

Three Winds might just be what these things are called.
Deekin...

It's something Heurodis is doing, obviously.
Deekin...
Heurodis said that Undrentide would fly again...
I don't want to talk about it.

Write that Drogan was a sentimental idiot who wasted his chance at power.
Write that he died nobly and that we won't let his sacrifice be in vain.
Write that Drogan died as he lived: a hero. He won't soon be forgotten.
Drogan was an old fool, that's what he was.

He sacrificed himself for me. You just happened to be with me.
I could not care less, really.
Yes, I think he is.
He called it a mythallar, yes.
Keep your hands to yourself and don't get any ideas.

Let them come. And don't get cowardly, now.
Actually, we're going to them.

You've got a point, there... I don't really want to be in danger.

You aren't thinking of backing out now, are you?
Bah! This is foolish talk!
Don't worry so much. I'll protect you.
Maybe a little. It's okay to be scared, Deekin.
No, I'm not scared at all. There's no reason to be.
I'd love to go back to Hilltop, but how?
And give up the rewards that may be waiting for me? Never!
No. We've got to do what we can on our own.
I'm not going to give the mythallar away! It could be useful!
Never you mind about that.

But Drogan is far away, and I've no way to contact him.
We've got far more important things to do, Deekin.
No, we can't do that.
That could take a long time.
Probably.
Why? What do you know about it?
Poisoned him?
You feel guilty? I find that a little surprising.
I don't really need to hear any whining from you.
Why do you think you never fit in, then?
Are you really all that different from the other kobolds?

How convenient.

Oh, yes, he was furious.
Why are you so interested?
So you know what it does?
Forget it. I'll find another use for it.

Can't you make it into something that would help me?

So this amulet would benefit you, right?
<StartAction>[Lie]</Start> Drogan gave it to me. What's it to you?
Because I never gave it back to him, that's why.
Just don't run during a fight and I'll be happy.
Well, we're safer together, aren't we?
If you're so free, why did you follow me?
Yes, I remember you blackmailing me into arranging that.
Well, you're free now.
Perhaps it's your imagination which makes you different.

You're probably right.
I would have listened to you, Deekin.
You don't know that for sure.
Don't feel guilty. I didn't care about Drogan one way or the other.

Well, don't. Now be quiet.
What do you want, then?
Never mind that, let's go.
Yes, I brought you back... but you should stay here.
Keep this up and I won't bring you back at all!
Forget it. You're staying here.
Fine, you can come along.
Just try not to die next time.
What did the voice say to you?
No, stay here for now.
Yes, come along.
This is the statue with the crystal that was so important, right? We should get it back to Ayala as soon as possible.
Glad as I am, this is the closest I ever want to get to a dragon's tooth.
We've got Mask's mask... er, the mask of Mask. Um... whatever it is, we've got it!
We've got the hand! Ugly little thing, but we've got it!
Oh, this is not good. Dragons... we aren't suppose to fight dragons, are we?
Be careful in here. It seems unnaturally cold. I don't like this one bit.
These kobolds aren't fighters. Most seem deathly afraid of us.
Take careful steps in here. Kobolds are at their sneaky worst in tight quarters.
Looks like there's some human slaves here. I wonder where they came from.
The gnolls have kobolds caged up in here. Minion against minion. Their masters must really hate each other.
Why's this building still standing? Must be something important inside if it was spared.
This place looks worse than Hilltop. Keep lookout for gnolls still around.
Forest as far as you can see... or would want to. There's nothing for a thief to do among the trees.
Ah, good solid stone all around. You can't go wrong with stone.
No offence to their living kin but elven ghosts are not my idea of good company.
Our kobold attackers ambushed by gnolls? Can't say I'm sad, but I'd like to know why it happened.
This area shouldn't be so bare. Where has everyone gone?
A caravan? What is it doing here this soon after an attack?
Just what the place needs, a doomsayer to keep people fired up and scared. Feh!
Well isn't that grand. Soused-up on ale while the town falls around him.
Looks like the locals are about to try and take back the building. Good luck to them, I says.
Drogan's lab is downstairs. If he kept the artifacts anywhere, it would have been there. It's well-guarded, however... I've never been able to sneak into it, so I wonder how they could have.
Another one? The ground is supposed to be solid beneath your feet. That's the one thing you should be able to count on in life.
That was a big tremor. Feels like everything shifted. A move like that back home would have been devastating.
That was the last one, right? Whew. Glad that's over with.
Five more to go. It is only five more, right? I'd hate to find out otherwise.
Well... nine more to go, I guess. Shouldn't take too long... right?
What else is coming? We've got to finish this soon and get out of here. Let's get to it!
This isn't good! No way this is good! You see that thing? What is that?!
I don't trust any of this. Stone that floats? It's just unnatural. Where are the pillars? The crossbeams?
This... is really strange. Lead on, but be careful, all right?
Doors upon doors. Feh! What twisted mind fills their house with doors like this? How do you get anywhere?
I see signs of traps all over this place. Don't know if they are supposed to hurt us or just wake the dead.
I'm am not going to end up dead in this place. Not here. We have to beat that undead thing. We have to.
Nothing feels right in here. Even the air feels... dead.
I've gotten lost in a good book before but... I'm sorry, I just can't finish the joke. This is simply too weird.
Look! These books... can you imagine what they hold? That's where we'll find riches... in these pages!
I don't think anyone from our time is meant to be down here. This place was never meant for my kind.
Nothing feels right down here. It's like walking back in time.
This stone... even the earth under my feet... it feels ancient. Whoever built this place is thousands of years gone... I'd hope.
Well... looks to me like the dig isn't going that well. The ruins are in... ah... ruins.
The followers of Ao... not that he wants followers, from what I hear. He's above that... or something. Nobody's got an answer out of him yet.
This looks more like a proper oasis now. No more dust storms here, that's for sure.
Is that who we're after? This undead... thing... looks like big trouble to me.
That statue... that's an image of Jergal, isn't it? This is a human god who was the supreme lord of death during the time of Netheril, if I remember correctly.
Might have been a nice bridge at one time... good stonecraft went into it. Not that I trust it now.
Not much in the way of prayer will be happening here. This place is desecrated and... undead taint it even more.
Not much of an oasis, is it? Looks bone dry to me.
Well, let's get ready for it! Zidan's in some kind of trap and we'd better act fast to get him out!
More caves? I don't want to go much deeper. I hope we find Zidan soon.
Perfectly good cave of earth and stone infested with filthy stingers. What a waste.
That's one of their holes, isn't it? Those stinger creatures? Be careful around it.
All right, I suppose I can just keep poking around on my own. There's got to be something valuable here somewhere.
Good, I'm glad to be moving. Let's figure out what our next move should be and get to it.
Very well, but there really isn't much to interest me around here.
Good. I want to get on to whatever our next task is supposed to be.
All right, but don't leave me here long. There's nothing I can do here. I'm much more useful out on the road.
Good. I want to make use of the training I've had here. We'll save the day and maybe pad our pockets a bit as well.
Let me know if you need anything, then.
Hmm... I don't like the sound of this, but if it's what you want, I guess I have to go along with it.
Good. Too much has happened for me to just sit around playing with pebbles. We've work to do.
I don't want to be stuck here for too long, so do what you must and then hurry back.
Then I'll try and make my way back to Master Drogan's and see how things are going there. Not sure how I'll be able to help, but I can try.
Very well. This should take but a moment.
I'm listening. What did you have in mind?
Very well. I'll act just how you've asked. Just let me know if you want to change anything down the road.
Fair enough, we'll walk bold as boulders right through anyone we meet.
Ah, I see, a little skullduggery in the shadows. I'll stay out of sight as well as I can.
If that's what you want, all right, but don't use that as an excuse to leave perfectly good treasure behind.
Sure, I'll give it a try. That's what I'm good at.
Sure, I don't want to crowd you. How far is good?
You've got it. Anything else?
I'll jump right in whever I see anyone. Just so long as you're right behind me, all right?
Fair enough. I'll watch your back until you decide it's time to fight.
All right then, take a look in my pack and let me know what you think I should be using.
It's not exactly my specialty, but I suppose I know a bit more about magical lore than you do. Allow me to look through your equipment... if I can identify something you have, I'll let you know.
I suppose I can accomodate you, though the grace of Vergadain - Which spell do you want me to cast?
Is there anything else you want before we continue on our journey?
Right then. Let's get back at it.
I have that spell ready. Do you want me to cast it now?
I can do that. Who should I cast it on?
All right then. It won't take long.
If that's what you want. I suppose we were too busy with our training to get to know each other at Master Drogan's.
I'm just fine, and I hope to stay that way. Keep on your toes.
Is there anything else you want to talk about, <FirstName>?
It's not like the old relaxed days training under Master Drogan, but I think I'm well enough under the circumstances.
Fine and ready for anything. Well, almost anything.
Fit and fine, which is surprising considering what we have to do.
I'm all right. I just worry about all the important things we have left to do.
Well, my pockets are a little light, but other than that, I'm fine.
Not a thing bothering me. Ready to take on whatever you want.
How am I? I can't see! If you can do anything, please help. I don't like this at all.
I'm not too bad off, but I could still use a rest. A few pains here and there.
Not great. I'm pretty beat up. I don't know how much help I can be if I don't get some rest.
How am I? I'm barely able to walk! I feel like another hit or two would completely finish me off!
I'm not good. It's poison, I think.
I don't feel well at all. Some sort of sickness... I feel nauseous.
Right now I am only focusing on training as a rogue.
I am currently only focusing on training as a cleric of Vergadain
If that's what you want, I'll do it. I suppose a broad base of abilities will help the most.
Yes, there's nothing like real experience on the road to progress your training. I am currently progressing as both a cleric of Vergadain as well as a rogue... in equal measure, more or less.
If that's what you want. Just let me know if you want me to change my focus. Whatever you decide, I'm sure our adventures will be profitable.
Very well. I'm sure my skills will come in handy once I have had some practice time.
Vergadain will be pleased, though I'm sure he'll be happy whichever of the two paths I follow.
I have my ring on me, if that's what you're wondering. Master Drogan said we weren't required to wear it constantly in order for its power to work, you know. Why do you ask?
I keep both the ring and my stash of focus crystals in a very safe spot. It's not that I don't trust you, <FirstName>... but I'd really rather not discuss this any further. No offense.
Drogan showed you how to make more crystals in the lab inside his bedroom, didn't he? If you're short on focus crystals to power your ring, maybe we should consider going there.
I never told you my sister's name... or my clan name. Did you wonder about that?
Oh. So, when would be the right time? When we're stone dead on the steps of those "bigger things?" Why ask if you don't care?
Don't be ignorant, <FullName>, not now. There's too much going on for your little tantrum to matter.
Let's just get back to work, then. My little thoughts can go unsaid. You've got your own troubles anyway. Hmph!
Yes, I guess I have been fairly open about all of this. It's strange to have it out and said. Talking has made things a lot clearer.
I suppose not, but it wasn't really my business to dump it on you, either. Talking has made things a lot clearer, though.
I just felt... well, we dwarves put so much importance on names, I really wanted you to understand what brought me here before I shared them.
And by "here" I mean with you and at Drogan's and all of it, not just inside an ancient Netheril city.
All right, all right. I suppose this has been like digging gems in shale. Lots of loose rock keeps burying any progress.
Heh... so have I, in a way. I make a pretty wishy washy dwarf, hmm? Been out of the mines too long.
But all that matters now is that we're sitting in a seat of ancient power, knocking on the door of a medusa, and I'm wasting time with old grudges.
Perspective changes it all, I guess. My sister, she chose her life. My clan, they follow their hearts. Me, I follow the Trickster and try not to worry.
Dorna Trapspringer... it's not a bad name, but maybe I'll add a little. Dorna Trapspringer of the Stoneshear.
My sister Kiirna would have liked it, I'm sure.
You see? That should have bothered me, but given what we've seen along our journey, it's so far beneath my notice I can't even see it.
And knowing what we have yet to face, I think you'll come to appreciate anything that keeps me in good spirits.
Come on then, <FullName>, let's see what this place has hidden.
It does, and I will. Knowing what we have yet to face, anything that keeps me in good spirits will serve to help us both, I think.
I am too. Knowing what we have yet to face, anything that gives me good cheer will serve to help us both.
You mean leaving the clan after my sister's death and erasure? I did for a while, but being out here isn't so bad. I think Vergadain likes me going far and wide.
The Dwarffather Moradin might not approve, but even so, he would not want to see me come to harm. I at least have faith in that.
No, I more regret the way my home left me. I have met many a dwarf that agreed our kind could move a little faster and still be only half as flighty as the elves.
Ah, but you rest your trust in transient things, like forests and plants and... I don't know, other green stuff.
Look, I'm no expert on all things elven-ish, but you know the differences between us. Stone does not move without great pressure behind it.
And the stone "is what it is," and yet we still carve it. The ore we dig "is what it is," and yet we forge all manner of armor and weapons from it.
Would it be so bad if things were to change? Maybe just enough so that we don't feel shame when someone goes against the norm?
Maybe it was just my clan. I have met dwarves from other lands that did not seem so trapped by presumptions.
I just can't help feeling that someone should have done something to make things right. Why was nothing done?
Why can't you? Why can't someone else come up with the answers for once? Why is it up to me to keep swinging at the wall?
That's not fair. I tried. I really did. I just... couldn't fail anymore. Why is it my job to hammer at the wall?
I can't run away from it completely, I guess. I'm as guilty as the rest of my clan. I'm starting to see that now.
The elders were afraid to change, so they ignored what happened. I was afraid to try to change them and fail, so I just left.
I was as weak as they were.
Everybody has their own way, hmm? I'd agree, but everything affects everyone else too. I don't know how to do the least damage.
I've tried to leave everyone alone... aside from swindling the odd coin. I just feel like I left some things undone. Maybe I'll go back one day.
I suppose I did, though I don't like boats much anyway. Too prone to sinking when they get loaded full of baggage.
I'd like to think so, but I don't know if that's fair anymore. What right did I have to force others out of their comfortable ruts?
I mean, we're good diggers and those are some nice ruts. It takes years to craft those. Everybody has the right to be in the place they want, right?
I don't know, maybe I should head back that way someday... assuming I survive our current trouble.
I just feel like I've left some things unfinished, you know?
Yes I was... and I have. There's no cleansing wind like the truth, <FirstName>. I might as well say what has troubled me for so long.
See, my sister was young... and though she put on a brave face after being banished, I knew she couldn't last on her own.
She tried to join a group of adventurers and found mercenaries instead. Even then she couldn't make it, and the lot of them almost starved.
There was much of her that was strong like that. Stubborn to the point of foolishness. The elders had counted on her being weak. They were wrong.
Proud and stubborn. the elders hadn't counted on that. They wanted her to weaken, but she surprised us all.
She was supposed to realize what she had lost. Instead, I think she started to resent the clan. She must have got tired of being hungry and just snapped.
She told the group about lightly-guarded clan storehouses. I don't think they meant to hurt anyone... but you know how these things go.
Not enough to hurt the clan. Well, not beyond its pride, anyway. We were in no real danger but it was an embarrassment.
A few guards. Good people that put their lives before clan property. Two of the raiders were killed too. It jaded both sides.
Not long. They didn't know enough to properly cover their tracks. There was an attempt at a peaceful surrender, but there were too many bruised egos.
Pretty much what you would think. She had built up a lot of hatred and wouldn't surrender. In truth, our guards weren't very interested in taking her alive.
She fell with the rest of the raiders. As a traitor her name was stricken from the clan roster. It was like she had never existed.
It was exactly how I used to feel; like I didn't matter and could be overlooked if enough people agreed it was okay to look away.
Should blame be assigned at all? She did what she did, but the clan failed her. She paid for their mistakes.
Exactly. Their attempts to pressure her failed and pushed her farther away. She was punished for their failure.
Did she? What did she do? She was treated like dirt and responded. She refused to be molded. Was she to be punished because the clan failed her?
And what about me? I set the example. I was the one that said not to listen to the elders, if not by words then by deeds.
When she was simply erased to avoid embarrassment, that's when I had to leave. They learned nothing... because they didn't want to.
So I left. My clan, my family, my name... all of it. And here I am, a little voice for Vergadain far away from her home.
I wasn't running from a fight, I was running from a place where I didn't seem to matter. Maybe I just wanted to see what my sister saw.
I didn't think so. At least, not soon enough that it would feel like I did it for my sister. We move slow under the mountains.
I wandered for a while, then went to Drogan and asked him to teach me. And now I'm on this foolish task with you. I think I've done well for myself.
Speaking of our task, we should get back to it. Maybe we can talk more later. I don't know what else there is to say, though.
Yes, yes I was saying something about that. I'm not sure I really want to get into it, though. I'm not used to such personal talk.
What about you, <FirstName>? Why did you come to Drogan's? What is your story?
And you're a master of the obvious. I shouldn't burden you with my failings. A depressed dwarf... how pathetic is that? Very against type.
So you were looking for excitement? I was too. I thought I was. Maybe I just wanted to get away. Ah, could I be any more foolish?
So you are just a wandering hand that needed a place to stay? Sounds like my sister. I miss her. Look at me, could I be more foolish?
Our kind, we dwarves, are very tough on the outside... and on the inside too. All this reflection on feelings and past mistakes... that's an elf's job.
It's silly, really. Everything would be fine if I didn't let any of it bother me. Just swing the pick and live through the stone.
Why wasn't I content with that, <FirstName>? Why did I want to be Dorna Trapspringer? Why not Kingmason or Stoneshear?
Maybe I am, but so what? Don't I have a right to take what I can? Our lives are not lived for other people. At least, I always believed that.
I'm going to have to think about this... I need a little time. Let's get back to work for now. I don't wnat to overshadow what we have to do.
It led to bad things. Is there a difference if the outcome is the same? I don't know. I shouldn't have to feel this way.
Your questions make me remember, <FirstName>, and I'm not sure I like that. I've gone a long time without confronting where I came from.
Give me a little time. I don't want to talk about this right now. I don't want it to overshadow what we have to do.
Maybe, but I know it all and I don't understand myself. Bah, why do I get so worked up about this? I lived my life... is that so bad?
Was I? I suppose I was. It might be good to talk about it. It was kind of my fault what happened. Kind of.
I was the upstart that made the clan elders all huffy, and she wanted to be like me. She thought all it took was going against what they said.
She never wanted to cause any harm... it all just got blown out of proportion.
Her name? I'll get to that. I have to say a few other things first to make it clear what happened. It was such a little thing.
It's hard to accept that she was punished over so little a thing. It seems so pointless... so sad.
I am. Just give me time. It's hard to accept that she was punished over so little a thing. It seems so pointless.
I followed the spiritual path. Trickery too, but spiritual. She was all blades and glory. She wanted to follow our father into the elite guard.
There was no obvious sign that this should be tolerated, not like in my case, so the elders forbade it. She sought training anyway.
When it was discovered that she had "defied what was best for her," she was banished for a time to learn what she had lost.
Perhaps, but not at the time. She made a life as an adventurer but there were unforeseen consequences.
She would have said the same thing. She managed as an adventurer for a while, but there were unforeseen consequences.
Much more. She made a life as an adventurer but... there were unforeseen consequences.
Suffice it to say that all did not go well and in the end I decided I felt better away from certain... influences. I hope you understand.
Maybe you're right, but that doesn't mean I want to run at the mouth for an hour. This isn't the most pleasant of memories.
I shouldn't be telling you anything really. We dwarves are not used to sharing. Maybe I've been on the surface too long.
In any case, I'm done talking for now. Maybe later.
Ah, I just need some time to figure it all out. I've been avoiding this subject for quite a while now. Just give me a little time.
We'll talk again, I'm sure.
I didn't give it up, I've just chosen not to use it for now. It was a very personal decision. I'm not sure I could make you understand.
You see, dwarven surnames are granted by the clan elders. You must honor it or be stripped of it and exiled.
I couldn't abide by some of the decisions of the elders, so I have chosen to not associate with them. It was... not an easy thing to do.
What would you know of it? I can try and explain, but I don't think I'll want to cover it all at once. It was not a good time in my life.
I'd have to tell you a bit about myself to really explain. I don't think I want to go into everything all at once. It was not a good time in my life.
See, I follow Vergadain, the Short Father, God of Wealth and Luck. It wasn't that long ago that females weren't allowed to be clerics in his service.
1358 DR saw a reordering of the gods and Vergadain began accepting us. Clan elders didn't like it, but they certainly couldn't say a god was wrong.
Most of the elders came to accept it over time, though there are those that shunned me from time to time. Nothing official, but it was evident.
Oh, I really couldn't care less about being accepted by those old rock-pushers. No, there were other things that bothered me.
I didn't care about their opinion at all. There were... other things that caused me to walk away.
See, my family suffered for my forward thinking. I had a sister and she... had some trouble because of me.
She didn't fare as well as I did. She was younger, you see, and she... well... maybe I should take a while to dig up what I really need to say.
This is not easy, <FirstName>. Look, if you want to hear this, give me a bit of time. If not, just don't ask again. It's that simple.
It is. Thank you for your patience, <FirstName>.
Then I am even less interested in telling you in a timely manner. Talk to me when you want to continue. If you don't, just keep walking.
As you know, being a dwarf yourself, dwarven surnames are granted by the clan elders. You must honor it or be stripped of it and exiled.
Oh, that's nothing special. I had heard his reputation for training and that he was accepting students. You don't leave your clan without preparation, you know.
That's not it at all. I don't expect you to understand. There were just some things that I couldn't support anymore.
I would have preferred to stay but... there were things I just couldn't support anymore. It's not something you will be able to understand.
This dwarf would and did. I don't expect you to understand, even if we are the same race. There were things I couldn't support any more.
I haven't really said I don't want to be a part of the clan, there are just a few things that have to get resolved before I go back.
It's not like that. My parents were very supportive of me. There were a few policies that I just couldn't agree with.
I wouldn't call it simple, no, but it had to be done. I didn't fit in with the way things were.
