No, I left on my own accord. It was... well, it was just a matter of disagreeing with a few fundamental clan policies.
It might seem a strong reaction... you'll notice that my chosen surname of Trapspringer isn't a traditional dwarven name. It was just something I had to do.
Not to a dwarf, it isn't. I'm not sure I can make you understand why I did this. Let's just get back to our job. We've important work to do.
That's... my own business. I'm sorry, but I don't know if I'm ready to talk about it. Besides, we've got important things to do.
I suppose you think I was exiled and stripped of it. Well, no I wasn't. As hard as it is for you to understand, this was my choice.
I really don't feel like continuing this conversation right now. Could we leave it for now? We've important work to do.
Talk to me some other time. Maybe I'll feel more like it then.
Well, all right, but don't keep me waiting too long. I want to help in this.
I'm right behind you. We'll have this wrapped up in no time. Relatively speaking, I mean. There's a lot to do.
I welcome being able to move again. A medusa... how do you fight that? Could you feel anything while turned to stone? I thought I felt cold... if I thought at all.
Does that seem right to you? It was so frightening. Wait... what is this collar you're wearing?
Blast! I wish Master Drogan was here!
I thought you always had a plan. Maybe you needed Master Drogan more than you are willing to admit.
Will it? I'd rather have him here in person. He had the skills to teach us; our abilities are just hand-me-downs.
I am, and I think we would be better off with Master Drogan here. He gave his life so we could get trapped? I don't think so!
I'm sorry. It's just... we're in the most amazing city I've ever seen and all we've managed to do is get enslaved by the Asabi.
I should be studying this place... scoping out what we can pocket. Instead I'm worrying like I'm still in my first pair of boots.
I... of course, <FirstName>. I apologize. I just... miss Master Drogan so. The pain is still so fresh. But we have much to do, don't we?
No, that wouldn't help. Don't worry, I'm not going to start bawling. I just wanted some time to mourn, but I guess it has to wait.
I know. I just want time to mourn Master Drogan, that's all. It shouldn't have to wait, but I guess it has to.
I'm ready. Just tell me what to do. We'll make it... I'm sure.
If you want to scout around, go ahead. I can wait here for a bit. It's not like there's a shortage of things to look at... or appraise.
I'm right behind you. Keep on your toes... for danger and treasure both.
And... thank you, <FirstName>, for saving me. Truly, I appreciate it.
Just because I want to see the place doesn't mean I'll be distracted by it. Look, if you want me along, great. I don't really care one way or the other.
More like an interest in this particular period. The Netherese disappeared so completely and suddenly, and it's still a mystery as to why.
Make no mistake, however. It's a passing interest and nothing I've dedicated myself to. This is human history we're talking about, after all.
Still, it might be useful if we travel together. Whatever you find out here in this desert is bound to be as dangerous as it is intriguing.
You too. Perhaps we should stick together... this seems a dangerous place.
As you will. If you change your mind, I shouldn't be far off.
I agree. Stay alert... I smell trouble ahead.
If you're here to help Master Drogan, you'll need to get underway as soon as possible. Do you need my help?
You're only one <man/woman>. Would it hurt to have someone to watch your back? Come on, take me. I want to use what I've been taught.
Well, you know me... if you need sharp eyes to watch for ambushes, or a nasty trap dealt with, I'm your girl. What do you say?
Well, I'll be here once you've made up your mind.
Great! We'll have Master Drogan's artifacts back in no time... and maybe pick up a coin or two for ourselves along the way. Let's go.
There's no need to be like that. I'll just wait until you think you're ready. Yeesh.
I suppose it can, but we should talk about a few things when there is time.
The farm... it seems familiar. Maybe from overhearing Master Drogan and one of his visitors.
Of course, you know all about it now, having talked with that Nathan Hurst character. The less said about him, I think, the better.
Of course, what is one dwarf's opinion when a man has powerful friends? I don't care who he knows, Hurst is what he is and that's all I'll say.
Let's just get moving.
My tone and words both. I don't care who he knows, Hurst is what he is. Ah, I've already given him too much attention.
Hurst! Nathan Hurst. That's who lives there. I heard him and Master Drogan discussing something... he described how to get here in good detail.
A dwarf knows how to interpret directions and the lay of the land. This has to be the place.
I remembered it because of what he is, not because of what he said. Duergar. A deep-dwelling duergar out of his proper place.
He is no dwarf. Duergar. A deep-dwelling duergar out of his proper place. Be careful near him.
They are the darker side of a history we would like to forget. Twisted by illithids they long ago became something evil... not to be trusted.
They live deep underground with the most foul of neighbors. Don't trust him, <FirstName>, you'll regret it.
Not as such, but it doesn't hurt to be on guard. His kind are naturally driven to evil. I didn't say to torch his farm, just that you should be careful.
It's just a matter of fact that his kind are driven to the darker things in life. I didn't say we should torch his farm, just that you should be careful.
I'm glad. He's probably no threat, but we don't know what he's capable of. Just be careful, that's all I'm saying.
He doesn't have to be *all* bad to hurt our mission. Just be careful, that's all I'm saying.
Well, I was concerned a dragon wouldn't be enough trouble for us. Heh, it seems we are caught between some powerful players.
Both J'Nah and Tymofarrar seem willing to go to any lengths to get Master Drogan's artifacts. I wish I knew what was really going on.
Oh, I'm sure it all looks so neat and tidy when it's printed up in your journal. All the possible paths clearly laid out, hmm?
Well, lead on, then. I won't give a thought to the little things, like why such powerful creatures are interested in that whelp Deekin and his statue.
Just don't blame me if we run into more than we can handle. Dragons, artifacts, a dodgy sorceress... what's next?
Do we know who we are taking it from, or why? What do these powerful creatures want with that little Deekin fool and his statue?
Good. This J'Nah wasn't telling us everything, that's for sure. I wonder why there's so much more interest in that Deekin creature's statue?
I don't like the thought that there's someone even further above us involved. Like that "mistress" we overheard J'Nah speaking to.
Hey, I didn't say I was going anywhere. I just want to be careful. We have to find what we need and get home in one piece, right? Let's get going.
I'll follow, but the only thing that will stop me from worrying is finding what we need and getting back home.
It better serve a purpose or I'm losing sleep for nothing. Let's just find what we need and try to get home in one piece.
I don't know that we can trust what this kobold said, no matter how smart or different he seems. His kind are usually pawns of greater evils.
Ah, so you view all your companions with equal suspicion, is that it? Does that apply to me as well? Do you trust me no further than this Deekin?
I suppose it doesn't really matter either way. I'm just here to support you. Just remember that I've an interest in the outcome of this little adventure as well.
Even if he was being honest, does he really understand what he's talking about? He could lead you into a trap without knowing the danger.
He talked of dragons as well. They don't give up their trinkets easily.
I don't know. I suppose we can follow his lead for a time, but don't let your guard down. He talked of dragons, and they don't give up their trinkets easily.
That's called intelligence, you fool. It's a *dragon*! What else is there to fear if you don't fear giant, toothy, manipulating lizards?
That's easy enough to guess. Anyone it couldn't buy it would simply threaten. Not a lot of people can say "no" to a giant lizard. Not and live, anyway.
Well... no, but I've heard a few tales. I suppose my sources really aren't any more reliable than this creature. Still, this worries me.
Why would this thing even be interested in the artifacts? I don't suppose there's any way to verify what this Deekin said.
We'll have to move forward and trust we can handle what comes. I doubt Master Drogan thought we would be facing such creatures so early in our training.
The crypt... even just inside you can smell the death in the air. I suppose that's appropriate but I'd still rather do without the memory of it.
Of course, if we get rich off the place, I'll still manage to sleep at night.
Whoa, slow down. I'm not interested in gutting the place. I juts figure that any gold or gems are better off with me. It's an Elven crypt, after all.
What does it hurt? It won't slow us down that much. Besides, any gold or gems are better off with me. It's an Elven crypt, after all.
I wouldn't take everything, but if you are talking about gold and gems, I'm sure they are better off with me. It's an Elven crypt, after all.
Not as such, and I've no interest in whatever fanciful cloaks are draped over their dead, but mined valuables belong with dwarves.
Consider it my way of keeping the Elves consistent. Elves don't dig. They excavate, sure, but they don't dig.
It just seems to me that Elves shouldn't put these things back in the ground if they didn't take them out in the first place.
Now just a minute, I haven't done anything yet. I just think burying "wealthy dead" is a waste of good gold.
There are far worse things to do to a burial site than taking excess gold. I'd hope the dead would understand that.
Come on, let's just get on with our task at hand.
I don't mean any offense. It just seems to me that Elves shouldn't put these things back in the ground if they didn't take them out in the first place.
I'm not looking for trouble. I'll keep to myself and let you lead. It just seems like a waste to me.
Well, think about it. I don't care if they drape their dead in fanciful cloaks or wood-carved whatever, but mined valuables belong with dwarves.
I just had a flash of memory as we entered Hilltop... it's a lot different now, that's for sure. Kobolds everywhere. Must have been a big fight.
Fine, I'll shut up, but you should spend a little time looking around, <FullName>. It's important to remember things like this.
I like a good dust-up as much as anyone but this wasn't a fair fight, and neither was the one back at the school.
I don't think the people had much of a choice. They may have been on their home turf but I doubt they had Master Drogan's skill to draw on.
Nothing they could do but pick up a shovel and hope for the best. Looks like they did all right. Well... relatively. People still died.
That's a bit cold to say. I mean, you're right that they could have been better trained, but this really isn't the time to say it.
You won't make any friends if you lecture while people are down. It all rolls off of me, but I doubt others will be so understanding.
Good idea. With this many attacking there'd have to be some hiding somewhere. We'll get our share, I don't doubt it.
Things aren't that grim yet. Master Drogan could still pull through if we get back the stolen artifacts. Get mad, sure, but stay on track too.
Let's scout around a bit more. We'll fight through a few stragglers and pick up a few coins, all while looking like heroes to the locals.
Come on, let's get moving. We've a lot left to do.
Of course not, but padding my pocket while helping out doesn't hurt anyone in the least.
Well, it's just that this is a big thing. We're leaving everything behind to find these kobolds and artifacts we didn't even know about.
I don't even know where to start. All I can think about is Master Drogan... lying there.
You may be able to just shut everything out, but I can't. Where I'm from, when someone is hurt you make the guilty pay for it.
So I'll shut up for now, but you just remember that Master Drogan needs us and we need him. Let's go.
Sure, you've progressed farther than all of us so you're not worried at all. I have a couple doubts, I guess, but I trained hard too.
That's what I was thinking, but I'm not going to let it get me down if you don't. He trained us well. I can do things I never thought possible.
Master Drogan has always been a good teacher. I owe it to him to try my best to help him.
You know, <FirstName>, I was thinking a little about that myself. I'm not above pocketing a few coins here and there. Just so long as we get the job done.
It will be interesting to see these things. I bet they are impressive. I won't let them distract me too much, though. I'll be looking for the odd coin, I think.
Well, don't forget that we'll be on our own soon and need to think about ourselves too. The odd coin here and there could fall our way.
That's the way of Vergadain. A little luck, a little skill, and a little bit of something for yourself in your pocket at the end of the day.
We've talked enough, I think. The sooner we head out, the sooner Master Drogan is better and we can count up the spoils. Let's go!
So... this is it. Heurodis is just ahead.
Very. To come all this way... through all of this. She has to pay for everything. Coin for coin... everything. I'll see to it.
Is it? I hadn't noticed. It's seemed kind of muddy up until now. I guess I'm ready. She's got a lot to answer for.
No, I'm well past that. This creature has taken a lot from me. I think it's time I took something back.
I'm right behind you, <FirstName>. Just give me a fair shot at her. I want her last sight to be me rifling through her pockets.
It's so frustrating. This creature... Heurodis, we don't even know if we can survive fighting her but we have to jump through hoops to even try.
Find the Three Winds... it's always something, you know?
I never said I would either. Not that I wouldn't mind returing to some simpler concerns. Take some simple gold coins? Oh no, I have to defeat a medusa in an ancient floating city. Bah!
Is that so bad? I get tired of these big concerns being dumped on us all the time. Take some simple gold coins? Oh no, I have to defeat a medusa in an ancient floating city. Bah!
Where would I go? Besides, all I meant was that I miss having small concerns. Take some simple gold coins? Oh no, I have to defeat a medusa in an ancient floating city. Bah!
I guess Master Drogan trained us to look for this sort of trouble. His skills would be wasted on the petty thief I used to be.
Fine, fine, whatever you want. We have to find the Three Winds to enter Temple of the Winds and defeat Heurodis. That sums it up, all nice and neat.
I'll try to be all business, like you want.
He prepared us for it anyway, knowing or not. I never knew what he saw in any of us, really. I guess I was just scared of seeing it too.
And here we are... wherever that is. Are you ready to go on?
I think we always do. Me, I choose to keep going... and keep an eye out for valuables along the way.
Even this high up, it's important to stay grounded, you know.
Me too. We'll find what we need, and maybe a few valuables along the way as well, heh?
Anything is possible, though I'd hope that if I could see the future, I'd do a better job of avoiding my own death. I don't think he knew.
That tremor... there's no fooling a dwarf, the whole place is moving. There's not a calm spot in this whole city.
It's weird, though. Is it on the verge of collapsing or... something else? It seems impossible... doesn't it?

We may be moving, <FirstName>. Heurodis is tapping the ancient Netheril magic that once floated whole cities. What if she is trying to raise this one out of the ground? What if this city is trying to fly again?
This is scaring me. I can't even imagine the forces needed to move a city. It should shake itself apart. It still could.
We have to find out what is going on. We may already be too late.
Master Drogan is... really gone. There's no way he could have... no way. <FirstName>, I... don't know if I want to do this anymore.
It wasn't long ago I was just a student. Now we're trapped here... and the only real teacher I ever had is dead.
"Move on?" That's your answer? Just pick up and walk away from the death of the most important figure in my life? And here I thought he might mean something to you, as well.
Nice. Real nice. I hope I never get as cold as you. I won't let this affect me like that. I won't let it.
Let's get going, <FirstName>. Master Drogan gave us a chance to do something. Don't waste it.
And who decides that? Who has the right to say that his time had come? It's not right, I tell you, it's not right!
I'm sorry, <FirstName>. It upsets me... more than perhaps it should. In this my faith fails me.
He wouldn't want to be dead, either. We don't always get what we want, I guess.
He was more skilled than either of us, <FirstName>. What hope have we got without him? His direction got us this far.
I suppose he did, and I wouldn't want to disappoint him. I suppose you think he would want us to continue in his memory?
Vergadain is the Laughing Dwarf, the Short Father. His teachings are about the joy of negotiation and trickery. Of luck in the face of great odds.
I don't think even he would have liked our chances. Master Drogan isn't with him. Master Drogan will be with Dumathoin, the Silent Keeper, the guardian of the dead.
That is little comfort to me. I don't much care for honoring the dead. I would rather honor people while they live.
I suppose. There is nothing to gain by sitting down to die. Vergadain would hardly approve of that.
Very well, <FirstName>, I will follow as I always do... and try to find some meaning in this.
As for you, Master Drogan... you were more than a mere teacher to me. You were a mentor and a father. I am grateful for your sacrifice and shall mourn your passing always.
Now you are return to the old stones once again. Go in peace, Drogan. Your duty is done. We shall fight on for you. Amen.
Yes, I'm finished. For now.
Let's go, then, and finish this. May the gods watch over Drogan and all of us who yet live.
Who'd have thought that this little crystal would be such a big deal? And that little Deekin creature had it for so long.
Can you imagine anything more dangerous? From what Garrick said, this thing could kill hundreds.
I'm not sure whose hands could handle it. The only use it has right now is killing whoever uses it to destroy J'Nah's mistress..
Other than sacrificing someone while delivering it, you mean? I hope so. It has to have a better use than that.
You mean J'Nah's mistress and whoever is foolish enough to deliver the surprise. I hope it doesn't come to that.
We have to find out what it's actually good for. Heck, we've got to find out who we're really supposed to use it against. We barely know who our enemy is.
Given the age of the ancient ruin... what else is waiting for us?
Oh ha ha, make a game of it. Look, I don't think I'm being ureasonable. I just want to know that we have a chance of coming out of this alive.
There's nothing wrong with turning a situation to profit, but I'm starting to think I'll be glad just getting out of this with my life.
Well, we've got a lot of baggage to carry around now. Let's try and get done what needs to be done.
It just seems so strange that Master Drogan asked us to do this for him, to find out what this crystal is. He is doing much better, after all.
Or perhaps I'm just having trouble adjusting to this confidence he's showing. I'm used to being a student.
I guess not. It's just weird moving from one role to another. I always thought I'd spend my first days away from Master Drogan tricking the locals out of their gold.
Nothing too devastating, of course, just a little misdirection for a coin or two, but it seemed like such a big deal at the time. Now... look at us.
I suppose, but with everything happening so fast, I guess he didn't get to the part where he tells me that instead of just you. Ah, I'm just kidding.
Let's get back at it, I guess. We've got a lot to do yet.
Heh, I suppose we do. All right then, let's get back to work. Master Drogan wouldn't want us laying about.
All right, I'll be quiet. Maybe that's best. I was getting positively elvish there for a second.
It is exhilarating, I'll give it that. Definitely not the career I was planning... if I ever had a plan beyond tricking the locals out of their gold.
Oh, I'm capable. I wouldn't have lived this long if I wasn't, but if empty bravado is all you want, maybe you should have brought Xanos.
Come on, let's get going. We've got to find out what this crystal can do.
You don't need to be so harsh, but I suppose I should spend some time going over what happened. I'll wait here until you're ready to have me back.
That is probably best. I don't want to rush back out or I'll be just end up chewing the dirt again.
I'll come, but you don't need to be like that. I ended up here because I was following you, remember.
Well, let's not worry about whose fault it was. I'll just be careful not to make a habit of doing it. It's... unsettling.
<StartHighlight>Dorna is currently unconscious and will likely die if he is not given aid very soon.</Start>
This is not a good time to speak.
No, stay here for now.
Yes, come with me.
Just wait here a while longer.
Yes, come with me.
No, never mind.
Yes, come with me.
Never mind.
I think we need to part ways.
All right, stay with me, then.
Just stay here for the moment.
Yes, you should go for now.
I'd like you to level up.
I want to change your tactics.
I don't want to change anything else right now.
I want to move faster and not bother with stealth or searching.
I need you to be stealthy right now.
Don't help me if I fail to open a locked door or chest.
Help me if I fail to open a locked door or chest.
I want to change the distance you stay away from me.
Stay a long distance away from me.
Keep a medium distance.
Stay close.
Go ahead and attack as soon as you see enemies.
Defend me and don't attack until I do.
I want to adjust your equipment.
Can you identify my equipment?
I need you to cast a spell.
Never mind.
No, that's it.
Virtue.
Ultravision.
True Seeing.
Summon Creature IX.
Summon Creature VIII.
Summon Creature VII.
Summon Creature VI.
Summon Creature V.
Summon Creature IV.
Summon Creature III.
Summon Creature II.
Summon Creature I.
Spell Resistance.
Shield of Faith.
See Invisibility.
Restoration.
Resistance.
Resist Elements.
Remove Fear.
Remove Disease.
Remove Curse.
Remove Blindness/Deafness.
Protection From Elements.
Planar Ally.
Owl's Wisdom.
Neutralize Poison.
Negative Energy Protection.
Mass Haste.
Mage Armor.
Light.
Lesser Restoration.
Invisibility Sphere.
Invisibility
Improved Invisibility.
Haste.
Greater Restoration.
Ghostly Visage.
Freedom of Movement.
Fox's Cunning
Find Traps.
Greater Sanctuary.
Ethereal Visage.
Entropic Shield.
Energy Buffer.
No, I've changed my mind.
Yes, go ahead.
Endure Elements.
Endurance.
Eagle's Splendour.
Divine Favor.
Death Ward.
Create Undead.
Create Greater Undead.
Continual Flame.
Clarity.
Cat's Grace.
Bull's Strength.
I've changed my mind.
Cast it on my animal companion.
Cast it on my familiar.
Cast it on me.
Cast it on yourself.
Bless.
Animate Dead.
Aid.
What was it you wanted to say earlier?
Let's stop and talk for a moment.
I think that's enough talking for now.
How are you right now?
I want to discuss your training.
<StartAction>[Dorna will gain levels as both a cleric and a rogue.]</Start> Split your training between cleric and rogue.
<StartAction>[Dorna will gain levels as both a cleric and a rogue.]</Start> That's fine, continue as you are.
<StartAction>[Dorna will only gain levels as a rogue.]</Start> Concentrate on rogue training only.
<StartAction>[Dorna will only gain levels as a cleric.]</Start> I want to you concentrate on your cleric training only.
Where is your ring? The one Drogan gave us?
And where do you keep it?
There's no need to be suspicious of me.
You look troubled. Not that the situation doesn't call for it.
I don't care. There's far bigger things to worry about.
I figured you would offer eventually.
It wasn't my business to press the subject.
Then get on with what you need to say.
I have tried to see your side of things.
Seems like pointless dramatics to me. You're good at that.
A small change, but if it makes you happy, go ahead.
It sounds fine. I'm glad you found peace with it.
Do you regret the way you left your home?
Ah, you just want too much.
It is too bad you couldn't find what you wanted there.
We are flighty? We outlive you.
I wouldn't go too far. We are who we are.
I don't think I can answer that for you.
Ask yourself, you're the one that ran away.
You left for your own well being. No harm in that.
You paid the price for rocking the boat.
They were the worse offenders.
You were deciding what to say about your sister.
I'd starve too rather than come crawling back.
And she was too proud to ask for help?
How much did they get away with?
Who got hurt?
How long before they were caught?
What happened to your sister?
So who was responsible for this?
Hardly a victory for the clan.
She got what she deserved.
You just ran away like a coward?
There was nothing else you could do?
You were saying that your sister became an adventurer.
You're dodging the question.
I wanted adventure.
Nowhere else to go, really.
You're too needy. Always wanting more.
Was what you wanted all that bad?
Maybe if you finished your story I would understand better.
You were about to tell me about your sister.
What was her name?
I'm listening.
Get to the point.
This is little different than you training with Drogan.
So she was kicked out. So what?
I assume there is more to it than that?
You wouldn't have said anything if you didn't want to talk.
If that's all you want to say, that's your choice.
You said you gave up your name. Why?
Some piddling overblown disagreement, probably.
What happened to cause you to do this?
I understand your anger at not being accepted.
Is that it? They lost; why let their opinion bother you?
Bah! A waste of my time.
If that is what you want.
Take your time. I'm only mildly interested anyway.
Tell me about yourself. What led you to Drogan?
So the spoiled little dwarf was looking for adventure. How novel.
Bored with the traditional life, hmm?
You left your clan? A dwarf wouldn't do that.
Ran away from your oppressive parents, hmm?
So you simply left?
Sounds like you're a criminal on the run.
Still sounds like a token gesture.
What happened that made you feel this way?
No dwarf willfully gives up her name.
No, not just yet.
Yes, come with me.
It's a slave collar. A "gift" from the Asabi that rescued us.
Quit whining. We need to figure out what to do.
I do too, but his training will help us in his place.
We have to think of ourselves!
You'd think you'd be a bit more grateful I restored you to flesh.
If that's all you can offer maybe you should just stay here.
It's overwhelming, but what else can we do? We go on.
I want you to stay here for now.
Come with me. We need to get moving.
Can you be useful if you are sightseeing like a fool?
Come on, then. Let's go.
You have an interest in history?
It's good to see you.
I want to look around on my own for a bit.
Yes, I think that would be wise.
Drogan said I should take someone. Sounds like baggage to me.
Bringing an extra pair of hands would be a good idea.
I'm not sure... perhaps I should check with Xanos.
I think that would be a good idea.
Not now Dorna! I'll let you know when I want to talk.
I'm sorry, this isn't a good time. Can it wait?
I suppose I have the time right now. What is it?
Keep your opinion to yourself.
Your tone says you don't like him.
You know it from one overheard conversation?
Is he a dwarf as well?
Duergar? Explain what that is.
Do you have any evidence that he has done something wrong?
You surpise me with your intolerance.
Warning noted. I'll be extra careful.
If Drogan knew him, he can't be all bad.
Pointless speculation. Let's just do what we have to.
Wishing doesn't help. We have to take what we need.
As do I. We'll proceed carefully.
Leave if you want. My task is clear.
Don't bother worrying. Just follow my lead.
Your caution will serve us well, I think.
Bah. I'll use him like anyone else.
You aren't curious at all? He seemed sincere.
I agree, but what choice do we have for now?
Is that fear in your voice?
I'm more worried how the dragon got his information.
Have you had any experience with dragons?
That's the spirit. We'll strip the place bare.
We're not here to loot. Keep focused.
You have no trouble looting the dead?
Do you harbor some kind of grudge against elves?
You'll make any excuse to cover your greed!
And if you happen to profit, all the better.
You make too many assumptions. I'll be watching you.
What's that got to do with it?
Thank you for the insight. Be quiet now.
And we missed it. Just like at Drogan's.
I'd have fought hard too.
They should have fought harder. Weaklings.
Maybe there's a few kobolds left we can help mop-up.
Just like at the school. I'll make these kobolds pay.
I like the way you think.
You're not just in this for the gold, are you?
Suck it up and keep moving. Whining won't help.
He'll be fine. We'll make sure of it.
I don't know if he'll survive. There's a lot to do.
And if we make a little gold along the way, all the better.
I also want to see these artifacts he kept hidden.
That's all I care about. We'll help him.
I guess so. It's a strange feeling, isn't it?
Yes. Our purpose is clear.
What, are you going to whine about that too?
I can't walk away from it. Not now.
If it was easy, we wouldn't need heroes.
If you have a problem with saving everyone, take a walk.
Yes, yes, we've both grown. Could we get on with it?
I don't think anyone planned for this.
Like I have a choice.
I am.
He was a wise man. Could he have known?
Get to the point, Dorna.
Considering where we are, I'd believe anything.
I can feel it, too. It's not like an earthquake.
Move on. We're still in danger.
It was his time.
Well you don't have to yell at me about it.
Drogan would not want us to despair.
He gave us a chance. We need to use it as best we can.
Look, you're going to have to move on.
Our skill saved him once. He knew we were worthy.
You don't have any answers as a cleric?
Just so long as you move on. We have to go.
Honor him while *you* live. That's all anyone can do.
Are you finished yet?
Let's go. We can't delay any longer.
Amen.
I won't let it fall into the wrong hands.
There's got to be a way to use this to our benefit.
Or just two.
Where's the fun in knowing all the answers?
Is your greed turning to fear?
Do you think his trust is misplaced?
We'll do okay. Drogan knows it.
What, we look almost professional.
Yes, wasting time. Let's go.
It's strange, but I like it.
Step up and prove yourself or go home.
So am I. Stay here for now.
No apology needed, but stay here a while to recover.
Be more careful or it'll happen again. Let's go.
No, I apologize for letting you fall. Welcome back.
This crystal... it is like none I have seen before. Perhaps it was worth the destruction of the artifact to discover it.
I wonder how Drogan... anyone, was able to obtain a tooth like this...
A mask imbued with the power of a god. This could get us much if we chose to use it...
The pieces of the ancient dead have long been known to harbor power after their... dismemberment.
That... that creature is huge! How can we hope to face it directly, should it attack? May... maybe retreat would be a good decision...
This place does not look good. We should be wary while here...
The kobolds flee before us! Flee before Xanos!
Kobolds may not be bright, but they can be tricky... We should be wary of traps.
The gnolls captured all these people? Maybe from Blumberg... or maybe they have ranged farther still...
There are kobolds in these cages as well... The gnolls seem to have captured them.
Why would this building be still standing? It is strange...
This town, too, has been razed... Look! Gnolls!
Bah! All this green makes me queasy... The hills were better...
These mountains are not known to be kind to travelers...
This is a place of great magic. A powerful force resides here...
Many of the creatures died in this battle... but I cannot tell the way it ended, nor what became of the survivors.
The people here, too, seem to have fled the kobolds... or been killed.
A caravan has arrived? One has to wonder about their timing...
Xanos has no need of prophecies of doom and destruction. As long as Xanos has Xanos, there is nothing to fear!
Bah! I could lead this town better than that drunkard...
Hmph. The locals try to fight the kobolds themselves, but they do not have the power of Xanos!
The dwarf's laboratory is downstairs. I wonder how the kobolds were able to breach its defenses?
The tremors do not stop... Xanos fears that bad things will soon happen...
The world shakes with wrath... This does not bode well for us...
All have fallen to Xanos! Rejoice!
Half of these golems have been destroyed under the iron fist of Xanos!
Another has felt the true might of Xanos!
Xanos is not afraid! Xanos will conquer all! Let us face what comes ahead and vanquish it!
The... the creature is huge! Xanos does not think he can handle this alone...
This is a room of great magic... Maybe more magic than Xanos himself can wield... Be wary.
The winds of death flow here... Xanos does like this...
I know where this is going... and it makes Xanos' brain hurt. I hate mazes...
This area is dangerous... The floor looks disturbed, and who knows what manner of creature may lurk in the dark.
The stench of death and magic is upon this place...
This place is strange to Xanos. I trust nothing I cannot understand...
The power of these tomes is beyond my ken... If I, too, could possess such power...
Ah hah! The treasures of the Netherese! These ancient tomes are just the sort of treasures I seek!
Insects will be squashed beneath Xanos' great heel!
With all the power the Netheril had, something could turn all their works to dust... Hope that it does not find us as well.
These halls they've dug up... they're ancient. The knowledge of the Netherese could lie within, demons or not.
Xanos thinks that these archeologists may have dug up something more than what they expected...
Why worship a god if he never listens? These followers of Ao are only deluding themselves...
The water in the oasis flows once more! Now I can finally get a damn drink...
The ancient dead are powerful indeed... but none so powerful as Xanos!
That statue... I recognize its like. It is of Jergal... There is evil at work here.
Dry oasis... old bridge... older tombs... This place is ancient and dead.
This temple is no longer a sacred place, and the dead lie restless. But much power could reside in a place like this...
This oasis is useless! There is no water here!
A foul sacrifice in progress... a helpless person in need... Xanos thinks that heroes are made in times like these!
These caves seem endless... Who knows how far down they go? But the farther they go, the more we might find within.
These holes must lead into their lair. Who knows what may lurk within... but it is the guide we need.
This is one of the holes those scorpion creatures might have come from. We should be on our guard.
Bah! Then I shall remain here until I find something useful to do.
Good! You see the merit in having someone competent accompany you.
Grrr... These small creatures will not last long should Xanos get angry...
Finally! Now I can be rid of them and have something useful to do!
So have you come to your senses? You need Xanos' skills, now, yes?
Bah! Go to your doom alone if you wish! I will be here if your senses return.
Very well, then. I shall accompany you.
What?! You would turn Xanos aside and make your way without him?
Ah, so you have not lost your mind completely. Only with Xanos can you hope to succeed.
*grumble* Very well, I shall remain here. We shall join again when you return.
Bah! Leave if you will, but you shall not get far without me! I will return to Drogan's and wait there.
Xanos will increase his skills and powers as he sees fit.
*You* would advise *me* on tactics?
If that is all you wish...
Very well. Caution and observation shall be sacrificed to speed.
Only those who Xanos wishes to see him, will.
You can attempt them on your own then.
Indeed. Where you have failed, Xanos shall succeed!
How far apart should we remain, then?
It shall be as you wish.
None will stand against Xanos!
Very well, then.
*sigh* Very well, then. Here is my equipment.
Eh. Maybe. Allow Xanos to rummage through your things. If something is found that is identifiable, Xanos will tell you. Good enough?
Now witness the fury of Xanos!
A spell then? What is it you wish me to cast?
What do you really want, then?
This is what you want me to cast?
Who do you want me to cast this on?
Xanos will do this...
You wish to mine my wisdom? The wisdom of Xanos is not something to be taken lightly!
Xanos will survive. Indeed, I shall survive better than all those who have fallen before!
What else is there you wish to speak of?
An adventurer does not speak of the hardships he endures, but... I am fine.
Everything is the same as it always has been. It is a cloth that my name shall be writ large across.
In time I shall be even stronger, and then our current problems will seem as nothing.
I am as well as may be expected given our current situation.
There is a foreboding feeling in the air... As if destiny moved against us...
It would be wiser for you to attend to your own affairs than mine, <FirstName>.
Xanos may not be able to see, but he can hear! All shall fall before me! As soon as I can find them...
I am injured, true, but more than competent enough to solve any problems which you seem incapable of handling.
Xanos has been injured. It may not be advisable for me to stay in harm's way much longer...
I am close to death and need healing soon... My journey cannot end this way!
Cool, clammy skin... Pale complexion... Fever... It would seem that Xanos has been poisoned... *cough* Ohhh...
Xanos is strong! Xanos is healthy! Xanos... has a strange itching sensation... Xanos maybe is not so well...
I am currently only pursuing my magical studies.
I am currently only pursuing my martial studies.
Hmm... perhaps I shall study as you have suggested... Yes, that would be wise.
I am currently pursuing both martial and magical studies.
Hmm... perhaps I shall study as you have suggested... Yes, that would be wise.
Hmm... perhaps I shall study as you have suggested... Yes, that would be wise.
Hmm... perhaps I shall study as you have suggested... Yes, that would be wise.
Hah! When your own ring runs low on focus crystals, you ask me for mine? Do not worry, little <Race>. Xanos keeps his safe.
Xanos knows of your intentions... The ring and the crystals that power it are kept close and safe... for Xanos alone!
Did Drogan not show you how focus crystals are made? Remember the little machine in the lab inside his bedroom? If it is more crystals you are sniffing about for, look for them there, instead.
Ah, well... I do not know. The future seems so far away at times like this.
Bah! I don't know anymore... Things used to be so clear... so certain.
The world was in order and my destiny was secure. But now... but now things have gone far, far beyond what I had thought.
I... I don't think I was ready for this... for any of this. It is only now that I have had time to think that I can... fully appreciate this.
Reality has always been there. It has shaped the ways I have gone, and the opportunities I have had... all for myself.
I know. I will not. But... but maybe things have changed... Maybe the world has... Maybe it is me...
No, it will not. I do not complain of the fate this life has given me... but maybe it has changed... Maybe I have...
I have, maybe. The world has, perhaps. I don't even know anymore.
You once told me that no one can be an island unto themselves... Or was that master Drogan? Maybe it was him... but I remember that lesson well.
You could not tell to look at me, or to listen to the way I speak, but I remember it every day, and every day it strikes home more and more to me.
Hah! Like it or not, you will! This is my time, <FirstName>, and I will spend it as I can! It is the least you can offer me!
*sigh* But it doesn't matter now I guess... I don't know what's come over me...
Maybe... maybe it was the time I spent encased in stone. It was... indescribable. Maybe it affected me.
Bah! You're always so intransigent! It's always the same with you!
But.. maybe that is a good thing. To have an island of stability when everything else seems so far...
I think... I think I will put my destiny... my plans on hold for a while.
Bah! It is not failure I worry about. I... I just need a little time maybe. To get accustomed to the way things seem now.
I think... I would stay in your company if you would let me. I do not think there is any place that I would rather be, right now.
We have spent much time together, you and I, and in spite of all that has happened to us, I still know you... Who you are.
I will stay with you for as long as I need, or for as long as you'll have me. Together we shall find a way to end this task... and maybe, I will find a way to go to my future as well.
Come. We should speak no more of this. Let us continue on our way.
But... I am glad that you have been here, whatever your intentions may have been.
I... I just need a little time maybe. To get accustomed to the way things seem now.
Yes, it has affected me. Unlike you, it seems. Nothing seems to have fazed you... not really, at any rate.
I don't know... I don't know what to think anymore. I just... it...
Hah! Xanos is as strong as ever! Only... I just...
Hah! 'Gentle King Xanos'! I like that one!
You always were the funny one... even when you weren't trying to be! Hah! But you always spoke your mind; that is true.
I had read a great many books before we left master Drogan's. Both books on politics and kingdoms, and on the sorcerer-kings of old, who had carved their kingdoms from the land as I will.
I have had much time to think of the society I would make when I ruled with absolute power. It is a surprisingly difficult task to balance all that would need to be balanced in harmony.
Hah! Neither would Xanos not that long ago, but a happy kingdom is one that can achieve much more than an unhappy one.

It is far better to be loved by the subjects than to be hated by them. You never know when a dissatisfied subject will turn on you, or who may aid him in his cause, but happy subjects... you can tell their intentions in their eyes.
Do not think that I am being overly sentimental by seeking their happiness. No, it is very much self-preservation that causes me to seek this.
You... you're joking, right? Happiness is not an end in and of itself. One who is happy will be complacent, and do nothing more than... than exist!
As much as people may complain and moan about the hardships in their life, it is by such struggles that their own worth is defined.
After all, look at Xanos! I have led a troubled life, and for that, I am destined for greatness! Hah!
Bah! Compared to some, perhaps not. It is not only the troubles one faces that define you, but also your reactions to them. Will you face the pressure, or cave under it?
Some may have been crushed by the life they lead, but Xanos... Xanos will prevail above all! Xanos will never be tread on the ground like so much dirt!
It is you, above all others who should realize this by now. It is by my own indomitable spirit that I will prevail! I will drag myself to the very heights of power by my teeth if I have to!
*sigh* But such things can be wearying of the soul sometimes. Sometimes it is so much easier to want to stop... to rest.
I do not give up on my goal, though. I will prevail! Destiny will be mine!
Hah! You think that I give up on my great goal? Never!
Everyone does need rest, though. Perhaps a little sleep... to regain my strength. At times it feels as though I have been wandering for years through lands I have never expected to see...
Bah! I grow melancholy and thoughtful in my old age... Enough of this! Let us continue on our way, then.
I know not what your destiny is, little <Race>, nor how you will react to the pressures this journey puts upon you. Whatever path you choose, Xanos will prevail!
Bah! Compared to some, perhaps my troubles are not so harsh. It is not only the troubles one faces that define you, but also your reactions to them. Will you face the pressure, or cave under it.
Indeed it is not! I never claimed to be out for anyone but Xanos!
By keeping my subjects happy, I can avoid raising their ire. This has been the downfall of all oppressive tyrants in the past. But I cannot keep them too happy...
I do not follow in their footsteps. No, no, Xanos is not that simple. Rather, I build upon their mistakes. I correct them.
Ah... Now that is a good question, my friend. One that I cannot find an easy answer to.
I do not think that I would like to stay here in the north. It is too cold. Too uninhabited.
No, I am very much a people person. I think I will go south to more populous lands. It is there that I can seek my fortune and destiny on my own.
Hah! I am not gone yet! We still have time together, you and I, and I am thinking that our greatest challenges may yet lie ahead.
But it is nice to dream sometimes. Dream of what will happen when I finally am strong enough to make my wishes a reality.
I will go south, to warmer lands. I will find a nice city or two. Ones dealing with a little bit of instability, or suffering under harsh rulership.
It is then that Xanos will step in and assist the locals, taking charge of their efforts, and bringing my own name forward. In such a fashion I will gain my place in the world.
Barbaric?? Hardly! It is a well-used and time-honored tradition. It is as much a part of politics as... as... rebellion...
I suppose that is not a good example, but it is not that unnatural a thing to happen! And it is not as if I would be a bad ruler. I, Xanos, would be the greatest ruler! Hahahah!
Indeed, for it is the beginning only. Soon all will see the virtue in Xanos' rule, and others will come flocking to my banner. It will be only a matter of time before my empire expands.
Then all the world shall know of Xanos. They shall tremble at his wrath, weep for his sadness, and cry out in joy for his happiness!
But that is far in the future from now. In the present, there is still much we can do that should be done. Let us continue on our way, my friend.
Hah! If that day should come, many years from now, I will not forget our friendship and travels together, little <race>. Do not fear, I will try to be gentle with you.
Hah! If you prove yourself competent in our travels together, little <Race>, perhaps you will have a place at my side one day. An advisor to the great king Xanos!
Bah! It is not nonsense! It is a vision of the future! I, Xanos, have been blessed with this sight... with this knowledge, and I will see it through until the end!
I do not like the tone in your voice... You disapprove, I think. My methods are a well-used and time-honored tradition. They are as much a part of politics as... as... rebellion...
Of course! It is a well-used and time-honored tradition. It is as much a part of politics as... as... rebellion...
Hah! Indeed! I know this as well as you. We still have time together, you and I, and I am thinking that our greatest challenges may yet lie ahead.
Bah! You do not know charisma if it stares you in the face... as it is doing right now! But I still have much to do before those days come. Our journeys will not end so quickly I am thinking now.
Hah! I did say that we would talk eventually, didn't I? Very well. What is it you wish to know?
Hahah! You are always in good humor, <FirstName>. I doubt that our paths will cross much after we have finished our task.
No, when I have finished my training, I shall go far from here... Far away to virgin, untouched lands and minds, who will then cower and fall before Xanos!
I know, I know. You disapprove. It is not so uncommon as that. Master Drogan too, thinks that I have the potential to cause much harm, but that is not my intent.
But none of you seem to understand that what I do, I do for the good of others as much as myself. The lands of the Realms need the firm hand of government to guide them.
The broken, lawless lands that cover too much of the earth would benefit much from Xanos' rule.
You mean like the Thayans? The Zhentarim? Fools, all of them... They have not learned enough from history.
"Nothing makes a prince so much esteemed as to carry on great enterprises and to give rare examples of himself."
To be a great leader, to create a lasting kingdom, one must not only be able to conquer or subject his people, one must also be able to win their hearts.
It is through the esteem of one's subjects that one has true power over them.
Hah! A simplistic method, and one that always fails in time. No one who treats all as enemies has ever held power for long.
It is not in the best interest of a ruler to lie to his subjects. Lies are always revealed in the end, to the detriment of those who have harmed others by them.
No, a great ruler, as I will be, must divide the world into two camps: those who are against me, and those who are subject to me.

"A prince is also esteemed when he is a true friend and a true enemy." A true friend to my people, and a true enemy to those who stand against. I shall treat my subjects as if my own children, and my enemies as mortal ones.

It is through such kind acts as these that the subjects will grow to love what I give them, and my enemies fear what may occur if they resist. This breeds a fanatical devotion to the ruler in his subjects, enhancing his power.
Hah! But I see that my philosophy is, perhaps, a bit beyond you. Do not fear, it is understandable.
Bah! A genius like Xanos also learns from the masters of the past. I give only truths gleaned from the work of others!
You seek to insult me with it?! Bah! Let us go, then, and do something more meaningful than your chiding.
Hah! Time will tell what future Xanos will hold. And I know that it is a great one!
Come, let us leave, my friend, and continue with our task.
Why question the wind, the rain, or the ground underneath your feet? It is the fundamentals, my friend. It is the desire that drives me.
My life? What is my life... It is nothing without a purpose!
To exist... to sit around all day doing nothing? Being 'nice'? Serving others?? That is no way for one such as Xanos to live!
No, for me, the only place to be is the top. A place above reproach where none can stand beside me!
Hah! Those with the will to gain power shall see it come in their lifetime. Such destiny is mine, of course.
But you think me to become an evil dictator? A tyrant? You compare me to the Thayans, perhaps?
No, this is not the way for Xanos. Xanos is no monster. Xanos is smarter than that.
Hah! You think me weak-minded? You think me simple? Power drives me, yes, but it does not consume me.
This thing... this thing which drives me, it is power. But power is fleeting, as we have already seen in our journey.
Xanos will not stand by as what I worked all my life to achieve is stripped from me. Not again!
Hah! Spoken truly as one who does not understand... and fears because of it.
I will not have my life taken from me by ignorance. Not in me, nor in my subjects.
History, my friend, teaches us many things. It teaches us the lessons that others have learned at their expense. A good ruler, as I shall be, learns from the mistakes of those who have failed.
But what mistakes have they made? What have I learned?
Hah! Xanos will not be so easily drawn into your little trap! I will not sell my knowledge so cheaply as that!
Let us journey on further, and then, perhaps, I will let you have a better glimpse at the genius of Xanos!
Hah! You overestimate yourself, little <Race>! Xanos has a destiny, forged in his past, which will not be denied!
My life is nothing without purpose, and that purpose is power! No other kind of life can be bared.
Hahah! I forgot about that... You had asked, hadn't you?
I guess I got a little carried away and never got around to telling you.
I have only myself to rely upon. Not you, not Drogan... especially not Dorna... I have become capable in and of myself to achieve my goals.
Yes, yes. I avoid, I know. Fine. I will tell you now.
When I was younger I did not have the... self-control I have now. I was a brash young lad, full of himself and his abilities.
You would not understand the follies of youth then? Are you perfect as master Drogan seems to think?
Bah! I act as I do now because I am capable of it. I know what I can and cannot do, now. I was more... foolish then.
I had placed too much importance on the acceptance of others... on their goodwill. I was a stupid, stupid youth.
Bah! I can be as critical of myself as you can. I push myself always so that I do not repeat the mistakes of the past.
I am not some simple-minded half-orc to not realize these things. I can and will stand on my own!
Hah! You seek to insult me? You think that Xanos would not notice your jokes at his expense?
I am not some stupid half-orc for you to play mind-games with! I can and will stand on my own!
Ever since the simple-minded bigots of my home drove me out, fearing my strength and my sorcery, I have vowed that I will cow to no one! Submit to no one!
I am Xanos, and my will shall not be denied!
Bah! You are as heartless as always. I do not know why I let myself tell you these things, knowing you will only mock me in response.
They cast me out and I wandered the wilderness for months... never knowing where my next meal would come from, or even if I would survive the night.
Until at last I found my way here to Hilltop... and master Drogan.
He alone accepted me for what I am, and let me harness the powers I was wielding. Powers I have now forged into the true might of Xanos!
Heh. In time, in time. All shall feel the power of Xanos, and all will bow before me!
But not right now. We have things to do, you understand, so let us be doing them.
Yes. Yes, I believe we shall.
Bah! Talking to you is as if speaking to a brick wall! Let us stop this nonsense and continue with our journey.
Bah! We have been over this story before, you and I. Why would you wish to hear it again?
Not interesting?! The greatest story ever told?! It is a story you will tell to your children!
Someday, far in the future, you will look back on the days you have known me and rejoice that you were close to someone who was so destined for greatness!
It is my destiny to achieve greatness. None will deny the will of Xanos!
I know you may doubt me. You... Mischa... Drogan... Dorna... All do not believe that this destiny will be mine... but I will show them!
I will work as hard as it takes, do whatever it may take, to achieve this goal.
Fear not, little <Race>, I am in full control of myself.
But I shall not be denied on my path to power. If anything in my life has shown this, it is that my will cannot be denied!
Bah! You are too impatient, <FirstName>. In time you will see the truth of what I say... You may even agree with it.
Rest assured that greatness is what I seek. The path of power and the voice within. It is my destiny.
And that is all we shall speak of for now... We have more pressing concerns.
My life of hardship and regret... the times I have... Bah! Xanos is not weak like the others. Though I may not speak of it, I have my own troubles. These are none of your concern.
The only thing that shall change the past and make the future great. It is my call to power.
But it drives me onward... If anything in my life has shown this, it is that my will cannot be denied!
Hah! You sound like Xanos! We shall be good company for one another!
But I shall not be denied on my path to power... by you or anyone. If anything in my life has shown this, it is that my will cannot be denied!
Hah! Fear not, little <Race> <man/woman>, I know my own limits.
Bah! Unlikely. You have always been too focused on your studies by far. But... I will humor you this once.
Bah! Very well. I shall tell you once more if you wish.
Bah! Then I will remain here until you come to your senses.
Hah! Then we shall face our perils together!
That... that is something I never wish to repeat again... Being entombed in stone is no way to exist.
Hah! Well I know this. But I also think we shall see more of her... and we must not repeat our folly.
Facing a medusa... and now one in possession of the mythallar will not be easy. Even harder now that this lizard thinks we are his slaves, if what I hear is correct.
Hah! I don't doubt that. We shall both take her down... we must obey the lizard for now...
There seems little else we can do, except what this lizard wants... but in time...
In time we shall free ourselves. Perhaps with the strength of the mythallar, I could... hmm...
But no, that is not our concern, is it? For now we must try to find this Heurodis. I know she is here somewhere... ehhh... where is this, again, exactly?
What? Then why did you free me? You need Xanos!
Yes, yes, yes. You are beginning to sound like Drogan.
Bah! Fine! But you shall come back to Xanos soon enough. You will see.
Indeed. I think we could aid each other greatly.
What? Me? Never! Do not be silly.
It doesn't seem to matter what we wish to believe, it is what *he* believes that is what matters...
Hmph. You have need of Xanos' skill in this place or you would not have freed me. I truly doubt you would have saved me out of pure sentimentality, eh?
Alright. It sounds like a good plan to Xanos, so long as you follow your own advice, eh?
And neither will I. But I also think we shall see more of her... and we must not repeat our folly.
Bah! What is good about it? The dangers of this place are evident... Perhaps we should help each other to stay alive.
Well then, we shall see how well you do without Xanos to aid you.
Of course... I thought of it! Let us go together, then.
And you think *I* should accompany you? You think that *I* want to retrieve these artifacts for master Drogan?
Xanos would not be so callous as to reject a call for help, once given. If you wish my aid, I shall be here to ask.
Very well, then. Xanos shall accompany you in this task. Drogan will likely reward us well when we succeed.
This was not funny the first time you said it. Xanos is not impressed.
I do not wish to be mocked!
Oh, ho ho. I see. Now it is all a big joke, eh? Xanos must suffer the blunt end of your juvenile wit.
Xanos will feel sorry for <FirstName>, shortly.
Do you wish to hear what I have to say or not, imbecile?!
Very well. Then Xanos shall hold his own counsel.
This place... it holds great power.
Hah! It is not that I criticize your ferret-like instincts, but rather that I, too, am eager to find the source of this power.
There was great magic worked here at one time... magic whose origins I do not recognize. It is ancient indeed, though.
If I am correct... If my intuition tells me true...
Well it is most definitely not the work of the gnolls...
Yes, yes, I have already said that. You do not need to mindlessly repeat every word I say.
It is not elven. Not dwarven. Almost... human? We are near the Nether mountains... If it is that old, then, perhaps...

Oh but I am. I think this may be the work of the ancient Netherese. If that is true, then what we may find here could have power beyond our wildest dreams... or enough power to reduce us all to dust in an instant.
Yes... Netherese. If that is true, then what we may find here could have power beyond our wildest dreams... or enough power to reduce us all to dust in an instant.
Netherese? If that is true, then what we may find here could have power beyond our wildest dreams... or enough power to reduce us all to dust in an instant.
We should be wary here, I know, but the potential power... it is limitless.
What is this mistress that spoke to J'Nah? This situation is getting more complex by the moment.
A feud between a dragon and a sorceress... and a secret master powerful enough to use both to further his, or maybe her, concerns.
I worry that what we may have stepped into may soon outstrip us both.
Indeed we do, <FirstName>, but I worry about the dangers... The danger to Xanos.
Hah! Xanos will not be leaving one such as you to be our only hope! That would be no hope at all. But there are dangers...
Hah! It is not your health I care about, <Race>! It is Xanos' health that may suffer!
It would not do to have a glorious life such as mine cut short in its prime.
But we would seem to have little choice in the matter. Let us continue then, and bring the retrieved artifacts back to master Drogan.
Hah! Xanos can handle anything! But...
Do you not find it disturbing that a dragon, such as this Tymofarrar, seeks the artifacts that were entrusted to master Drogan?
Perhaps the artifacts hold a much greater import than we were led to believe...
Indeed... It is as you say...
The enemies we face must go beyond the simple kobolds we have encountered already.
That was not my original meaning, but... the powers they may hold would surely help Xanos in his quest...
Bah! That is not what I was talking about! I was only suggesting that perhaps the enemies we face go beyond the simple kobolds we have encountered already.
First kobolds, then a dragon; who knows what other powers may be lurking behind the scenes and are arrayed against us?
But he cannot. We are left to our own devices for now, and we must take all due caution as we continue.
We must not allow Xanos' glorious life to be snuffed out so meaninglessly.
Indeed. We are left to our own devices for now, and we must take all due caution as we continue.
Indeed. But we are left to our own devices for now, and we should take all due caution as we continue.
This... this place has a feeling of life about it... and of death.
Hah! Xanos does not fear the kobolds that fled here! But... there may be other things... older things...
I will speak candidly with you now, <FirstName>. Xanos does not scare easily, but I question the wisdom of disturbing a tomb such as this.
There is no love between my ancestors and the elves, but I rise above that. I do not discriminate as they do. But these places were not meant to be disturbed.
I only think that, maybe, if we continue, something may awaken that was not meant to. We should not disturb the bones of the dead.
Bah! I sound like a coward to you now, but my words stand true. I do not wish to die in a place like this.
Bah! Talking to you is like talking to a brick wall, sometimes! Very well, I will follow your lead, <FirstName>, but I have voiced my concerns.
Hah! If I could believe that, I might have some respect for your abilities, but I know well your limitations, <FirstName>.
If you choose to go on, I shall remain with you. Xanos will protect you! Hah!
Xanos will not die, of course. I was more concerned for your safety, is all.
The kobolds have not left this town peacefully... I will have my revenge for what they have done here!
Bah! Selfish to the end, you are. But Xanos at least admits to his failings, as few as they might be. Though both you and Drogan liked to point mine out for me.
Yes... Drogan. It seems we all owe a lot to master Drogan. I can hardly count the number of scars he left on my body. Still, the crotchety old dwarf had some redeeming features.
When I first came to this town, I was shunned by the people because of my heritage... my orcish half was all they could see... except Drogan.
What? Here?? The people here are country folk and woodsmen... They have a harsh acceptance of the realities around them, and are very cynical of the good intentions of others.
But I suppose I do not hold it against them any longer... In the years I have been here they have grown on me, I guess.
Indeed. We must find those kobolds... and retrieve the artifacts they have stolen.
Bah! You are as inflexible as always.
The hallmark of those destined for greatness is flexibility. Like me for example.
But we should delay no longer. We must pursue those kobolds and retrieve the artifacts they have stolen.
Yes... Yes, I will. And we should not waste more time here talking. Action calls.
Bah! You are too cynical by far! You think only of yourself! You are almost as bad as the townsfolk were when I had first arrived.
Bah! I knew I could not expect understanding from you. *You* have always had it easy... being Drogan's pet student. Some of us actually had to work for ourselves.
I am not bitter! Not anymore at least... I do not hold it against them any longer. They have grown on me, I guess.

Even silly Mischa could tell Drogan favored you, and I would not call her observant. She worships Drogan as much as these townsfolk do. That respect is their one redeeming feature. It almost makes me like them.
Then show it! You act so tough and independent, but Xanos acts this way too. Perhaps if you can find some maturity, then we can speak as equals and avoid some of the verbal abuse.
The townsfolk do not even mistreat me anymore. I could almost like them now.
The kobolds would have to have come through the village, I think... Though they hold no challenge for Xanos, the villagers may have fared poorly.
Hah! It is as I thought it would be: At the first sign of hardship, you turn and run back to Drogan's skirt!
The kobolds have only just left. If we pursue now, we may yet have a chance to catch them before they leave the town.
But we must have a plan to find and capture them. I, Xanos, shall take the lead, of course.
Hah! I know, I know. You think me overconfident, but I shall be gracious.
I know that master Drogan favors you above the rest of us. You are his oldest student, after all. Therefore I shall treat you as an equal in this endeavor.
We shall find and defeat the kobolds together, in our own way. But be wary... They may have expected us to follow them.
Let us go. We must not let them get too far ahead of us.
I agree. That is a surprisingly good insight for you, <FirstName>; one worthy of Xanos himself.
Quick action is decisive, but rash ones are the sign of a small intellect.
This is it, I think... We shall meet Heurodis again very soon... and there must not be things left unsaid between us, as there was between master Drogan and myself.
Bah! That is always the way with you. Always like this, in the end.
But you and master Drogan... you have changed me from the way I once was. You have made a new man of me.
Once this Heurodis has been dealt with, perhaps we shall see what the future will hold in store for us.
Perhaps... perhaps not. I am not at all certain that we will survive this, but... I must speak my piece now.
In spite of all that has been between us, both good and bad, I... I count you as a true friend <FirstName>. I mean that.
You may not agree, you may not feel it is appropriate, but that is the way things stand.
You are my friend, and as such, I will stand by you in the final battle, even though it may cost me my life.
Indeed... well, still I shall be there. Let us go now, and meet our fate, then.
Let us go now, and meet our fate, then.
You and master Drogan... you have changed me from the way I once was. You have made a new man of me.
These three Winds must be the key to the mythallar and Heurodis... If we hope to defeat her, we must find them, then.
I can only hope that all of them have survived the millennia trapped inside this ruin...
Yes... I know... But we need to find all three first.
They're supposed to be scattered around, with each one in a different place. But surely they would not have left them unguarded...
I think it's likely they put each one in its own fortress of sorts... something to protect it from casual outsiders and thieves.
Hah! Them? Those thieves. No, I don't think they'd know anything about this city. They're just common thieves and slavers.
Indeed. We will likely have to face whatever guardians the ancient Netherese put in place... plus whatever Heurodis has done to reinforce them.
I do not know...
Perhaps as this city is divided into sections, maybe they placed the Winds in those as well...
We must search them at any rate, but we must stay on our guard. We cannot allow Heurodis or whatever lurks here to stop us in our task.
Hah! Don't let overconfidence blind you to the truth! We need those Winds.
This place seems to be shaking itself apart! It is only a matter of time before all this collapses around us.
Heurodis might be trying to reactivate this city... to make it fly again... but I don't think it would work.
Indeed... and that is why we must make certain to stop her.
She might get the city to fly; she might harness its powers. But when it finally comes crashing down around her, who knows what destruction it will cause...
No, it's vital we stop her... we cannot afford to fail.
Hah! Yes, I had almost forgotten... I suppose that says something about me... about us.
Hah! I had thoughts of that, too, at one point. But the powers here, old though they are, are too strong for any of us to wield.
But... a thought occurs: we may not be able to harness the city, but surely some of the items within it must hold incredible magical power.
Any that we could take with us... Just think of it! The power!
Yes. Let's go quickly.
Hah! Not if I find it first! Let us hurry, then.
Perhaps... Let us hurry in any case.
Yes. Speed and time are of the essence.
It is too old... I can sense the magic failing in the enchantments... The decay...
Drogan... he is dead now. I am having... difficulty with this.
Bah! Xanos is not weak! Xanos is strong! Stronger than you it would seem...
It is not weakness to admit your feelings... You can draw much strength from it.
Drogan... As much as I hate to say it, he was like family to me.
Xanos never relied on anyone save Xanos... until he came along. He was a mentor to me... almost a father.
He took me in when none would and in the end, he gave his life for me as well...
Bah! Cynicism and mockery are your trademarks, as always. I try to be serious and that is the response you give me...
I do not disagree, but did you hear the things he had to say to Xanos? He was a gruff old dwarf, and I was a troublesome student.
I thought... I believed that he saw something more in Xanos, but the words never came from his mouth before. Why... why did those words have to come only when he was dying?
Why could Xanos never let go of his pride and confide in his mentor. So many things I should have said... now it is too late.
Curse your miserable heart, <FirstName>. If it were not for the example set by Master Drogan I would destroy you here and now for your foul words.
Indeed. There is much that needs to be finished. We will not let his sacrifice be in vain.
Drogan gave everything to stop Heurodis from gaining the mythallar and using it for her foul purposes. We must not fail in this.
When we find Heurodis... I will tear her heart from her chest!
The power of this crystal, this... mythallar. Are you sure that you can handle it? Should not Xanos keep it safe?
Bah! You laugh at Xanos! I do not know why I put up with you sometimes.
Bah! You mock Xanos and seek to belittle him? I do not know why I put up with you sometimes. Who leads whom here? You should ask yourself this sometime.
Perhaps... perhaps not. I suppose we have little choice.
The power that Garrick has said is within this crystal, though... It is awesome. If this master of J'Nah's could lay hands on it...
Hah! You are awfully confident for someone who has had such troubles so far.
Indeed, it is only because of Xanos that you have come as far as you have! Hah!
But... it may be better if you keep the mythallar in your care... so long as you recognize what it is you carry.
I suppose it is better that you keep it in your care... so long as you recognize what it is you carry.
Indeed we cannot. I suppose it is better then, that you keep it in your care... so long as you recognize what it is you carry.
That one crystal, if used improperly, could destroy us all... and the rocks and sand for miles around. It is dangerous... yet therein lies its allure.
If you could just let me hold it and try to... no! I... I do not think I should be trusted to handle it... It is, perhaps, too tempting.
Keep it... Keep the crystal... Keep it safe and we shall see what utility it may prove to be later.
Xanos wishes to make a complaint. This desert is a hellish and inhospitable place! Our traveling accomodations are dreadful and the food since we left Hilltop has been nothing short of dreadful!
So you are in the same position as Xanos. Neither of us asked to be here, and yet here we are!
Nothing, obviously. You are in no better a position than Xanos. Neither of us was given a choice as to whether or not we wished to come here!
Was Xanos given a choice? Were you? I did not ask to be sent into the desert to risk my life, as I recall.
Bah! I believe that I am entitled to some "whining", as you put it. Xanos did not ask to be here!
No sooner was one dangerous task completed, then we were ordered to rush headlong into another! And for what?! To identify this little crystal?!
And yet here we both are, performing Drogan's little task like dutiful children. We risk our lives for nothing!
I would rather we not have left Hilltop at all! What relevance does this task have to our lives, eh?
Obviously it is not important enough a task for Drogan to take it on, himself, is it? No, it is for us to risk our lives for nothing!
So what if we have this crystal identified? Then what? We should be looking for the culprit behind that J'Nah woman and taking the battle to her!
Or better yet, give all the artifacts back to the Harpers and tell them to think of a better place to hide them. If we do not have what this woman wants, she need not bother with us!
What does it matter? This is Harper business, not ours! By carrying this crystal, we put ourselves in danger!
Of course Xanos makes sense! Why are we even involved in this madness?! This is Harper business, not ours! By carrying this crystal, we put ourselves in danger!
Yes, and that is what Xanos finds so very irritating. Moreso than having my britches full of sand, even. I do not know why I put up with it.
Hmmm. Perhaps you are right. Still, Xanos would prefer to choose when he risks his hide, regardless of the possible rewards. Unless they are very, very big rewards. Hmmm.
Do not be ridiculous! Xanos laughs in the face of danger! Ha ha ha!
What?! Where?! Kill it! Kill it quickly, I... oh, I see. You are joking with Xanos. How very droll you can be, <FirstName>, ha ha.
Yes, and notice how greatly he is helping us in return, eh? Our rings no longer protect us, and yet he gives us nothing to replace them.
Tell me seriously, however... why did you come? Xanos may have little choice but to follow you about, but you could have refused if anyone could have.
Too late, eh? Xanos is beginning to think that you enjoy all of this more than you say. Perhaps you are right to do so... or perhaps you are crazy.
You believe so? Perhaps you are right. Perhaps Xanos thinks too much of his comfort and not the power this little crystal could bring. You make a good point.
I see. Xanos swears... if you begin to run around waving your weapon and crying, "Wheeee!", I shall vomit.
Pfah! One day I hope you will grow a spine, <FirstName>. It is revolting to see you grovel before Drogan as he throws you a bone.
Yes, revenge is good. Whoever is behind this attacked Xanos as much as she attacked the dwarf, eh? That is true.
Bah. Xanos will come along, then, and do as he must. But he will still complain! Never shall he relent!
Yes, it is very good, is it not? What a pair we shall make!
And why not? It is better than listening to other people speak. Try long enough and others become a distant buzzing, in fact.
Eh? What was that?
Now you sound like Xanos's mother. I am beginning to feel very nostalgic.
Xanos shall mouth his complaints in your direction, then. And use hand gestures, of course.
But enough with our dawdling. If we are to find treasure and power, we will not do so standing about. Lead on, <FirstName>.
Very well. I will come.
I shall stay then. Leave if you will.
<StartHighlight>Xanos is currently unconscious and will likely die if he is not given aid very soon.</Start>
This is not a good time to speak.
No, stay here.
Fine, come with me.
No, stay here.
Yeah, you can come with me.
No, never mind.
Yes, come with me.
Never mind.
I think we need to part ways.
Alright, fine. Stay with me, then.
Wait here until I return.
Leave me. Now.
I'd like you to level up.
I want to change your tactics.
I don't want to change anything else right now.
I want to move faster and not bother with stealth or searching.
I need you to be stealthy right now.
Don't help me if I fail to open a locked door or chest.
Help me if I fail to open a locked door or chest.
I want to change the distance you stay away from me.
Stay a long distance away from me.
Keep a medium distance.
Stay close.
Go ahead and attack as soon as you see enemies.
Defend me and don't attack until I do.
I want to adjust your equipment.
Can you identify my equipment?
I want you to use your Barbarian Rage.
I need you to cast a spell.
Never mind.
No, that's it.
Ultravision.
True Seeing.
Summon Creature IX.
Summon Creature VIII.
Summon Creature VII.
Summon Creature VI.
Summon Creature V.
Summon Creature IV.
Summon Creature III.
Summon Creature II.
Summon Creature I.
Stoneskin.
Shield.
Shadow Shield.
See Invisibility.
Resistance.
Resist Elements.
Remove Curse.
Remove Blindness/Deafness.
Protection From Spells.
Protection From Elements.
Premonition.
Owl's Wisdom.
Mind Blank.
Mass Haste.
Mage Armor.
Light.
Lesser Mind Blank
Knock.
Invisibility Sphere.
Invisibility
Improved Invisibility.
Haste.
Greater Stoneskin.
Ghostly Visage.
Fox's Cunning
Find Traps.
Ethereal Visage.
Energy Buffer.
No, I've changed my mind.
Yes, go ahead.
Endure Elements.
Endurance.
Eagle's Splendour.
Create Undead.
Continual Flame.
Clarity.
Cat's Grace.
Bull's Strength.
I've changed my mind.
Cast it on my animal companion.
Cast it on my familiar.
Cast it on me.
Cast it on yourself.
Animate Dead.
What was it you wanted to say earlier?
Let's stop and talk for a moment.
We're done talking.
How is everything?
I want to discuss your training.
<StartAction>[Xanos will take 1 barbarian level for every 4 sorcerer levels.]</Start> Concentrate on both martial and magical studies.
<StartAction>[No leveling change.]</Start> Keep studying as you are.
<StartAction>[Xanos will level up as sorcerer only.]</Start> Concentrate on magical studies.
<StartAction>[Xanos will level up as barbarian only.]</Start> Concentrate on your martial studies.
Where is your ring? The one Drogan gave us?
And where do you keep it?
I wasn't trying to take it from you...
Have you thought about your future more since we last talked?
Don't get all sentimental on me.
Yeah, tell me about it...
What do you mean?
Reality always tends to kick in eventually.
Remember your future, Xanos. Don't give up on it!
I don't think whining about it will do you any good.
What has changed?
I don't want to hear this.
I think you're making excuses. Shape up!
Better to stop before you fail.
Why?
You will?
It didn't affect me.
Affected you?
So what can be done?
Why are you telling me this?
You're getting weak, Xanos.
So tell me of the kingdom 'Gentle King Xanos' will rule.
